author: {'steamid': '76561198075234627', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1712161848}
review:
Not sure what this game is supposed to be. It seems like a point and click game, and I got stuck on the very first scene having to use a walkthrough. Objects blend in but apparently you can press spacebar to show objects you can interact with. The game tells you this, after you get past the scene where I could not see what I should interact with.

Next up was a  part where you have to drag the mouse in a certain way to proceed. This was broken on the native Linux version so I had to switch to Proton to get past the very first sequence. After that there was another type of timed event where you need to pick between different options before time runs out. Pick "wrong" and you get to restart from the checkpoint.

Obviously being rather... let's call it "unhappy" only minutes into this, I shall not play any further. Perhaps a case of "not for me".

author: {'steamid': '76561199073417334', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1696957212}
review:
This game is a true unique fantasy story. Even though the ending that I got was really sad, I loved the game.


The Good
The art for the game is really good.

The game told a unique story. At the end of the game you have a choice for what ending youâ€™d get. After you get it and the game brings you back to the menu, you can just load up your last save and see the other ending which is cool. The problem that I have with the other ending, is that it leaves me with more questions. The other ending is sad too though, if you've seen the sad ending.

I liked the music.

It was a fairly easy game.

I thought that the voice acting was good. I thought the Renie voice was cute. Like, itâ€™s just nice to actually play a game where the child is voice by an actual child.


The Bad
I hated the controls for the mouse. There was one part at the beginning where you had to balance the dude on something and I wasnâ€™t able to do it. The devs expect you to have a large table/area surface to even do the balancing minigame. It was stupid. I had to then use a controller.

The game can softlock you in many areas. By softlock, I mean getting stuck. The creature blocked me from moving and I couldnâ€™t go back. Luckily, you can reload from your last checkpoint.

You canâ€™t skip the long cutscenes.

The hint icon color is too hard to see. And not only that, itâ€™s small.


Conclusion
The game was great because of its art and story. It felt like a high production point and click adventure game. And to be honest, I hate point and click puzzle games where you have to find the correct sequence to progress. But I loved the game, itâ€™s true.

author: {'steamid': '76561199483594082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1711066858}
review:
The story is nice, but I've played more satisfying adventures before (and my gaming career isn't really long!).

+
- Spot (oooh, so sweet! <3)
- interesting story 
- easy puzzles and lots of story (remember, I like that!)

- 
- unsatisfying (depressing) endings!
- very unsatisfying game controls (trying to look at things can be a pain in the ass with a normal controller)
- mostly unappealing characters (and you don't even know why)
- long loading times (especially frustrating in combination with the difficult game controls that lead to too much wasted waiting-time)

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 1895, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1895, 'last_played': 1709339383}
review:
"Silence" ist ein klassisches gezeichnetes Point-and-Click Adventure aus dem Hause Daedalic.

Wir sind zurÃ¼ck in Silence, der Phantasie-Welt, die wir schon in "The Whispered World" kennengelernt haben. Diesmal sind wir aber nicht der depressive Clown Sadwick, sondern wir steuern (meistens) die Geschwister Noah und Renie oder auch die magische Raupe Spot, die sich zu einem Ball aufblÃ¤hen oder papierdÃ¼nn platt machen kann. 

Es herrscht Krieg in der realen Welt. Nach einem Luftangriff finden sich der 16-jÃ¤hrige Noah und seine kleine Schwester Schwester Renie in der Phantasiewelt Silence wieder. Auch wenn Silence bezaubernd mystisch schÃ¶n scheint, ist es doch die Welt zwischen Leben und Tod. 

Das Gameplay ist klassische mausbasierte Adventure-Mechanik. Wir kÃ¶nnen Dinge anschauen, aufnehmen, benutzen und mit Leuten sprechen, indem wir dann aus zwei verschiedenen GesprÃ¤chsoptionen auswÃ¤hlen. Im Gegensatz zum VorgÃ¤nger haben wir hier aber kein interaktives Inventar. Hin und wieder nimmt zwar ein Charakter einen Gegenstand an sich, setzt diesen aber dann automatisch an der richtigen Stelle ein. 

Das, und die zahlreichen Cut-Scenes fÃ¼hren dazu, daÃŸ sich das Spiel oft mehr wie eine interaktive Geschichte anfÃ¼hlt denn wie ein klassisches Point-and-Click-Adventure. Oftmals sind wir mehr Zuschauer oder werden gespielt. Die streng lineare Geschichte bietet kaum Freiraum fÃ¼r eigene LÃ¶sungsansÃ¤tze.  

Die vorhandenen RÃ¤tsel sind grÃ¶ÃŸtenteils zwar logisch aufgebaut, allerdings in der Regel sehr einfach. Lediglich die Tatsache, daÃŸ manche LÃ¶sungwege doch recht abwegig erscheinen, fÃ¼hrt dazu, daÃŸ man ein wenig gefordert wird.  

Eine Besonderheit ist unser kleiner Begleiter Spot, ein kleines raupenartiges GeschÃ¶pf, daÃŸ verschiedene ZustÃ¤nde annehmen kann und uns so bei den RÃ¤tseln helfen kann. Eine nette, aber dann doch selten kreativ genutzte Spielidee.

Grafisch ist das Adventure aus dem Hause Daedalic mit seinen zahlreichen Screens schÃ¶n, liebevoll und durchaus detailreich gezeichnet. Besonders die Farbwahl ist gekonnt und atmosphÃ¤risch. Die Animationen sind recht flÃ¼ssig und tragen zur Lebendigkeit bei. 

Das grÃ¶ÃŸte Problem ist allerdings die Story zwar liebevoll erzÃ¤hlt ist, aber doch inkonsistent und merkwÃ¼rdig schrÃ¤g ist. Die einzelnen Situationen innerhalb einer Szene funktionieren fÃ¼r sich meist gut und die jeweilige Situation ist auch plastisch. Allerdings knarrt es arg bei der Verbindung der einzelnen SchauplÃ¤tze. Vieles wirkt aufgesetzt, Charaktere scheinen inkonsistent und die ErzÃ¤hlstruktur wirkt holprig. Dadurch wird einem die an sich poetische Welt verleidet und die Charaktere verweigern durch die Bank die Rolle einer Identifikationsfigur. 

Schon "The Whispered World" konnte nur bedingt Ã¼berzeugen und stellte sich immer wieder selbst ein Bein. Dieser Titel wirkt fast noch ungelenker. Dabei steckt viel spÃ¼rbares Talent in den einzelnen Bestandteilen. An einem talentierten GeschichtenerzÃ¤hler, der alles zu verbinden weiÃŸ, scheint es aber offenkundig gemangelt zu haben. 

Dennoch bleibt das Game im GroÃŸen und Ganzen charmant und liebevoll und trotz aller nerviger und alberner SchwÃ¤chen ein irgendwie nettes Spielerlebnis. Nur hÃ¤tte man von Daedalic eigentlich mehr erwartet. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
5/10 Story
8/10 Grafik
7/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
5/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Wo sind nur die wirklich guten Geschichten-ErzÃ¤hler.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

review:
This game is a true unique fantasy story. Even though the ending that I got was really sad, I loved the game.


The Good
The art for the game is really good. 

The game told a unique story. At the end of the game you have a choice for what ending youâ€™d get. After you get it and the game brings you back to the menu, you can just load up your last save and see the other ending which is cool. The problem that I have with the other ending, is that it leaves me with more questions. The other ending is sad too though, if you've seen the sad ending.

I liked the music.

It was a fairly easy game.

I thought that the voice acting was good. I thought the Renie voice was cute. Like, itâ€™s just nice to actually play a game where the child is voice by an actual child.


The Bad
I hated the controls for the mouse. There was one part at the beginning where you had to balance the dude on something and I wasnâ€™t able to do it. The devs expect you to have a large table/area surface to even do the balancing minigame. It was stupid. I had to then use a controller.

The game can softlock you in many areas. By softlock, I mean getting stuck. The creature blocked me from moving and I couldnâ€™t go back. Luckily, you can reload from your last checkpoint.

You canâ€™t skip the long cutscenes.

The hint icon color is too hard to see. And not only that, itâ€™s small.


Conclusion
The game was great because of its art and story. It felt like a high production point and click adventure game. And to be honest, I hate point and click puzzle games where you have to find the correct sequence to progress. But I loved the game, itâ€™s true.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979731618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1705870140}
review: Love the game, lovely graphics, irreverent and heartwarming. The writing is a bit...off sometimes, but still understandable. The loading times are a bit of a bear. Sometimes you have to go back and forth between areas and the loading times takes longer than walking from one side of the area to the other. Still would recommend, just know that you'll have to be patient about constant loading times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084438509', 'num_games_owned': 173, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 570, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 570, 'last_played': 1703861003}
review:
Silence is a stunning game, it's nice to be able to play it through without any google'ing at all.. (I often need to in these games)

BUT it is short. has to many rude characters, bad language and the feeling of a story that's been cut down to size. The previous game I remember as amazingly inventive and has a long story.

Still IF you can get this at a really good discount it is worth a play through.

review:
Silence ist die gelungene Fortsetzung des Daedalic-Hits â€The Whispered Worldâ€œ
Neben spannenden neuen Figuren gibt es in â€Silenceâ€œ auch ein Wiedersehen mit alten Bekannten

SILENCE legt als Adventure vor allem wert auf die audiovisuelle ErzÃ¤hlung der Geschichte. Es gehÃ¶rt mit zu den schÃ¶nsten Adventures, die ich bisher Ã¼berhaupt gespielt habe. Die Grafik ist stellenweise einfach wunderschÃ¶n. Die Musik und die deutsche Synchronisation sind ebenfalls wieder fabelhaft gelungen wie man es ja von Daedalic gewohnt ist.

review: O jogo tem um estilo grÃ¡fico incrÃ­vel, uma historia envolvente e um tanto diferenciada. Roda em computadores mais fracos e para quem gosta de modo historia Ã© uma excelente recomendaÃ§Ã£o.

author: {'steamid': '76561198400799873', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1706911356}
review:
If you didn't play Whispered World, play that first. Not because it is necessary, but that is worth your time. 
Here there are no choices, no puzzles, just a linear story where you have to click one or two obvious actions.

You should play this game if you have enough time and want to watch an interactive animation movie with a flat story.. It could have been good, but seems half-ready.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018946343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1703867551}

author: {'steamid': '76561198122847648', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1702589531}
review:
Tem uma resenha em trÃªs partes pela frente, mas em um geral: Sim, Ã© um jogo bom e eu recomendo.

Em jogabilidade, Ã© divertido. Cheio de pequenos puzzles mas sem a oportunidade de ter mais de uma soluÃ§Ã£o - o negÃ³cio Ã© encontrar a forma que deve ser feito e seguir em frente. Parecemos ter mais opÃ§Ãµes com as formas que o Spot toma, mas no final apenas uma versÃ£o vai servir pra cada puzzle. E tudo bem, porque o foco parece ser mais a histÃ³ria do que o jogo em si.

A histÃ³ria Ã© bonita. Somos os dois irmÃ£os por tempo o suficiente pra vocÃª se perguntar quem Ã© o verdadeiro protagonista, mas a histÃ³ria vai se encaixando e dÃ¡ pra entender que, por ser sobre quem Ã©, o mundo ao nosso redor Ã© daquele jeito. As coisas encaixam em 99% dos pontos.?

O final. Esse era um jogo que nÃ£o poderia ter sido publicado sem a opÃ§Ã£o de escolha no final. Enriqueceria a histÃ³ria, daria vontade de jogar de jogar de novo (e ir atrÃ¡s das conquistas ainda nÃ£o obtidas) e seria super interessante ver o que aconteceria se a gente simplesmente se entregasse Ã  fantasia. Sem a opÃ§Ã£o, ficamos de meros espectadores na cena final - que, sinceramente, me surpreendeu e MUITO. SÃ³ nÃ£o sei se pra positivo ou negativo. 

NÃ£o me arrependo de ter jogado e soltei umas lacriminhas, umas risadas. Num geral, super bom para o que se propÃµe.

review: After "The Whispered World" I was craving for a continuation of the story. In that way Silence delivers for sure, the mood and setting are mesmerizing. The gameplay is rather limited and sometimes maybe the 2D style of the previous game would have been better than using 3D.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006711202', 'num_games_owned': 209, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1698582493}
review:
I only recommend this game if you want a rather simplified and more story-driven point&click advanture game.

The game is very simplified and easy to progress, which not necessarily bad to be honest and has lot of focus on the storytelling. Howewer I felt this made the game absolutely pointless to be a p&c game.
Another angle is the story. This meant to be as a sequel for the Whispered World, but I felt absolutely forced to have any connection to that game. It tells a similiar story, but unlike the Wishpered World, it lacks the charm and world building. It uses some character(and the gorgeous main theme) from the Whispered World as an excuse to be a sequel.

[Spoiler Part!]
.
.
.
.
It has a fine ending, but at the same time, the story and couple of characters you get to know through the story just doesn't matter at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198267390855', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1698145319}
review: A really fun Point"n"Click game with a strong and emotional story. Knocked it out of the park with beautiful artwork and soundtrack. Puzzles are easy enough and make sense, The characters have depth and you'll probably love them all. Summing up, an amazing experience! skippable cutscenes and dialogues would have been nice but if you are only planning on playing it once it shouldn't be much of an issue. 100% worth a try considering it goes on sale for peanuts.

review:
Das Spiel ist insgesamt einfach nur zuckersÃ¼ÃŸ. Von der Musik, den Charakteren und der schÃ¶nen Grafik stimmt wirklich alles. Es macht auch einfach nur SpaÃŸ und alles wurde liebevoll programmiert.  Lediglich die Story hat mich doch etwas gewundert. Offensichtlich spielt der 2. Teil im 2. Weltkrieg, wÃ¤hrend der 1. Teil unsere Gegenwart darstellt. AuÃŸerdem frage ich mich woher die Schwester plÃ¶tzlich herkommt. Wahrscheinlich hÃ¤tte es ein 3. Teil gegeben der das alles aufklÃ¤rt. Leider lief das Speil wohl nicht so gut, was sehr schade ist.
Meine Theorie:
Es handelt sich hier um den Vater, oder Opa aus dem 1. Teil und die Geschichte von Sadwick des traurigen Clowns  wird seit Generationen an die Familie weiter gegeben. 
Dieser Clown steht dann Sinnbildlich fÃ¼r einen Begleiter, oder Freund mit deren Hilfe man alle Schwierigkeiten verarbeiten und Ã¼berstehen kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022514722', 'num_games_owned': 1080, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1696175976}
review:
Es war eine knappe Entscheidung.
Ich wÃ¼rde dem Spiel die 5/10 geben.

Vorab: ich wusste nicht, dass das hier der zweite Teil ist.
WÃ¤hrend dem Spielen hat es aber eben sich gezeigt, dass mir die Vorgeschichte fehlt.

Das Spiel selbst ist ganz nett. Die Grafik ist nett gemacht.
Ich mochte alle Figuren bis auf den Noah/Sederick(?).
WeiÃŸ nicht warum, er war mir total unsymphatisch.

Das Gameplay ist recht easy, Point and Click eben.

Warum nur 5/10?
Ich fand die Ladezeiten einfach zu schlecht fÃ¼r ein Point&Clickt Spiel.
Vor allem, da die Levels ja eigentlich recht klein sind.
Ich habe eine M2.SSD und musste trotzdem 15+ Sekunden warten.
Klar, das hÃ¶rt sich nicht nach viel an, aber es gibt Abschnitte im Spiel,
da muss man immer wieder zwischen den Bereichen wechseln, um eine
Aufgabe zu erledigen ... das ist halt echt nervig.

Die RÃ¤tsel waren auch sonst zu abgespaced (das mit den "Schlangen" und den Sprossen).
Aber das ist wohl eher Geschmackssache.

Was ich richtig scheiÃŸe fand war das Ende.
Ich habe beide Enden probiert und mir hat keins gefallen.
Zu traurig, zu deprimierend.

[spoiler]Ich hatte gehofft, dass wenn ma Noah nur lange genug schÃ¼ttelt, dass er dann aufwacht. Das wÃ¤re richtig cool gewesen. Aber sonst fand ich es scheiÃŸe, dass immer einer von beiden starb.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198046909876', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1695581359}
review:
This is a wonderful sequel to The Whispered World. 
The music and graphics are both improvements over the first. The story felt surprisingly short compared to the Whispered World, however. 
I would have liked a bit more time to get to know some of the characters. Kyra, Janus, and Samuel seem like they're initially set up to be a bit more recurring than they end up being in the end. 
The puzzles have very logical solutions; a major plus in a point in click (nothing is worse than a point and click feeling like you just need to keep randomly combining items to find the answer).
The only pieces I didn't enjoy were the long load times between transitions, the fact that you can't skip cut scenes you've already seen, and [spoiler]trying to catch a lumi in the marketplace[/spoiler].

author: {'steamid': '76561198113805058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1694733204}
review:
Very beautiful game. The artwork is really splendid. The story is ok, the ending was not exactly to my liking but it did fit the story right.
It isn't the most difficult game, as most things are relatively straight forward (didn't use a walkthrough at all).

I bought it in a bundle or on sale a long time ago, so it was for me well below 5 euro's, and I think for that price it was a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199093123840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1658469734}
review: I hate posting bad reviews, but I'm someone who has to play games until the end, and it's been such a struggle to get through this one. The graphics are so pretty, it's like a gorgeous artsy storybook, but that's about it for me. The gameplay is so tedious. Sure, there are puzzles and I had to think a bit in some of them but I don't know, it just felt so childish to me and though the graphics give that impression, the summary doesn't. I really wanted this to be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993416727', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1694980703}
review: Silence is a dark-ish P&C indiegame from Daedalic in the vein of "let's visit a fantasy world b/c our town is being bombed." The animation, art, & voice acting are great! The story & puzzles (while fairly linear) are entertaining. Worth checking out if it's in your backlog and you like point-and-clicks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280159326', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 362, 'last_played': 1694926300}
review:
Loves the art style. The ending is amazing. Well worth the play.

There's some lag between each save screen and sometimes spot needs to be lined up exactly in the right spot to make his action work which can be frustrating but once you're used to it then it's not to difficult to figure out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450345569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 317, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1693679011}
review:
i review games on steam after i 100% complete them! check out my reviews to see all the games i have completed!

silence is a 2016 point-&-click adventure game that was both developed and published by daedalic entertaniment, a german publisher and now former developer which was founded in 2007 who were known for developing (at the time) p&c games. silence acts as the sequel to the 2009 game whispered world, that got a definitive edition release in 2014. it's your standard p&c adventure, with a standard interface, although a few things that stand out to me are the beautiful visuals and really good gameplay with high interactivity, with the characters specifically looking great. the gameplay mechanics and puzzles are a little simplistic but intuitive enough to not make the game frustrating at any points throughout the completion process. i would absolutely recommend grabbing this but only on sale. it's on sale pretty frequently for 90% off, making it only $1.99 for what is a good, but not great P&C adventure.

review: They make some of the best point and click games , You can even play with gamepad witch you have to so try , You would think it would not work and just be a nightmare however it works so well giving a whole new feel to the game. I love how you can walk around and everything is so perfectly mapped out making it more fun. I was not sure about it at first after how great the first game was , but it grows on you fast as the game world and story open up.

review:
Zauberhafte Geschichte, auch unabhÃ¤ngig vom VorgÃ¤nger spielbar, aber als Fortsetzung erklÃ¤rt sich natÃ¼rlich einiges eher. 
Das ich nicht immer die Orte wieder wechseln kann, z.B. um  alle MÃ¶glichkeiten auszuprobieren, erst wenn ich es auch mÃ¶chte Orte fÃ¼r immer verlasse gefÃ¤llt mir nicht so gut, auch die schwierige Steuerung mit dem Touchpad nervt.
Das Ende stimmt mich in beiden Versionen traurig, das hÃ¤tte ich mir anders gewÃ¼nscht. Vor allem die zweite (mÃ¶chte nicht spoilern, daher so vage) bietet ein offenes Ende, das schreit nach einer Fortsetzung (in der dann bitte-bitte alles gut wird). 
Trotz den Kritikpunkten wÃ¤re ich auf jeden Fall wieder dabei!

author: {'steamid': '76561198018061433', 'num_games_owned': 1510, 'num_reviews': 1588, 'playtime_forever': 323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 323, 'last_played': 1691708351}
review:
Ein Point & Click Game mit einer interessanten Geschichte, tollen Charakteren und einer schÃ¶nen Welt

- Die Aufgaben haben genau den richtigen Schwierigkeitsgrad
- Ebenfalls die Spielzeit reicht vollkommen. Wenn man alle Errungenschaften erreichen mÃ¶chte, muss ein zweiter Durchgang gespielt werden, wodurch noch mehr Stunden dazu kommen
- Zwei Enden gibt es, die man mit neu laden auch bequem sehen kann
- schÃ¶ner Soundtrack

Ich habe den ersten Teil nie gespielt, somit keine Vergleiche gemacht. FÃ¼r mich war hier alles stimmig.

review:
Ok, this is the most sad game I ever played in my whole life - don't get me wrong, I loved every second of it, but now I am devastated. 

I strongly recommend this game, the aesthetic is beautiful, the story is great, the characters are captivating. The game is old but memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016427788', 'num_games_owned': 805, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1687554018}
review:
So ein toll gemachtes Spiel. 
Man versetzt sich einfach da rein. 
Den Anfang fange ich recht traurig also den Vorspann. 
Die ganze Geschichte ist aber sehr Interessant und Spannend.
Die RÃ¤tsel sind auch gut zu lÃ¶sen, zwar gibt es hin und wieder das ein oder andere etwas kniffelige RÃ¤tsel aber selbst das lÃ¤sst sich ganz gut lÃ¶sen mit ein bisschen nachdenken. Notfalls gibt es ja die Leertaste als zusÃ¤tzliche Hilfestellung. :)
Kann es mehr als weiter empfehlen.
Mal nach langem ein Spiel welches mich so gepackt hat das ich es am liebsten direkt auf einmal durchgespielt hÃ¤tte.

Als Tipp: Man kann beide Enden sehen! Einfach den letzten Spielstand laden wenn man durchgespielt hat und sich dann anders entscheiden am ende. :)

Pour cela, vous pourrez compter sur vos nouveaux alliÃ©s ainsi que Spot, une sorte de monstre domestiquÃ© capable de faire beaucoup de choses (gonfler comme un ballon ou s'aplatir comme une crÃªpe par exemple).
Le tout est saupoudrÃ© d'une relation frÃ¨re/sÅ“ur assez attachante.
L'histoire est donc originale mais son dynamisme est ralenti par le gameplay malheureusement propre au point&click.

Gameplay : 
C'est donc du Point&click. Et comme tout jeu du genre, vous devrez rÃ©soudre beaucoup d'Ã©nigmes et de puzzles, au point d'Ãªtre constamment ralentis dans l'histoire, ce qui vraiment dommage car Ã§a coupe l'immersion. 
Avec votre souris vous pourrez donc dÃ©placer vos personnages, les faire interagir avec des objets ou d'autres personnages etc... Rien de compliquÃ© dans le gameplay, seul votre intelligence et votre logique pourra vous poser problÃ¨me pour certains puzzles.

Graphismes :
Les textures sont bonnes mais ce n'est pas une claque visuelle. L'immersion graphique est lÃ  et fait largement le job. Les cinÃ©matiques sont trÃ¨s bien animÃ©es et les personnages trÃ¨s bien dessinÃ©s. Cependant, l'action reste saccadÃ©e par le gameplay Ã  cause du point & click.

DurÃ©e de vie: 20h pour faire le jeu + les succÃ©s. 10h juste pour l'histoire.

DifficultÃ© : Votre logique et intelligence mais plutot facile dans l'ensemble.

Prix: Moins de 5 euros en soldes. A prendre en soldes surtout car Ã  ce prix la le jeu vaut le coup.

Silence est un bon jeu Point&Click, il raconte une histoire sympa mais ne rÃ©volutionne pas le genre et ne casse pas des briques on va dire. Je recommande pour ceux qui aiment le genre en sachant que c'est un jeu que l'on fait une fois par curiositÃ©, car perso je n'y retoucherai plus :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018579571', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1686599124}
review: Five Word Review: Pretty, short, and enjoyable adventure. Beautiful graphics, charming story, frustration-free gameplay. In Silence, the game gives you plenty of environmental clues, textual clues, as well as pointing out which objects in the environment are interactable. I'm sure the point & click purists will complain about 'dumbing it down', but there's a reason that kind of gameplay is not popular anymore. Overall, highly enjoyable few hours!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047444685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1682981207}
review:
Un juego precioso, como todos los de Daedalic. Mucho mimo y con bastante interÃ©s para llegar hasta el desenlace.
Lastima que Ã©ste fuera escaso y algo corto el juego en general, hubiera preferido que contaran mas, incluyendo sobre los secundarios, porque llega un momento que no se vuelve a saber de ellos.
El punto mas flojo del juego es su jugabilidad, es casi nula, no hay inventario, pocos puzzles, un avance solo complicado (y bien creado) por el uso de la mascota.

review:
Ce jeu est sorti en 2016, sÃ©rieusement ? J'ai l'impression qu'il date du dÃ©but des annÃ©es 2000 :/
Les temps de chargement sont infernaux (et Ã§a ne vient pas de mon ordi, je viens de finir Life is Strange 2 qui fait 40 Go et j'attendais moins longtemps que Ã§a...) et les animations extrÃªmement lentes. En parlant de Go, pourquoi ce jeu pÃ¨se-t-il aussi lourd alors qu'il est finissable en 3 heures et que les graphismes n'ont rien de bien fabuleux ? Il va falloir qu'on m'Ã©claire, lÃ  ^^'

Je n'en suis qu'Ã  2 heures de jeu pour le moment mais je me tÃ¢te vraiment Ã  arrÃªter, je dÃ©teste ce gameplay, je le trouve vraiment Ã  ch*er et le personnage de Kyra est insupportable (je dÃ©teste les enfants et c'est un littÃ©ralement un condensÃ© de tout ce qui est chiant chez un gosse xD)

Edit : j'ai fini le jeu. Il n'est vraiment pas fou mais j'ai trouvÃ© les graphismes lÃ©gÃ¨rement mieux sur la fin. En gros, les plans fixes sont cool mais les persos en eux-mÃªmes ne sont vraiment pas beaux. Une histoire importante se cache derriÃ¨re tout Ã§a mais Ã§a n'est pas captivant au point de conseiller ce jeu donc je reste sur mon premier avis.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118676399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1682861462}
review:
Okay, ich hab geweint... Storyline wieder sehr schÃ¶n und herzzerreiÃŸend mit vielen Anekdoten aus Whispered World. Hatte Silence erst ohne den ersten Teil gespielt (nur das erste Kapitel), jetzt aber vorher den ersten Teil gespielt. Fand ich so rum wesentlich besser fÃ¼r das VerstÃ¤ndnis der Charaktere und Storyline. Silence ist viel angenehmer zu spielen als der erste Teil - da wurde einiges am Gameplay verbessert, wobei ein wenig schwerere LogikrÃ¤tsel mir gefehlt haben. Allerdings ist der Hauptcharakter ein kleines Kind, daher ergibt es nicht wirklich Sinn, schwierigere RÃ¤tsel einzubauen.

Ansonsten kann ich den Mitkommentatoren zustimmen, dass die Story um die Nebencharaktere nicht gut aufgelÃ¶st wurde. Mich hatte das aber nicht besonders gestÃ¶rt, da die ganze Welt ja eine Traumwelt ist und es ja im GroÃŸen und Ganzen nur um den Hauptcharakter geht. 

Alles in allem mal wieder ein super Storygetriebenes Daedalic-Game im klassischen Welt-Untergangs-Szenario.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072447875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1682713866}
review:
Silence is a title that is clearly designed with a certain audience in mind, myself not belonging to that. There are some potentially interesting motifs that run underneath the surface here that ultimately remain unexplored. The ravages of human actions (specifically war) on the innocent, the defenceless, faultless children; the rapidity of their maturity; the acceptance that reality must inevitably be faced; and such tales and analogies can be a useful tool that must ultimately be left behind. All are such considerations that remain unchallenged. Indeed, the finest part of the game is when no words are spoken, but instead the player can consider such matters.

What instead is presented is more one-dimensional and simplistic. From the characters to the puzzles, all embody these traits. The runtime simply isn't sufficient to properly provide emotional attachment to what is occurring on screen. The proper audio and visual cues are present, but a rushed and undeserving crescendo feels rather awkward. Which is a shame, because considerable effort was placed into the audiovisual experience, being of a consistent and praiseworthy quality.
As such, it is perhaps more fair to consider this title as a first foray into the point and click genre. These qualities, however, it succeeds in. As was previously mentioned, it is visually appealing, contains additional tools to aid the completion of puzzles already simple, has engaging or appealing if simple and boring characters; and to top it all off - an annoyingly cute mascot blob that serves as the solution to far too many puzzles.

Overall, it is somewhat difficult to recommend to the majority because of its short length relative to its base cost. Avid fans of the genre will quite bluntly find the experience tepid and dull. But for a reduced fee, those remaining that are willing to admit their inexperience, ignorance, and perhaps even their ability to be easily pleased, there is something pretty here for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561199105197380', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 419, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1683538305}
review:
A game where you can make a little girl get high from licking a giant mushroom, then make her lick everything in the search for something bitter including a giant skull and literal tar.

Renie is very cute and frankly my favourite character, but she does say some questionable things for instance when talking to Samuel:
[hr][/hr]
[b]Samuel:[/b] [i]You can't just go around eating everything, it cold be poisonous.[/i]

[b]Renie:[/b] [i]That's what Noah says - you want some?[/i]

[b]Samuel:[/b] [i]Well...[/i]

[b]Renie:[/b] [i]Open up[/i]

[b]Samuel:[/b] [i]*Forgets what he just said about poison and catches the berry she throws to him in his mouth*[/i]
[hr][/hr]
wait... what? Renie, can you just run me by what you just did right there? 
Renie is probably a lvl 100 assassin.

A game where you revive an annoying girl named Kyra by doing chest compression, facial slapping and mouth to mouth before you look over at Spot, the squishy caterpillar thing and realise you could have gotten him to revive her. So you get off her, wipe your mouth - die inside for what you just did and tell your caterpillar thing to revive her. At least you can punch her in the face. That was the only part of the reviving process I enjoyed. Unfortunately, there is no option to let her die. I'm just trying to take care of my sister and leave this place, you just started ordering me around. I don't know you.

When I first met Kyra, she started being annoying and knew I wouldn't like her, so when she told me to hold onto a bomb while she prepared it, I made sure to just let go in the hope that it would explode and kill her. It didn't.

Also

One of the concept art examples of Spot shown in the Bonus menu of the game looks like the blob at the end of I Have No Mouth And I Must Scream. It's good to know the blob man escaped AM and somehow got to know Noah.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014119124', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1679017675}
review:
Was enjoying this quite a bit at first. 

Then the controls became completely unresponsive during a puzzle, causing me to fail it 4 times in a row. It was a timed puzzle, pretty early into the game, and I'd already solved similar ones prior to that. So I knew what I  was supposed to do.  The game just wouldn't register my inputs for this one. Literally nothing I pressed or moved did anything.

It' frustrating because it makes an otherwise fun game (up to that point) impossible to continue.  It's effectively soft-locked. 

I would assume the game was tested, so I don't know how this got through.

In any case, I cant recommend a game I can't play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198866866950', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1669582328}
review:
A true hidden gem. Visually stunning, with a really good soundtrack and dubbing, it tells a nice story with endearing characters. The first cinematic hits pretty hard, but from there on there are also a lot a sweet and funny moments.
I also can confirm it is not necessary to have played the first game to enjoy that one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088213112', 'num_games_owned': 1213, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1678383671}
review: Interesting, vibrant world, but the story is cheesy and the characters annyoing. "I'm Kyra, the leader of the rebels!" - yeah, I suppose you are. The only thing that keeps you from falling asleep in that dreamwold is the cringe. Ciao.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011606722', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 854, 'last_played': 1678014753}
review:
Ein wundervolles, emotionales Storygame â™¥
Ich habe das Spiel gleich zwei Mal durchgespielt, um mÃ¶glichst viel von der Story mitzubekommen :)

Hier mal aufgelistet die Punkte, die ich besonders toll fand, aber auch was mir "negativ" aufgefallen ist:
+ tolle, emotionale Story, die man auch mehrfach durchspielen kann
+ zwei alternative Enden
+ viele Dialoge die man entdecken kann
+ wunderschÃ¶ne Gestaltung (sieht aus wie gezeichnet, das Licht ist total schÃ¶n gesetzt und stimmig)
+ schÃ¶ne Musik, die das Setting sehr gut unterstreicht
+ liebevolle Charaktere
+ lustige Dialoge (der Gesang der Steine hat mich gekillt :D)
+ RÃ¤tsel mit einer guten Herausforderung (ich bin definitiv kein RÃ¤tsel-Profi und saÃŸ an manchen Stellen etwas lÃ¤nger) â†’ die RÃ¤tsel an sich sind alle logisch, wenn man weiÃŸ wie es geht :D

- das Spiel hat mich zum weinen gebracht
- leider hat sich das Spiel zwei Mal bei mir aufgehÃ¤ngt, es lieÃŸ sich nichts mehr drÃ¼cken, ich kam nicht vor oder zurÃ¼ck und musste die Sequenz erneut machen
- keine manuelle Speicherung mÃ¶glich!

Ich empfehle das Spiel Jedem, der ein entspanntes Point and click adventure mit einer schÃ¶nen Story sucht :)
Hier werden auf jeden Fall einige Stunden Unterhaltung geboten :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199113397117', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1678129331}
review:
Engaging storyline: The game features an engaging storyline that follows the journey of two siblings, Noah and Renie, as they navigate the mysterious world of Silence. The game's story is well-crafted and full of emotional moments that keep players invested in the characters and their journey.

Beautiful graphics: The game features stunning hand-drawn graphics that bring the world of Silence to life. The attention to detail in the art and animation is impressive and adds to the overall immersive experience of the game.

Challenging puzzles: The game features a variety of challenging puzzles that require players to think creatively and outside the box. The puzzles are well-integrated into the storyline and provide a sense of accomplishment when solved.

Atmospheric soundtrack: The game features an atmospheric soundtrack that complements the visuals and enhances the overall experience of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070639253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1677787316}
review: Really enjoyed this, though I wish it had save points so we can go back and review options (without having to play the whole game again from the start).

author: {'steamid': '76561198022517753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1677744334}
review:
That was... I totally forgot this was a sequel, the intro music should have clued me in.

Extremely pretty, the art and design blew me away; it has great animation and decent characters  (the main character is adorable) with a simple, but solid, story, I am kicking myself that I left it sitting in my backlog for so long

The fact that I played the game before this recently made me see the references and.... oh soo good!

Go play The Whispered World if you haven't already!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994345983', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 485, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1677613448}
review: Turns out itâ€™s a sequel to a game called The Whispered World. Story is a little bland but the Jim Henson like characters are endearing enough to carry it. Plenty of hint options. Cosy soundtrack and hand drawn visuals. If the balancing bar doesnâ€™t work turn the v-sync off. No, seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052108232', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 378, 'last_played': 1675629869}
review: I really REALLY REALLY dont like point and click games. However the look/descriptions of play etc. drew me to this one. Artwork to me was superb - which I guess Is the trade off having it be point and click. All in all to me it was a superb game in this genre. Yes I had to basically get a walkthrough guide and follow it. I tried not to, but you have to point click, go there do that, then the same thing that you had pointed clicked that didnt do anything magically says something different ARRRG that gives me headaches. Anyhoo if you like point and click definitely recommend. If you dont - get one of the guides and then I recommend it  - its worth the journey.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034359551', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1675192524}
review: Im Vergleich zum VorgÃ¤nger "The whispering world" sind die RÃ¤tsel deutlich weniger komplex. DafÃ¼r wurde mehr Fokus auf das Storytelling gelegt. Das macht das Spiel insgesamt etwas kÃ¼rzer, dafÃ¼r aber auch das Spielerlebnis intensiver. So ist es etwas zugÃ¤nglicher fÃ¼r Neueinsteiger. Die Geschichte fesselt aber auch alte Hasen. Absolute Empfehlung von mir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141483232', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 257, 'playtime_forever': 827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1655789838}
review: Fun point and click game with beautiful art! Nice throwback to the Whispered World though this Spot is definitely cuter! I enjoyed the story, but there are some buggy achievements. Still I recommend the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198306942316', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 231, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1675056224}
review: This is a sequel to the whispered world, and while I thoroughly enjoyed it back in 2017, it took me quite a long time to come back to it and get all of the achievements. I loved the stories, even if some of the puzzles were a little tricky to me. If you enjoy point and click adventures with a good story, this is a great one to pick up while on sale- Daedalic games are a true treasure. The only con for this game is that some of the achievements are bugged and its definitely not going to be fixed anytime soon, so be prepared to look up a fix on how to obtain them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031018398', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 839, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 838, 'last_played': 1676244123}
review:
[b]TLDR[/b] Although it tries to bring some innovations to traditional adventures, poor implementation and lack quality of life features make it a shore to play. [7/20â­, 12hğŸ…, 2/5ğŸ’¡]

[b]Context[/b] Silence is a sequel of [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/macwh/recommended/268540/]The Whispered World[/url], taking place in the eponymous dream world (assumed right from the start this time) as the prequel after characters' village is bombed . Although there are some improvements in writing, and the game does look beautiful, the implementation is so poor that it resulted in one of the most frustrating gaming experiences Iâ€™ve had.

[b]Writing[/b] While the dialogs are better written than in the prequel, the plot is still as tacky as in the prequel, and the world and the characters like any depth. There is no consistency in the narrative, and scenes feel disconnected. I know itâ€™s all just a dream, but that can't be an excuse for poor storytelling. [spoiler]Just think how irrelevant the role of Janus is.[/spoiler] And the framing story doesnâ€™t really add anything, itâ€™s just there for the cheap feelings.

[b]Aesthetics[/b] The game does look great. Unfortunately, for some technical reason that I could not solve, on my machine cutscenes often became unbearably blurry. The voice acting and the soundtrack are decent.

[b]Gameplay[/b] This is where it all comes crumbling down. Although it resembles a traditional point-and-click adventure, Silence implements very simple actions, some of which require some mouse movements and quick reactions. There are not complex puzzles nor inventory management, everything is pretty straightforward. While this is not a bad thing by itself, the implementation is so clunky that itâ€™s easy to fail the movements (forget casual play with a trackpad). You can die, but youâ€™ll just respawn in a previous checkpoint (apart from losing an achievement). There are no deadends.

But the worst is really the lack of quality of life features. You cannot manually save the game, it just auto-saves in the current progress slot at checkpoints. So whenever you leave the game - or want to backtrack some decision - you have to restart from the last checkpoint. Unfortunately, most checkpoints start with unskippable cutscenes and dialogs. This is already annoying by itself, but if you add a set of achievements that require you to explore every little interaction throughout the game, it becomes a nightmare. I ended up manually managing back up save files just to avoid going through the game a 3rd time, and still had to live through some cutscenes more times than is healthy. 

[b]Value[/b] My first run took me 5h to complete, while getting all the achievements pushed my playtime to about 13h, which required an additional full playthrough and a lot of save file management. Like all Daedalic games, it seems to be more often on sale than not. You cannot revisit previous chapters, but there are multiple progress slots. There are multiple endings, but depending only on a last minute decision. Some achievements are just plain ridiculous, like completing the game without skipping any dialog line, which can be ruined by any occasional misclick. If not carefully planned, achievements may requires multiple playthroughs, most of the times without adding anything relevant to experience.

[quote][i]For more puzzle-game reviews and curated lists check out the [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/43326007-The-Clueless-Adventurer-Puzzle-Trove/]Puzzle Trove[/url].[/i][/quote]

ğŸ“š[b]Pilastro â… : La Narrazione[/b]ğŸ“š[6,5]
Ha l'aria di essere un sequel senza idee valide per arricchire la serie, poichÃ© la storia Ã¨ corta e scimmiotta fin troppo quella del capitolo precedente e inoltre i personaggi secondari son dimenticabili e non aggiungono nulla alla storia; nonostante tutto i protagonisti sono convincenti e la storia risulta godibile, anche merito della breve durata.

ğŸ®[b]Pilastro â…¡:Il Gameplay[/b]ğŸ®[7] 
Incomprensibile la scelta degli sviluppatori di eliminare l'opzione del salvataggio manuale come Ã¨ presente in ogni gioco di questo genere.
Parlando proprio del gameplay Ã¨ palese la poca cura in esso e si nota nella banalitÃ  degli enigmi e ostacoli che ci troveremo ad affrontare; nota di merito a Spot che come nel precedente capitolo Ã¨ un ottimo elemento che arricchisce il gameplay con le sue meccaniche/funzioni originali.

ğŸŒ„[b]Pilastro â…¢: Il Fascino[/b]ğŸŒ„[6]
Graficamente siamo su un piano totalmente differente rispetto al capitolo precedente e qui si vede la cura degli sviluppatori nella realizzazione della colonna sonora, aree e sfondi di gioco. Tecnicamente per me Ã¨ bocciato, perchÃ© non tollero assolutamente caricamenti da 10 secondi circa per ogni area, anche le piÃ¹ piccole.

ğŸ’­[b]Pilastro â…£: Le Sensazioni Del Giocatore[/b][ğŸ’­6]
La storia sarebbe stata pure convincente ma ahimÃ¨ gli sviluppatori non hanno voluto osare distaccandosi dal lavoro precedente, creando cosÃ¬ un gioco mediocre che verrÃ  dimenticato  nella miriade di altri giochi mediocri del genere.

review:
This game is adorable and fun. The game play is easy, the puzzles are fun, the story is great just as the actors. HOWEVER, I had to stop playing the game due to all the LOADING SCREENS. As much as I want to give this an amazing review and rating, I cannot.

Developers, please decrease all the loading screens.

review: A game with strong emotional impact at the beginning of it for the current times when a war is going on out there. Would definitely play it again one day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198156701926', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1698708159}
review: Heartbreaking as expected, but worth the pain for sure! Sometimes the dialogue clearly expects you to make certain choices rather than others, and the result is a bit weird/disjointed if you took the other ones, but it's never been game-breaking and now I definitely want to go try the other choices to see if it flows better together and unlock the achievements I missed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198398300230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1672740585}
review: I get that many ppl like this game, and I wanted to like it, too. It has beautiful art style along with a cute story concept and an amazing music, but you can't help it when you encounter a bug that breaks your save and forces you to repeat the game all over again without the ability to skip the long scenes as you are forced to watch them, and you can't even minimize the screen cause it will pause the game completely. I finished it under the stress of the probability of losing my save file at anytime, so sadly I couldn't enjoy the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068169042', 'num_games_owned': 1435, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1672508197}
review: It's a beautiful game with an emphasis on emotional portrayal of the characters. There are Point&click puzzles but there is a lot of talking and it is not possible to skip the video conversation or sequences. It is really nice but only for the first pass through the game. I can probably say that this game is a combination of an interactive movie and point&click. Video sequences are in high quality and I really like them. But not in the second pass. Not sure if 3D is an advantage but it is made in high quality and it was nice to play that way.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015275441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1672063731}
review: Silence is breathtakingly gorgeous. It is a sequel to The Whispered World, but it plays quite differently. Whispered World is 2d and focuses a lot on puzzles. Silence is 3d, and while there are plenty of puzzles, the focus is more on the characters. I can understand some people might not like that, but I thought it was fine. I made it through without needing help with the puzzles, so I guess that means Silence is a bit easier than its predecessor. Silence can stand on its own, but playing Whispered World first will provide a lot of helpful context and understanding. Overall, it is a great story and solid point & click adventure with incredible visuals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122725919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 599, 'last_played': 1670946493}
review: Ho iniziato questo senza sapere fosse il successore di The Whispered World e senza nemmeno conoscerne il genere. Inizialmente ero un po combattuto se continuarlo o disinstallarlo, per fortuna ho deciso di continuarlo ed addirittura ho acquistato il predecessore. Che dire, un gioco con enigmi alla portata di tutti che si evolve in un mondo immaginario molto colorato e ben curato nei dettagli. La trama Ã¨ davvero molto carina ma avrei aggiunto un ulteriore finale che avrebbe fatto felici i tanti romantici come me. Consigliatissimo

author: {'steamid': '76561197981478843', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 979, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 800, 'last_played': 1670267708}
review:
No, just no...

The game looks beautiful. Art is fantastic and together with a music the only thing I liked about the game.

The story is boring and not well written, voice acting is below average, dialogues bring nothing to game's plot, puzzles are pretty much non-existant, characters are forgivable and bland, no manual saves and checkpoints loads with UNSKIPPABLE cutscenes, and loading screens are very long and frequent.

Overall boring experience. I'm wondering who is the target audience. I have a feeling this was a game made for for 8 year olds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050919086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 664, 'last_played': 1670181003}
review:
This is an okay point-and-click.
The puzzles vary from dead easy to abjectly obtuse.
The characters are revoltingly saccharin cute, making it very much a children's game but the graphics are excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961734538', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1670131895}
review:
Silence is... alright. It's a sequel to the classic Daedalic point-and-click The Whispered World, but this one is less of a traditional point-and-click experience. It plays more like those modern cinematic narrative adventure games where you don't have an inventory and occasionally have to complete quick time events or use precision mouse movements to achieve a goal. That's fine, I like those kinds of games too, but it's not quite as relaxing and comforting as a traditional point-and-click.

Each screen has a very long load time, which doesn't matter too much because the vast majority of puzzling is "escape room" style - you rarely need to switch locations, and when you do it's fairly obvious why. There are few interactive objects, and those that are interactive are almost always related to a puzzle, so it doesn't feel complex. The fairly thin puzzling could be made up for if the story was really compelling, but it isn't. Silence touches on similar themes to the first game, but because the first game's big reveal is already known from the start of this game, it makes the stakes feel less high than they should. Oh, and the save system sucks because it doesn't exist. There are only checkpoints, which is very annoying when the animations are also unskippable.

I mean, it's fine. The music is great. The graphics are pretty. The world is one of those wonderful modern European fairy tales. It's fun enough. But it isn't really best-in-class for either point-and-click or narrative adventure genres. Worth a playthough for fans, but probably not so interesting for people who aren't diehard adventure gamers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036297204', 'num_games_owned': 1295, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1659304129}
review:
[i]Silence[/i] is a sequel to [i]The Whispered World[/i], so it's very much advisable to play the first game before the second one as lot of [i]The Whispered World's[/i] events and characters will get mentioned or even will make their appearance. But the true feeling of nostalgia will kick in once you hear the iconic main music track from the first game and see the beautiful background visuals. And of course, once you hatch Spot. <3

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2841692669

[i]Silence[/i] is an adventure game where you get to play as three different characters - Noah, his little sister Renie (she is a real sweetheart) and Spot. Both Noah's and Renie's characters are greatly written and especially Noah undertakes a serious development through the story. As the game is focused on the storytelling and on heavy emotions the gameplay is sadly rather shallow. You have no inventory and the items you find get used mostly on the same screen. There are few (very few) traditional logical puzzles, attention is mostly focused on interaction with the surroundings. I got stuck once, but it was mostly of a bad game design as I wanted to perform an action, but before that I had to perform two other actions even though they were completely unnecessary for the result.

The highlights of the [i]Silence[/i] are great main characters, beautiful soundtrack and gorgeous hand painted graphics. I was a little bit afraid of the 3D characters, but it worked nicely in the end. The story adapts the same theme as the first game, this time without its â€œwow effectâ€, but the idea is still very strong to carry another whole similar storyline. Weakest point are side characters whom we meet right at the beginning. Even though we can select in what way to interact with them and their characters develop somehow it all leads into a big nothingness. Their whole presence in the game is pretty much without any meaning and if they wouldn't be there it would have pretty much the same effect. It's rather sad, because in [i]The Whispered World[/i] all important characters got their conclusion during the credits (it was a touching moment). Not this time though and all we can do is ask why they were even there.

To obtain all of the achievements you have to play it twice at least. Some of them are rather tricky so beware as you can't simply load it up. There is only an auto save, which is pretty much disappointing and sometimes leads to replaying a whole scene again as it saves only in certain moments - once you start doing some scene, you better not leave in the middle of it.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2841692034

I have enjoyed the [i]Silence[/i] even though it in some moments felt like a weaker sibling of [i]The Whispered World[/i]. The nostalgic note plays well with me, I admit that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198835430528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 927, 'last_played': 1669755578}
review:
The visual representation of the game is great, but unfortunately, that is also the best feature the game offers.

The story can be best described as sluggish; the majority of scenes have nothing to do with the main plot and play out as time fillers. The repetitive cutscenes (one of them is played three times in a row), the non-skippable animations, and the shockingly frequent and long loading screens only add to this problem.

The characters can be divided into two groups: the two protagonists (Spot is more a tool than an actor) and the rest who are just part of the set. Both main characters are constantly switching personalities: one minute they are complete buffoons; the next they draw logical conclusions and intelligent decisions.

Unfortunately, this game is a sequel that relies on its predecessor, so I have to assume that most of my story-related questions originate from the lack of knowledge of the first episode.

Another shortcoming of the game is that it fails to establish a consistent mood: it is neither comedic nor dramatic. Instead, it creates a weak mixture of both that accomplishes neither.

Most of the achievements are easy to obtain, but there are a few that require the repetition of scenes or even the whole game. There are broken achievements as well that need a workaround to trigger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132503739', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 548, 'playtime_forever': 585, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 585, 'last_played': 1668970331}
review:
[b]My Playtime:[/b] 9.8h (100% achievement, finished the game twice)
[b]My First Playthrough:[/b] 6.4h
[b]Grindy Achievement(s):[/b] No.
[b]Optional Achievement(s):[/b] Yes (~38 achievements).
[b]Difficult Achievement(s):[/b] No.

[h1]Intro[/h1]
[b]Silence[/b] is a sequel to [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/268540/The_Whispered_World_Special_Edition/]The Whispered World[/url][/b], telling the tale of the main character long after the events in the first game. It reintroduces a lot of the side characters and references to the story morale in the previous title while still trying to give something unique on its own.

[b]Pros:[/b]
- Beautifully-made landscapes and cutscenes
- Adjustable hint button

[b]Cons:[/b]
- Hint doesn't show interactable objects clearly
- No option to skip cutscenes - only dialogues

[b]Specs[/b]
Intel Core i5-9300H 2.40GHz, 8GB RAM, NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1650

[h1]Should you buy this game?[/h1]
[b]Yes.[/b]
[i]If you enjoy modern "point-and-click" games with beautiful scenery, buy this game on sale.[/i]

[hr][/hr]
[h1]In-Depth Review[/h1]

[h3]Visuals[/h3]
If I have to describe it in one word, I would say that it's beautiful. I thought the backgrounds were just still images due to their realistic style and lighting that was more commonly used in 2D, but I was proven wrong once I saw a running water to be animated in one of the backgrounds and rotating scenes. I couldn't help but stop and admire the scenery every time I encountered a new one, and the camera angle is always positioned perfectly whenever it shoots the main character with the background. Sadly, the quality seems to be degraded as you play. The background in the last few areas looks blurry and the lighting was made dimmer to conceal that. The only thing that saves those scenes was the cute-looking characters that are portrayed up close.

[h3]Story[/h3]
If you haven't played [b]The Whispered World[/b], you might want to play it first. The game will give summaries of what happened from the first game, but there are a lot of references and characters that will be reintroduced in this game. Those who haven't played the first game will miss out a lot on that, and if they played the first game after this, they will be spoiled by the ending since it was told at the beginning of this game. That being said, you still can enjoy the story as long as you don't mind about these things.

Despite being presented with several choices throughout the story, most of them don't matter. The only ones that matters are the branching near the end of the game, which only impacts a few scenes right after. To make it worse, there was even a choice that looks different despite giving the same result; I was asked whether to go left or right and the main character will say that he wants to go in one direction regardless of my choice.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1683823450

Although [b]Silence[/b] introduces some new characters at the beginning, they end up being abandoned. It feels like a waste since the game tries to establish some sort of connection with them, only for it to be used as fuel for your decision at the end. Moreover, you still won't know what happened with those characters, or what they were doing in the first place no matter which decision you chose.
 
Unlike the first game, [b]Silence[/b]'s dialogues flow better than the first game. You don't talk to random objects to find the characters spewing random lines; there is one objective that you are geared towards, and the dialogues will switch based on that. Get a new objective? You might want to interact with everything again. Well, there might be some random lines if you interact with the same objects several times, but it's not like it applies to everything like in the first title.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=922679217

As for the ending, the game tries to reinforce the morale that was given at the beginning. You will be given two choices, each having different consequences. It's obvious which is the better choice at a glance, but the main characters' circumstances might make you wonder if it was actually the better choice. However, the conclusion seems to focus more on the despair side, and people might miss some clues that the game wants to tell us unless they notice some little details.

[h3]The Game[/h3]
[b]Gameplay[/b]
[b]Silence[/b] can be said as what a modern point-and-click game looks like, immersing you in a 3D environment with some point-and-click elements - you still need to walk towards some areas and interact with the objects to find a way to proceed. There is no inventory; you can pick up some items, but the said items will be used automatically if you interact with another object. This will force you to interact with everything several times and exhaust the dialogues just to find a way out. The game might be easier because of this, especially with the hint system that tells you what you can do, but it can be exhausting to get through all dialogues this way.

Despite the point-and-click elements, you will mostly spend your time watching cutscenes. Using an object or proceeding to the next area will net you more cutscenes, which is unskippable for the most part. I hated it when I had to spend time waiting for dialogues to finish, and although the game introduces the option to skip dialogues, this option tends to be useless because they don't work for cutscenes.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=806811390

Puzzles are easy. You can solve most of them with trial and error, although some still force you to think. I especially liked the bridge puzzle where you need to move people to the other side and calculate their weight. I wished that they have more puzzles of that caliber.

[b]Length and Difficulty[/b]
I finished the game in 6.4h. I replayed the game again until near the end to get my leftover achievements. There isn't any need to replay the game unless you are an achievement hunter - there is an option to reload the last checkpoint to see both endings. As for the difficulty, the game is easy to beat as long as you don't mind interacting with everything several times. Doing it might bore people out, though.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
[b]Silence[/b] feels like a combination of point-and-click games and Telltale games. It focuses more on the story while still giving you some point-and-click activities. Most of the point-and-click elements might be obscured beneath dialogues, but that makes them easier to point out rather than the nonsensical solutions that the first game has. Despite some of my concerns about the repetitiveness to exhaust all dialogues and a weaker story, the game still has a great quality, and I would like to see something more like this. I won't recommend this game at full price, however.

review:
Silence is a beautiful and emotional adventure game. Although the story can be a bit childish and rather clichÃ©, it manages to catch you thanks to its attractive and charismatic characters (or adorable ones, like Spot and the Lumis) and, above all, due to its outstanding audio-visual section.

It's not a very long or difficult adventure. Ideal for a couple of quiet afternoons (it lasts about 5-6 hours).

* Played on Steam Deck from start to finish, works perfectly.

review:
This is a beautiful sequel of The Whispered World, but, altough the graphic art style is awesome, the puzzles are a bit too easy and the whole story is not as great as in the first game, it receives from me a Bronze medal hands down, but nothing more.

Recommended to newbie adventurers and to everyone else.

My Final Score is

[h1] [b]80%[/b] /100 [/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561199159960137', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1662123902}
review:
Silence Ã¨ il seguito di The Whispered World ed Ã¨ ambientato qualche anno dopo il suo predecessore. Questa volta i protagonisti sono 2: Noah, il co-protagonista di The Whispered World, e la sua sorellina Renie. La storia comincia nel nostro mondo, dilianiato dalla guerra, e prosegue poi su Silence (il mondo in cui Ã¨ ambientato anche il primo episodio), dove Noah dovrÃ  ritrovare la sua sorellina ed insieme poi dovranno riuscire a tornare nel nostro mondo o forse no?. 
La storia Ã¨ molto delicata, con una nota di spensieratezza che riesce a far digerire meglio la malinconia e la crudezza di alcuni momenti. Tutta la storia si sviluppata bene fino ai 3/4 del gioco, e poi subisce una brusca accelerata, come se si avesse fretta di chiuderla. Resta una bella storia,ma alcuni passaggi logici sul perchÃ¨ alcuni personaggi fanno quello che devono fare risultano affrettato e decisamente senza molto senso.

Graficamente si passa dal grafica cartonesca del primo episodio a quella in 2.5D, un mondo di fiabe e mostri talmente bello che mi perdevo a fare screen da usare come wallpaper, stessa cosa si puÃ² dire sui personaggi cartooneschi e adorabili all'invero simile (soprattutto Renie con il suo cappuccio gigante e la sciarpa che ti viene voglia di toccarla e Chad Spot).
Le musiche del gioco ben accompagnano lo svolgimento della storia, alcune sono anche molto rilassanti. Il doppiaggio, purtroppo solo in inglese, ma non Ã¨ un problema visto che per fortuna ci sono almeno i sottotitoli.
Gli enigmi del gioco sono abbastanza semplici, alla fine si tratta soltanto di trovare l'oggetto giusto per risolvere l'indovinello o di parlare con il personaggio che ci puÃ² indirizzare, non ci sono mai oggetti da combinare tra di loro oppure enigmi astrusi che possono bloccare il giocatore. Anche chi Ã¨ novizio delle avventure grafiche non avrÃ  problemi a completare la storia. Si aggiunge un sistema di scelta delle nostre risposte in alcuni punti della campagna, ma Ã¨ poca cosa e non ha influenza sui finali.
Ecco, un elemento che fa storcere il naso Ã¨ la longevitÃ  del gioco, siamo intorno alle 6-7 ore per una prima run, e non ho messo impegno. Sono andato molto chilli con anche l'attivitÃ  di fotografo. Leggendo in giro per Steam, viene scritto che ci vogliono almeno 2 run se si vogliono vedere tutti i finali e prendere tutti gli achievement steam. Cosa in realtÃ  non necessaria, in quanto il titolo ha un sistema di autosalvataggio e per delizia dei completisti salverÃ  poco prima della scelta piÃ¹ importante. Parlando dei finali... quello che si teme puÃ² diventare realtÃ , quello che vuole essere solo una fantasia invece rimane.  Tutti e due i finali lasciano una sensazione di malinconia in bocca, forse va bene cosÃ¬. Ogni tanto Ã¨ giusto cosÃ¬.

author: {'steamid': '76561198215484043', 'num_games_owned': 154, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 845, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1662239363}
review:
[b]The Depressingly Hollow World of Silence[/b]
To my utter chagrin, the story is blander than the one in the first instalment. What are the issues? Most of the events that happen in this game do not move the plot â€“ they are absurdly unnecessary fillers of an already short game. It also did not uplift my mood I constantly had to endure a moronic, petulant child, who, at times, conveniently proposed solutions only an intelligent adult could. 

Issues with consistency are sadly not related solely to this character. [i]Silence[/i] is supposed to be a continuation of [i]The Whispered World[/i], yet the prequel is treated as a cheap prop that allows the writers to throw in an occasional reference. Acceptable, had the entire plot not revolved around the existence of the very same fantasy world â€“ world which now feels completely alien and devoid of continuation. One could argue it makes sense since there is a different person imagining it. I say it is lack of writing ingenuity. The cinematics which, despite obvious efforts, fail to induce a dramatic emotional response, attest to that.

There are more flaws that make for a very frustrating experience: broken achievements; insufferably â€“ and I cannot stress this enough â€“ frequent and sluggish loading screens; or repetitive non-skippable animations.

Such an artistic potentialâ€¦ and such a waste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074258777', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 1521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1521, 'last_played': 1644705629}
review:
Silence 

The game Silence has a beautiful but sad story. It's about Noah and Rennie, brother and sister, who are stuck in the world Silence, a world between life and death. They know exactly what to do to get out, follow them on their journey through the world of the in between.

I absolutely loved this game. The story moved me quite a bit. The art work is stunning and the voices really fit the characters! The game is a point and click puzzle game. It's story based but to progress you need to solve some puzzles. Some are slightly trickier than others but they are relatively easy! The game also has a bit of humor in it still. But since this game is from Daedalic I was also expecting it because their games are always so much fun! 
I instantly fell in love with Spot and Rennie, they are extremely adorable! The character I hated was Sadwick and I just don't understand why Rennie loves him so much. 

The game is relatively short. It took me around 5 hours to complete it the first time. I've had to do 4 playthroughs to get all of the achievements. There are 2 endings so that means 2 playthroughs. I did one to get the remaining achievements and I had to do 1 more because for one achievement in particular that was broken and will only be triggered while playing with a controller. So just a small tip. To get all of the achievements it took me 25 hours but if I knew beforehand that one achievement was broken it would've been less.

Things I disliked about the game or maybe would've liked to see differently are: 
- Some more background stories about the characters. After another playthrough I've noticed a few dialogs that didn't quite make sense to me but they never explain what they mean. 
- Harder puzzles. Some of the puzzles, if not all, are pretty easy and I'm not sure if you can actually call them puzzles. But on the other hand I also understand that this game is more about the story than the actual puzzles so it also makes sense. This really just is a matter of opinion. 
- Working achievements. Or at least, one in particular that would also be triggered while playing with mouse and keyboard. 

Overall I give this game a 7/10 
The story is beautiful and the artwork is stunning. Which is always a big plus for me. The game isn't perfect and it could've been a lot better if there was a bit more to it.

review: I got the game almost for free with an 85% discount. Despite this, I want to praise this game. The original scenario and interesting gameplay, the puzzles are intuitive, sometimes make you smile. If you love puzzle games, then you should definitely play this amazing game. I did it with great pleasure.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972463372', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1658774969}
review:
Steam! We need a neutral rating! This game has so many good things to it but also so many not so great things. 
The world building and art style are beautiful! I could have spent hours and ours in Silence. And even without having played The Whispered World, I could easily get immersed into this game. I think the difficulty of the puzzles is just right but I would have preferred and inventory to got some more options to try things. Without it the items you find will be used within minutes and there is no Puzzling involved. 
Things I did not like where the long loading screens that accrued way to often, the flat side characters and the ending that felt kinda abrupt. After chapter 3 is finished it feels like there is a part missing before the final. 

All in all a good PnC with some flaws but a good 3D debut for Dedalic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058791441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1653216886}
review: The artwork of the world and the character actor for the little girl are the best parts of Silence. The personality of the clown is awful and definitely kept me away from trying the first game. And that's a problem because there are constant throwbacks to that game. Otherwise there is barely anything to this game. There is no depth to the characters and the plot is a mess where main objectives change multiple times. There is no adventure. It is short but not sweet.

author: {'steamid': '76561199202661661', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1656874115}
review:
Was wÃ¼rdest du tun, um deine Familie zu retten? 

Silence ist ein weiteres wunderschÃ¶nes Point & Click aus der Deadalic Schmiede.

Anmerkung vorab, bitte spielt erst "The Wispered World" bevor ihr Silence spielt.

Denn die beiden gehÃ¶ren zusammen und Silence ist die Fortsetzung davon. 

Noah und Renie werden in eine fremde Welt geworfen und mÃ¼ssen zusammen und getrennt den Weg nach Hause finden.

Triff alte Freunde aus "The Whispered World" lÃ¶se neue RÃ¤tsel und lerne neue Freunde kennen.

Auch hier sind die RÃ¤tsel angenehm und mit ein wenig nachdenken auch zu  lÃ¶sen. 

Man durchstreift die welt und findet immer etwas zum schmunzeln und Staunen, aber auch zum Nachdenken.

Wer Point & Click liebt macht hiermit alles richtig! 
Dadurch das ihr variabel Entscheidungen trefft,  kann die Geschichte bei erneutem durchspielen komplett anders ausgehen.


Ein muss fÃ¼r jede Spiele Bibliothek

author: {'steamid': '76561199328059669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1657572168}
review: Ein fantastisches Spiel mit sehr viel Liebe zum Detail. Renie, Sadwick und Spot auf Ihrer Traumreise zu begleiten macht unglaublich viel Freude. Die Grafik ist einzigartig, pittoreske Landschaften mit einem zauberhaften Licht- und Schattenspiel und fantasievollen Figuren. Passend unterlegt mit harmonischer Hintergrundmusik und die Charaktere begleiten den Spieler mit humorvollen Dialogen durch spannende RÃ¤tsel. Dieses Spiel lÃ¤dt nicht nur zum TrÃ¤umen ein, sondern regt auch zum Nachdenken an. Mit Moral, Esprit und ein wenig Geschicklichkeit geleitet man die Geschwister durch ihre Abenteuer. Das macht sÃ¼chtig und ich freue mich schon auf eine Fortsetzung. Absolutes Suchtpotential, weiter so!!!
