author: {'steamid': '76561198110903879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1643269004}
review:
A beautiful game for a cheap price.

Characters are interesting. I heard that there is a prequel to this, i never played it but it doesn't really affect much on the game play as you can still comprehend the story as you progress.

The story is short but very touching. Recommend this to people that are into short story telling, but not for those that are looking for adventures since it is really short and no actions in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040234830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 393, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 393, 'last_played': 1656448787}
review:
I will just repeat what someone else already wrote and I can only agree with this:

"The plot seems so fragmented and sometimes rushed, the characters pale and unimpressive and sometimes their behavior is not understandable at all. You constantly have the feeling that there is more background to the characters in the game, but it's as if this content was simply removed afterwards. Why certain things happen to them, where they actually come from and why they do what they do - you don't find out. And that's where there would have been so much potential. I feel like I've only played half of a game that originally wanted to be so much more. Nothing really fits together, the game stumbles from setting to setting and doesn't even manage to unite them in the storytelling in a comprehensible way. Even the ending seems rushed, quickly cobbled together and not properly thought out."

Graphics are great, stunning art but lack of interaction and game play made this game quite boring. You can't explore and are almost always 'trapped' in one or two screens with puzzles to be solved before you can continue. There is not really an inventory, since you can't use your items randomly on objects. Quite disappointing I must say.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025364608', 'num_games_owned': 394, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1656347314}
review:
The biggest flaw of Silence is the time-wasting.

* Want to interact with something? Walk over to it slowly and click the interact button. The character slowly turns around in place, slowly moves in to position (to the single specific spot they need to stand in), and then slowly turns to face the object, and first THEN will you interact with it. Constantly. Even just to look at something.

* There is a "skip dialogue" button, but it only works in very specific and rare interactions.

* You can't skip cutscenes.

* The only save method is autosaves, which are not frequent enough. You finish watching a lengthy cutscene to make sure that the game is saved. Next time you load the game you realize that it didn't save after the cutscene at all. Did I mention that you can't skip cutscenes?

The other big flaw is that the puzzles are way too simple.
I never enjoyed combining items in the inventory, so I don't miss it in this game. But the outcome is that you have a very limited number of interactions, and most of the time it's very clear what you need to do. Except when it's not, because you need to interact with some things blindly to get a reaction that is impossible to predict..
Regardless, I never felt a sense of accomplishment for completing a puzzle.

The story is merely serviceable, but not interesting enough for me to put up with the lackluster gameplay.

It's pretty though.

It's clear to see why point & click games are mostly a relic of the past, when even veterans like Daedalic are still designing games with the same flaws that we complained about way back in the 90s.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104447098', 'num_games_owned': 148, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1655131837}
review:
I'm at 50-50 with this review, because it starts out great, story starting to flesh out, new charaters getting introduced and slowly getting to know them more, you feel like you're at the halfway mark........aaaaaaaand it's over. Just like that boom, questions unanswered, side characters just disappeared like......just sitting there dumbfounded how abruptly it ended.
Music is beautiful, characters and chemistry is great, Renie and Spot are adorable, story went well until it lasted but.....feels incomplete

[h1]A silent world...[/h1]
[i]A wonderful game and sad at times. 
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2819416786
The war began.Our heroes are a brother (Noah) and a younger sister (Reni).Because of the bombing, our heroes took refuge in a small bunker. Where they were in their little fantasy world, but it didn't last long.The bombs caught up with them there, too..After the bunker collapsed, our heroes enter another world, where the world is ruled by a lying queen. Noah and Renie split up and Noah set off in search of his sister with a cute caterpillar -Drop. The magic drop will help us in many walkthroughs. On the way our heroes will come across various dangers, quests with puzzles, meeting new personalities and creatures. Beautiful graphics / art, interesting plot. 
Of course, I don't see the point in writing everything that happened otherwise it won't be so interesting)..But I will note that there are several endings in the game..
There are quite a few games left that make you immerse yourself in the world of fairy tales. 9/10[/i]

 https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2819417080

review: Suchst Du ein Adventure mit anspruchsvollen RÃ¤tseln? Dann bist Du hier leider falsch. Silence ist eher eine interaktive Geschichte, mit einigen "kleineren" RÃ¤tselpassagen. Die deutsche Syncronisation ist wunderbar, die Figuren sind liebevoll gestaltet und auch sonst merkt man den Entwickler*innen ihre "Leidenschaft" an. Dieses Spiel verbindet Emotionen, Figuren mit Geschichte und lustigen Passagen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084291565', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1653843065}
review: The art and story is amazing! The puzzles are pretty easy-ish, but they use a cool new way of interacting you don't see in other games. Spot was adorable, and the voice acting was great!! That said, it's really slow paced, and they don't let you skip the cut scenes. You end up re-watching the same ones A LOT if you quit before one. That's a special kind of torture... and easy to code in so I don't get why they skipped that ability. If you are OK with moving slow and here for the story, I do recommend it because it's so unique! But if you're a bit twitchy, maybe not for you. I think full price is asking a lot without cut scene skip ability IMHO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359132385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1653707739}
review:
Its hard to say i would recommend this game, im not super far in the game yet so take this with a grain of salt

visually its a beautiful game, the backgrounds are the real star when it comes to the environments and all of the creatures are super creative. The dialogue is super clunky and not written super well, same for the characters. The voice acting is pretty good though. The story seems to be alright but like i said the writing is a but clunky so it makes the story come out the same way. personal thing but I dont like spot. why does he inflate and then turn into a piece of gum. its uncomfy.  I

all in all i dont hate the game but i dont think its worth the price

author: {'steamid': '76561199065312958', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1676237882}

author: {'steamid': '76561197996859750', 'num_games_owned': 821, 'num_reviews': 397, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1652573839}
review: Beautiful adventure! I tend to prefer the 2D hand-drawn adventures like its predecessor, The Whispered World, but I must say I really loved Silence's new visual style, with those beautiful hand-painted backgrounds and those 3D characters with hand-painted style textures. The experience is mostly easy, simple and really accessible, and the duration is on the short side (it took me about 5 hours). The characters are really charming and the story very touching, like in the previous game. Maybe not as great as The Whispered World, but a nice return to its world.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002986817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 295, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 734, 'last_played': 1651966587}
review: It's a pretty good game overall but far from perfect. If you have played Daedalic titles before, then this is another great story from them. It's a good sequel and they really found unique ways to improve their design. The world is beautiful, the story is very engaging and they even found ways to simplify the gameplay. I used a walkthrough much less here then in previous titles. Sadly, my biggest complaint is that I really didn't enjoy the ending and its a tad on the short side. Still, its a great game worthy of another sequel so the characters can have a truly good ending.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960620050', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1651431914}
review:
Ich habe mich vor Silence mit dem VorgÃ¤nger The Whispered World beschÃ¤ftigt und war vom Humor, der Geschichte und der Erfahrung wirklich begeistert. Somit kann man sich vorstellen, dass ich mich auf die Fortsetzung hier gefreut habe.
Nach dem Starten des kleinen Spiels war ich von der PrÃ¤sentation schon mal vÃ¶llig begeistert. Die graphische Umsetzung ist fantastisch. Da dachte ich noch, dass das nur noch besser werden kann.
Allerdings fing Silence mich bereits in den ersten paar Spielminuten an zu nerven. Noah war mir vom Start unsympathisch. Was soll die SchweiÃŸer-/Fliegerbrille und wer hat ihm diese Hose angezogen? Hinzu kamen die stÃ¤ndigen Unterbrechungen im SpielfluÃŸ durch lÃ¤ngere Animationen und Zwischensequenzen. Wirklich flÃ¼ssig spielen war so nicht drin. Ach ja, dann gab es ja noch die Ladebildschirme, die scheinbar mit angezogener Handbremse ausgefÃ¼hrt wurden. Alles in allem gleicht Silence eher einem Animationsfilm mit eingeworfenen, kurzen RÃ¤tseleinlagen. Und wo bitte war der Humor? Dieses Sequel zu Whispered World ist so vÃ¶llig anders. Auch wurden die ganze Welt nicht wirklich erklÃ¤rt. Wo sind die Eltern. Wo kommt Renie her? Warum der Krieg. Wieso flÃ¼chten nur sie beide in den 'Bunker'. War es Ã¼berhaupt ein Bunker? Warum ist Sadwick so ein Miesepeter? Und wieso ist diese Fortsetzung so ganz und gar anders? .... Der einzige Lichtblick ist Spot, dieser scheint sich nicht wirklich verÃ¤ndert zu haben

Ich will nicht sagen, dass Silence ein schlechtes Spiel ist. Das sicherlich nicht, doch mit dem RÃ¼ckblick auf The whispered world ist es eben nicht das was ich erwartet habe. WÃ¼rde ich whispered World noch uneingeschrÃ¤nkt empfehlen, so wÃ¼rde ich hier nicht so einfach eine Empfehlung aussprechen. Es ist so vÃ¶llig anders und an vielen Stellen irgendwie deprimierend.

Wer ein typische Adventure erwartet, sollte die Finger von diesem, ich will mal vorsichtig 'interaktivem Film' sagen, lassen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111334373', 'num_games_owned': 642, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1650908996}
review: This is the best point and click adventure game that I have ever played, and one of the best games that I have ever played. I really don't want to go into too much details, but this game essentially combines a story focused experience, however, with an actually pretty great point and click puzzle adventure experience that was absolutely amazing from the beginning to the end. The puzzles were perfectly balanced, not too easy or too hard, the gameplay was really fun and satisfying, and the characters and especially the setting and world building is just so interesting, beautiful, and unique. It reminds me a lot of classic point and click adventure games when it comes to its charm along with the advantages of being a newer game. The writing is also, just so good. This game is literally a perfect 10/10 game for me, and I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044161322', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 248, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1650245191}
review:
A very short point and click adventure game.

Pros:
- gorgeous artstyle, some backgrounds and cutscenes are stunning
- an option to skip puzzles is given

Cons:
- many references to the prequel (The Whispered World) but there is no summary, like a 'previously...' cutscene. This can leave players somewhat baffled as to the characters and what's going on
- very short, not many characters and the ones that are there aren't really developed
- dialogue between the characters feels awkward
- story pacing feels off. You try to decipher the location of another rebel and he turns out to be 3 screens away, you get to the port and somehow you're on a ship, etc. It feels like some scenes are missing
- voice acting can be pretty bad, Renie in particular
- puzzles are very simple

Get this if you really like point and clicks, but if you must play this, at least wait for a sale .

review:
SIlence hat mich wirklich sehr Ã¼berrascht und mitgenommen. Die Story ist sehr liebevoll und auch das Art-Design. Zudem ist das Spiel sehr niedlich und Spot (die Raupe) ist der wohl beste Bestandteil dieser Reihe. Die Ideen die fÃ¼r den Spielverlauf aufkommen, sind auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlich und abwechslungsreich. Etwas missfallen sind mir jedoch einige Charaktere wie z.B. Kyra und teilweise sogar Sadwick, sie wirkten teilweise unstimmig und zu grausam fÃ¼r mich. Die kleine Schwester Renie ist jedoch sehr sÃ¼ÃŸ und ihr Ehrgeiz ist auÃŸerordentlich hoch. :) 

Nun gehe ich noch auf die Verbesserungen/Verschlechterungen bezÃ¼glich des VorgÃ¤ngers The Whispered World ein

[u]Verbesserungen[/u]
[list]
 [*]BezÃ¼glich Grafik und Design ein riesen Meilenstein nach vorne
 [*]Spots Form kann schneller geÃ¤ndert werden
[/list]

[u]Verschlechterungen[/u]
[list]
 [*]Weniger komplexes Denken von NÃ¶ten
 [*]GegenstÃ¤nde kÃ¶nnen nicht kombiniert oder spezifisch aufgerufen/benutzt werden

[/list]

Silence ist dennoch ein sehr guter Nachfolger und absolut empfehlenswert.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975018345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1649309487}
review:
[h1]Silence was very short but sweet[/h1]

Silence took me about 4 hours to complete, so its a really short game compared to games I normally play. It was a good story in which two kids are protagonists. Game is intended for younger audience and its a typical point and click adventure and I enjoyed it, but I remember better games of that genre that had better stories. Overall, the game is beautiful, well voiced, and playable with children.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ Beautiful graphics
+ Spot is a nice helper with lots of abilities
+ Emphasis on bond between children

[b]Cons[/b]
- Some achievements
- Very short game

Overall this game is a rewarding one time experience. There is very little replay value unless you want your children to experience this game as well. Its a very short story presented in beautiful way. This is not a must play by any means and I would not recommend it at full price. If you like point and click games and may share it with children, then buy it during steam sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561199224559114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1649845995}
review:
[h1]Un gioco tranquillo[/h1]
Silence Ã¨ un titolo punta e clicca con una storia, seppure triste, molto bella. L'ambientazione si accompagna bene alla trama grazie ai colori e ai vari personaggi che si incontrano lungo il cammino.
Per ogni scenario ci saranno dei piccoli puzzle da risolvere ma niente di impegnativo. 
Le ultime fasi sembrano un po' affrettate (come se gli sviluppatori avessero finito il budget o cose simili) per cui oltre ad arrivare subito al finale, si resta con un grosso punto interrogativo stampato in testa su quale sia il destino dei vari personaggi incontrati durante la fiaba.
Guardando i contenuti extra, si ha la percezione che molto sia stato "tagliato" dal gioco; peccato perchÃ© seppur breve (4-5 ore a dire tanto), la storia Ã¨ molto emozionale e lo stesso finale si apre a mille interpretazioni diverse. 
Consiglio il titolo proprio per come si conclude e suggerisco di leggere i post della community in merito alle varie interpretazioni.
Voto complessivo: 6.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197970161817', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 411, 'last_played': 1648664634}
review:
Visually, a really beautiful game. Marco HÃ¼llen is a great illustrator whose Art I already loved in the predecessor "The Whispered World". The character design is lovely, the atmosphere beautiful, and so you have all the ingredients for a really good game. You'd think. 

But the plot seems so fragmented and sometimes rushed, the characters pale and unimpressive and sometimes their behavior is not understandable at all. You constantly have the feeling that there is more background to the characters in the game, but it's as if this content was simply removed afterwards. Why certain things happen to them, where they actually come from and why they do what they do - you don't find out. And that's where there would have been so much potential. I feel like I've only played half of a game that originally wanted to be so much more. Nothing really fits together, the game stumbles from setting to setting and doesn't even manage to unite them in the storytelling in a comprehensible way. Even the ending seems rushed, quickly cobbled together and not properly thought out. 

On top of that: the puzzle design is ridiculous and can hardly be described as such. I am sad after finishing this game. Because it could have been so incredibly much more. This wasted potential is at the same time a waste of all the high-quality art this title has in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053133577', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 1292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 690, 'last_played': 1647800214}
review:
Beautiful in the most literal sense, both visually and sonically. I expect one [i]should[/i] play the prequel The Whispered World to get the most out of this game or even most anything period, and while I don't recommend that one unless to the sturdiest of point-and-click fans, this sequel still has "the series" well worth it.

Played specifically now due to being promised by other reviews that it would last just some 4 or so hours but it did not for me; I'd expect probably double that for a leisurely, walkthrough-less first playthrough. Don't use a controller: some things (e.g. catching the  Lumi at the marketplace) are literally impossible with one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004496223', 'num_games_owned': 1048, 'num_reviews': 229, 'playtime_forever': 319, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 319, 'last_played': 1646572500}
review:
Silence is an impressive point & click title featuring stunning visuals and a heartfelt story. It is the best title I've played from Daedalic Entertainment and somewhat of a hidden gem on Steam. It commonly goes on a hefty sale or is bundled, finding its way into many Steam libraries already, but sadly falls victim to gamers backlogs. I highly recommend this title to all story and adventure enthusiasts; it is one that I will not easily forget.

[b] [u]Pros[/u] [/b]
[list]
    [*] Absolutely gorgeous visuals
    [*] Metaphorical cutesy fairy-tale story with dark and poignant undertones about war
    [*] Truly adorable characters & voice acting (Renie & Spot)
    [*] Cinematic experience with many cutscenes throughout
    
[/list]
[b] [u]Cons[/u] [/b]
[list]
    [*] Some characters monologue comments became very repetitive
    [*] No chapter select 
[/list]

[h1]Story[/h1]
Silence is a sequel to the developers first title, The Whispered World (2009). As usual, I launched this game completely blind and was unaware it was a sequel. Luckily, Silence can be played without having any knowledge of its predecessor, although I imagine there are some extra references and Easter eggs for those with a broader understanding.

Silenceâ€™s opening scene absolutely took me by surprise. Beginning with a dramatic cinematic cutscene of children running to a bunker to escape an air raid. Having played Daedalic's previous famous titles (such as Deponia), I figured I knew what I was getting into with Silence, but I was quickly proven wrong. There are multiple protagonists in the game, with the main 3 being Spot (the cutest caterpillar shapeshifter you ever did see), Noah and Renie. Noah and Renie are siblings, Noah is the eldest and takes responsibility for his little sistersâ€™ safety, dedicating his every decision with her wellbeing in mind.

Noah and Renie had conjured up a fairy-tale universe called Silence and seem to use this world as an escape to their war-ravaged reality. After the bunker gets ruthlessly bombarded with bombs, the game swiftly swaps to the world of Silence. The polar opposite of the characters real lives, a sunny place with signs of life, fantastical creatures and a castle that is not merely ruins. A place to escape. A place of hope. In this fantasy world, the siblings meet the resistance fighters who are battling the evil Seekers and the false queen. Renie and Noah must join forces to bring peace once more to the world of Silence and overthrow the false leader.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2775014585

Despite this dark contrast, majority of Silence is light-hearted, cute and bright. It could easily be mistaken for a childrenâ€™s movie, judging solely by the characters and visuals, yet it is so much more. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Gameplay is quite simple, as opposed to the previous Daedalic titles I had played. It maintains the point & click style but there is no inventory system, thus the puzzles are immediately solvable. There is a heavy cinematic and narrative focus which alters the pacing and puzzle difficulty level.  I must admit, I was never a fan of Daedalic's most prominent titles and found them to be over convoluted and frustrating, but I adore the direction they took with Silence.

There are 3 playable characters, and each have their own abilities, especially Spot. Spot is a caterpillar that can shapeshift into a flat and bulbous form. It also can ingest certain liquids to gain new abilities such as water, fire etc. Puzzles are fairly straight forward, and I never found myself completely stuck. There are some choices throughout the game which can lead to different achievements (pacifist or sadist). There are also general conversational choices, but these seemed to have little impact on the story overall. Regardless, I liked their addition, and it made the characters feel more personal. 

Silence is a very short casual game, ranging from 3-6 hours for one playthrough, but has a staggering number of achievements for such a short game. Although there is no chapter select, so the whole game would need to be played from the beginning for achievement hunters and those looking to unlock a different ending.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2773585640


[b] [u] Puzzles [/u] [/b]
As mentioned earlier, puzzles are relatively simple, and most will revolve around Spot. An example is when Spot has to navigate a dragon to obtain a shard fragment. To do this, Spot must change forms multiple times and avoid being pushed backwards by the many obstacles in his way. There is no inventory system, so every item is usable within the section the item was found. This is typically displayed with a highlight, so there is no frustration of endlessly clicking on objects and trying to combine them. Furthermore, there are occasional balance minigames where players must centre the mouse to avoid falling, or to move an item players must hold M1 and move the mouse in the specified direction (like Quantic Dream games). 

Personally, I loved the casual puzzle design and lack of frustrating moments. It draws the focus to the narrative whilst keeping players engaged.


[h1]Visuals & Sound[/h1]
The universe of Silence is gorgeous, there is no denying it. Most settings have soft pastel hues, and the long-range shots are breathtaking. A great contrast to the ferociously cold and drab reality for Renie and Noah. The character designs are adorable. Renie and Spot are extremely charming in their cute, child-like way. Renie's naivety and pure innocence reflect in both her appearance and her voice. Further exaggerated by her trusting and forgiving demeanour. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2772654251

The audio is another big positive, especially the voice actors. Each voice is so vibrant and dramatic, mimicking that of a childrenâ€™s fairy tale. Especially the British talking stones! The standout for me was definitely Renie's voice. Her unfeigned innocence in the face of war was both uplifting yet simultaneously melancholic.


[h1]Technical & Stats [/h1]
[quote][b]This game was played using a controller and with the following PC specs.:[/b]
Intel i5-9400 2.9 GHz
16GB RAM
GeForce RTX 2060 6GB
2560x1440 resolution
HDD
Windows 10[/quote]
[b]Playtime:[/b] 5.5 hours, can be finished in as little as 3 hours. 
[b] Controller Recommended? [/b] Player choice. It does feature full controller support.
[b]Replayability value:[/b]  Yes, to obtain the other endings or unlock the many achievements. However, there is no chapter select.


[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
Silence is a standout point & click title. Its poignant story shines right through from the very beginning. It has a cinematic approach and therefore has less of a focus on complex puzzles, perfect for a casual narrative experience. 
Despite its cutesy art style and fantastical story, the harsh undertones of war are ever present, and Silence's emotional narrative will stay with me for some time. In a world savaged by conflict, Silence's portrayal of innocence and war is forever relevant, and I highly recommend this to all story lovers. This will be one of my favourites that I have played this year and if it is sitting, forgotten in your library already, do yourself a favour and put it at the top of your to play list.

Disclaimer: Received for free from AEG. Thank you, Glenn!

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34936724][quote]Follow my curator page, [b]Cookie Reviews[/b], if you enjoyed this review and want to see more like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099662596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1646536254}
review: I have very mixed feelings about this one. I can't really click "don't recommend," because the game isn't *bad*, just a rather lackluster follow-up to The Whispered World. Somehow knowing you're in a dream world from the beginning drains something of the magic from the scene. It's been so long since I played Whispered World that all of the references ended up making me wonder what I was missing, rather than calling up warm feelings of nostalgia. The characters are underdeveloped, and the dialogue and voice acting leave a little something to be desired. Plus, the game is *short*â€”half as long as The Whispered World. I also found the ending to be much less satisfying. The puzzles, at least, are moderately interesting and generally reasonable. Overall, I'd say play the Whispered World, instead; but, if you're interested in a bit of a follow-on, you can give Silence a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025070619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1659823491}
review:
Was surprised to realize this was actually a "Whispered World 2" but the naming was mediocre and boring "Silence" with unfamiliar face in the banner. Anyway, after plunging into it, it was very enjoyable journey and 5/5 stars!

The praise:
- Heartwarming (and i used this word, about, never) story
- AAA graphics, animations and camera shots
- good balance between puzzles and cinematographics
- Renie and Spot
- few puzzles but they are challenging enough

The nag:
- could've been longer (passed in 6h)
- sounds are imbalanced (too loud speaking compared to surroundings) and subtitles did not work
- Why not name it after Whispered World?

review: Brilliant game, excellent graphics and gameplay, the voice acting(especially renee ) is very good.game flow is very good only a couple of areas which required pixel- hunting.Ive been playing point-and -click games for well over 20 years and this up with the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986430789', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1629222975}
review:
It's a nice Point'n'Click adventure. However, it does seem a bit too short and at times it feels as if it just scratches the surface.
A good game but it feels like it could have been more. By in large the gameplay was better than "The Whispered World" but the 'world' lacked the depth of the first game... Also, the ending was a bit too predictable for those who played "The Whispered World"!

Visuals, voice acting and music are great. It's a good game and I hope that we see more games set in this universe.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052980230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1645365513}
review:
One of the most enjoyable point-and-click adventures I've played. It has beautiful locations, interesting creatures, excellent voice-acting. I was never feeling bored (and that means something, because usually I do get bored while playing this type of games).
It is rather short though, but then, a fairytale isn't supposed to be long. And Silence is just that â€“ a fairytale (well, may be a bit dark one, but it still has hope, and hope is the most important thing in a fairytale).

author: {'steamid': '76561198047890068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1644794471}
review:
Beautiful, clever game and amazing kinda-sequel to "The Whispered World", with a lot of throwbacks. It's also a good spiritual successor to the first one because it plays on the same themes but manages to still be it's own story. Even the puzzles are not quite as non-sensical as they usually are in this type of game. In other words: totally recommended! 

(play the first one, too, it's worth it :-))

review: I played the prologue until about ten minutes in when the first "reaction test" puzzle requires the abuse of the mouse by moving it repeatedly in a specific direction. I moved it so fast it almost broke, but did not get any feedback and repeatedly failed. This is shoddy, lazy game design at its worst. Even if the graphics are nice, don't buy this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160125251', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1644616487}
review:
Es un juego precioso. Se disfruta mucho tanto grÃ¡ficamente como por la historia y la forma que tiene de contarla. Precisamente vale la pena por lo anterior mencionado, porque si lo que buscas es un juego con el sistema de point & click bÃ¡sico y que te estruje un poco la sesera, lamentablemente no lo vas a encontrar aquÃ­. No tiene inventario y las acciones son mÃ¡s bien un tanto automÃ¡ticas (no hay inventario) y con nula dicifultad. Pero no por ello es un mal juego, al contrario, simplemente se toma una forma distinta de proceder donde prioriza facilitar la historia al jugador por encima del resto de cosas.

Aunque se pueda disfrutar sin haber jugado a su predecesor The Whispered World, recomiendo altamente hacerlo en orden, en Silence hay muchos guiÃ±os a la anterior aventura, asÃ­ como cameos de personajes que ya se vieron y eso le aÃ±ade un toque entraÃ±able si no te has saturado ya con las dos criaturiitas que mÃ¡s protagonismo adquieren en el juego: Renie y Spot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129212819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 274, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1644509090}
review:
I enjoyed this one as far as point and click games go. Definitely not difficult like some. But with most point and click games I find the puzzles rarely make sense and you find yourself clicking randomly on things for hours. For some reason the puzzles in this one just lined up for me and made sense. 

The characters are adorable. Story decent enough. Music and sounds brilliant.

Seems I could have made some major different choices in a few parts so I may give this another go some time since it wasn't too long and knowing the puzzles now will make the second playthrough faster. 

All in all at 90% off was worth every penny. Just read Daedalic closed its doors early 2021 so that's sad. Some good chill games in their library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055541101', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1644435250}
review: I've played a variety of point and click games. This one's incredibly slow. Takes forever for actions to finish cause every character moves so slowly. Some puzzles don't really make sense so you have to try everything on a level, which combined with the dialogues and slow pace, takes forever. Wasn't able to finish it, got bored pretty early in the game.

Astounding graphics, heartwarming story, interesitng puzzles, no bug whatsoever.
A positive experience from all points of view, I advice for anyone even remotely into point-and-click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561199149741392', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1643825363}
review:
I really wanted to enjoy this game. I really did. 
It has beautiful graphics, story is interesting, but the gameplay itself is incredibly dull and boring.
There is no inventory, so anything you pick up you use right away. Puzzles are almost non existent. There's not really much to do but walk around and click on objects and listen to the story. 
It's not that I hate the game, I just wish there was more to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040811698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 429, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1643577511}
review:
Highly recommended for fans of point and click adventures, art, and a good story.

+Visuals, art style, environments
+Full voice acting
+Characters, story
+Some meaningful choices

-Autosave only
-Some puzzles are unclear and repetitive
-Some fake choices
-Side characters are underdeveloped
-Assumes too much from its lackluster prequel, The Whispered World

author: {'steamid': '76561198014817484', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 267, 'playtime_forever': 333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 333, 'last_played': 1643561057}
review:
Deel twee van het bekende spel waarmee je met Spot speelt, 
de rups die verschillende vormen kan aannemen.
Grafisch is dit een meesterwerk, Ã©Ã©n van de mooierer spellen 
van Deadalic, persoonlijk vind ik alle avonturen spellen goed er
uit zien van ze, maar ze hebben er een paar die er meer cartoony
uitzien en die vind ik persoonlijk iets minder leuk.

Alles is erg goed uitgewerkt en je hebt voldoende keuze in
het menu om grafisch aan te passen maar ook geluid en 
andere zaken. Er is een extra's menu met game lore etc..

Waar ik wel even aan moest wennen waren de spel mechanieken,
met name als je met toetsenbord en muis speelt en vaker
point & click avonturen spellen doet is dit toch net iets anders.
Ook is de pacing is langzamer, ze hebben zelfs een achievement
voor nooit weg klikken van ondertiteling/gesproken woord.
Dus als je dit spel doet zou ik er echt ff voor gaan zitten.

Al met al een fantastisch leuk spel met medium moeilijke 
puzzels, alle puzzels vond ik zelf erg natuurlijk en had nooit
een walkthrough nodig om de puzzels op te lossen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116344006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1643501770}
review:
Wie Ã¼blich bei Daedalic super niedliches PaC Spiel. Die Story is schÃ¶n, die Grafik gewohnt gut gemacht, lediglich die Ladezeiten zwischen den Screens sind absurd lange (nein, das liegt nicht an meinem Rechner). Muss man mehr als zwei Mal hin und her, ist das bereits sehr nervig, nach 4h Spielzeit hat man bereits genug von "auf den Ladescreen warten". 
DarÃ¼ber hinaus fehlt eine regulÃ¤re Spielstand speichern Funktion, man kann also nicht nochmal zurÃ¼ck, sondern muss, wenn Bedarf nach Achievements, alles nochmal spielen. Was, Ladescreens sei Dank, dann vermutlich doch nicht so bald passieren wird.....

author: {'steamid': '76561198957129589', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1651332700}
review: Such a cute game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198888074499', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1643338849}
review: **minor spoilers** - Looks pretty but only one interesting character, Renie. Some terrible game design moments - "I need to secure the chasm first." Apparently you actually need to do something seemingly unrelated in a different part of the world first and then secure the chasm! Puzzles that really wouldn't be challenging at all without intentional misdirection by the main character. "If only I had some kind of net" when if he said "bridge" you would know exactly what to do. I'm way more mad about the hours wasted on this than the $2 I spent on it...

author: {'steamid': '76561198164016063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 333, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1643391974}
review:
pros

+ touching story of two siblings
+ gorgeous looking and detailed hand-drawn background artwork
+ immersive fantasy world and atmosphere
+ enjoyable puzzles. they are not too easy or overly complicated.
+ nice and relaxing soundtrack
+ three playable character
+ there is auto save
+ well made, long and fun to watch cinematic cut scenes
+ good voice acting
+ likeable and charming characters
+ when you press to space, hotspots is highlighted
+ hint system and tutorial very helpful
+ there are steam achievements and cards
+ there are two ending

cons

- frequent and long loading screens halts game's pace. narrative also could do with a little more pace
- controls and interface mechanics made for gamepad so playing this game with mouse and keyboard quite frustrating
- characters and their relationships with each other could have been developed more

Overall, this is an pretty good point and click adventure game and decent sequel to first game. i quite enjoyed and i really recommended those who are fan of first game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198166274638', 'num_games_owned': 131, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1643308112}
review:
The game is just a bunch of interactive kinematics, it feels incomplete. 
If, like me, you love graphic adventures, surely this game is not for you! There is not even a freaking inventory, where am I supposed to keep and shuffle my items??? Oh.. right... there are no items to keep.
[spoiler] Of course it's so easy and fluffy, you could buy it for your 3 year old. Ah no wait! There are little girls getting blown up right at the beginning of the game and minors who take drugs by directly licking psychedelic plants. [/spoiler]
This game really sucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344353564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1642700877}
review:
What attracted me to this game was its visuals. 
Since the game was published in 2016, the game might have been such an achievement back then. However, when I played it in 2022, the rest was just okay.

Being the sequel of The Whispered World, people said that this is a stand-alone video game, which makes me disagree for the rest of 6 hours playing this game. The story was super fast; there are so many details untold, especially with the characters. I can't even empathize with what happened to them. The game's mechanics were too simple; it bores me, and the voice acting so flat it hurts me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198867764770', 'num_games_owned': 370, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1642899476}
review: Bought this game on sale for less than a dollar. Great story and gorgeous art style. Finished the game for 7hrs but I might play it again to choose another path and to possibly unlock the achievements. There are some parts where i got stuck so I need to load from the checkpoint -- super minor. overall I enjoyed the game. If you love point and click games, give this one a shot!

review:
Histoire trÃ¨s touchante et pleine de poÃ©sie. Les graphismes sont trÃ¨s beaux et la BO est gÃ©niale. 
Je ne comprends pas certains commentaires trÃ¨s mitigÃ©s, personnellement cette histoire m'a vraiment transportÃ©e jusqu'Ã  la fin. Ni trop longue, ni trop courte. Les Ã©nigmes ne sont pas difficiles, idÃ©al pour ne pas se prendre la tÃªte, et les personnages sont attachants - mÃªme si j'aurais prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© un peu plus de dÃ©veloppement sur certains.
Pour l'avoir jouÃ© trois fois, on note des Ã©lÃ©ments que l'on avait pas remarquÃ©s au premier passage (dont de nombreux clins d'oeil au premier The Whispered World) et Ã§a donne un peu plus de profondeur Ã  l'histoire.
Au final j'ai passÃ© un trÃ¨s bon moment, je ne peux que vous recommander ce jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094948942', 'num_games_owned': 314, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1642616501}
review:
[h1] Such a cute game! [/h1]

[b]Short version:[/b]

I would recommend this game to you if you like cute graphics and puzzle games, and you are patient! Because in some places it took me a good 30 minutes to solve a puzzle... It's just not obvious what to do sometimes, and there are minor bugs as well. These aside, I really enjoyed the game, the story is great, and it left and open question at the end that made me think and appreciat the game more.

[b]Long version:[/b]

Alrighty, so you need more details. I get it, let's go: This game was real fun to play, although I wouldn't consider this a one-sitting game, as in some parts it took me so much time to figure out what to do that I just needed a break. For example, in one part you have to switch between 2 of your characters and interact with the map at the same time. For some reason, for the first try everything worked fine, but I messed up the sequence, so I had to restart the moves. And for the second time, my character wouldn't do that same exact interaction it did 5 minutes ago. I had to leave that area and go back in order for it to work. Minor bugs like this can make the puzzles a little bit more time-consuming, but luckily this was the only one I encountered.

Otherwise the story is fascinating, the game itself requires absolutely no skill (it's a click&collect, duh!) so it can be played with a friend by passing the controller to eachother etc. I really liked the multiple-choice parts, although I read here that the choices don't actually change the plot, which would be a pity! Though I didn't test this part, so cannot say for sure.

The graphics are also amazing, and the musical parts were really enjoyable! I liked playing with this game, and I might re-play the whole thing in some time.

10/9

author: {'steamid': '76561199024621652', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1642240535}
review:
[h1] The annoying perfection of 6 hours  [/h1]

When I tried the demo version, I expected to find difficult puzzles, well-organized plots, and good character development. In fact, after buying the full version and finished it, this game truly grasped the role as a point & click genre.

There is nothing wrong with the point & click mechanic in this game. Just click your mouse and the game will be over after millions of thoughtless clicks.

Some of the things that I LOVE in this game are the excellent sound design, cartoonist graphics, then Renie and Plot characters. Others, may be the work of an intern developer.

This game gets my thumbs up because I got 90% off.

review:
Silence is yet another point-and-click from Daedalic.

Gameplay-wise, mouse.

Conclusion, Silence is playable but it feels like Daedalic was unable to complete the game and just sold it finished. The game is also really short.

author: {'steamid': '76561199175979314', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1644977777}
review:
Short version: 10/10, love the game

Long version:
I was skeptical when buying this, given a-lot of people were saying that they weren't fond of the characters, the dialogue was scarce and that it overall was only an O-K game. I saw it was on sale, for a really good price and thought I'd check it out anyway. I'm so glad I did, Sadwick does get on your nerves, but not for long. The story is worth it, and even if it wasn't there was Spot. Spot makes life OK.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007513026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 433, 'playtime_forever': 512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1641427710}
review:
I really would like to recommend this game. It has great graphics, good voice acting and a strange but interesting story.

What more could one want from a game. How about a game that doesn't have a game breaking bug and no proper saved game feature so if you encounter the bug you have to restart the game. Unfortunately I encountered this bug and since there is only one save and it auto saved with the bug I had to restart the game from the beginning.

As many have complained about the load times are very long. Also, when you exit the game and come back later you will have to rewatch long sequences because the auto save intervals are too infrequent.

How about the puzzles? What puzzles? Daedalic isn't, at least to me, known for creating good puzzles. I enjoyed the Deponia series in spite of some really bad puzzles. There are essentially no puzzles in Silence, there is only trial an error. You only have a single inventory item so it comes down to trying that item, if you have it or one of the other characters on every object in the scene. Even then Daedalic manged to create a few nonsense "puzzles".

I bought this game on deep discount and I did enjoy the good parts of the game. But the negatives outweigh the positives so I can't recommend it.

Update - after a few more hours of play, the negatives greatly outweight the positives. Somehow Daedalic manages to create "puzzles" that are as bad as Deponia even though there are almost no interactive actions in the game. I just got stuck on a "puzzle" which turned out to be an arcade sequence, but there was no indication there was an arcade sequence. Even after reading the walkthrough it took me several attempts to solve this "puzzle". Definitely not recommended, even at the 90% discount I bought the game at.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026026858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1578154222}
review: I absolutely love this game. I dived into this world for about 6 hours and it was such an awesome experience. I loved the story (don't wanna spoil anything here), which is so emotional. The storytelling hit home a few times and I literally shed some tears. A beautiful masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970587571', 'num_games_owned': 742, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1640714662}
review:
The backgrounds are great, and so are some of the characters. It looks pretty decent for a point and click adventure.

The story is ok, interesting enough. But the game is a bit too simple, no inventory and very easy puzzles. The voice acting is irregular, some characters are insuferable.

On overall, an ok game, it has some charm and it's quite pretty. Worthy of buying at a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327462603', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1640491267}
review: Not a bad game/story, but I felt like it got boring after a while, maybe something to do with the genre itself and not the game. Obviously, other people might not feel the same way. Nice plot (especially the end "twist").

author: {'steamid': '76561197968878172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1124, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1641572025}
review:
Leider der Tiefpunkt und auch das Ende der Daedalic-Adventures ... RIP Daedalic!

+ sieht sehr gut aus
+ tolle deutsche Sprecher
+ kam noch in einer schicken Box mit Steam-Key (bei Release erworben)

--- kein echtes Adventure, Gameplay like Telltale (Interaktive Geschichte), traurig, wird Deadalic nicht gerecht und entÃ¤uscht auf ganze Linie ... kein RÃ¤tsel, kein Inventar ... blame on you Deadalic 
- konsolenoptimieres "Gameplay", Interface und MenÃ¼ ... man traut sich gar nicht das Gameplay zu nennen ... man klickt sich durch die Geschichte
- Dialoge sind teilweise zusammenhanglos ... zusammengeschnitten? per Google ins Deutsche Ã¼bersetzt?
- Story ist kurz und wenig mitreiÃŸend
--- keine Speicherfunktion

EnttÃ¤uschung pur.
Hier sollte offensichtlich der Konsolenmarkt erschlossen und der vermeintlich erfolgreichere Konkurrent Telltale (wir wissen wie erfolgreich sie tatsÃ¤chlich waren ...) kopiert werden. Bitter wenn das Kapital bestimmt und gute Studios zu Grunde richtet.

review: Beautiful game and I bet it would be a lot more fun if I had known about and played the game before it apparently since the first hour has been almost nothing but references to the last game I guess? review:
Silencio es un mundo que se encuentra entre la vida y la muerte, un mundo que Noah ya conoce porque ya estuvo allÃ­. Sin embargo, ahora tambiÃ©n le acompaÃ±a su hermana Renie, y Silencio estÃ¡ gobernado por una "reina falsa". Si quieren regresar a casa, tendrÃ¡n que enfrentarse a ella y decidir el destino de Silencio. 

Es evidente que el juego se centra mÃ¡s en hacerte disfrutar de la historia y del arte, que del juego en si, ya que no es muy largo y los puzles no son complejos. Pero acierta en ese aspecto, y consigue hacerte pasar un buen rato. La Ãºnica pega que le veo es que no tiene rejugabilidad ninguna (solo dos finales, y puedes verlos seguidos solo con cargar la partida de nuevo una vez has visto uno), asÃ­ que no aconsejo pagar los 20 euros que vale de normal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198223164124', 'num_games_owned': 946, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1637699158}
review:
Yet another beautiful game from Daedalic, with a compelling story, ruined by poor logic and bad interface decisions.

Here are the two things that made me give up:

Being a Point & Click, you'd expect it to work nicely with a gyroscope mouse - as do other games of this genre. Not so, because of those balance challenges, and those pull or wiggle prompts.

I was expecting it to be a bit of a puzzle game, yet you can't deviate much from the predefined trail - meaning, sometimes you can only do an action (like picking an item that's just lying there) after doing something not reasonably related (like removing something elsewhere).
So, thinking in advance is definitely discouraged, and some riddles are rendered needlessly more difficult due to having to retry actions at different times to try to get different outcomes.

Having tried most Point & Click games from Daedalic, i advise you to steer clear from all of them - including this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991699715', 'num_games_owned': 1124, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 6982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6982, 'last_played': 1636286080}
review:
Since I was missing some achievements and I wanted to finish every achievement, I had to finis chapter I & II... for three times :P But I didn't mind since I like the characters and the story, even if the universe is not that familiar, but both main characters have something that I can relate to. The boy is not always 100% sure, he makes mistakes exactly like an older brother, while the little sister is not all sure that something should be done but she is curious about the world in itself, she likes Spot and since she is the little one is exactly like she should be in real life. The story is not bad, but what I like the most is rather the two main characters, since I can relate to them. Kyra is not a bad character, but the secondary characters are introduced without any story, they have a different purpose and we never meet them at the end... in any of the endings. The rock brothers are funny maybe they were used too little since the story is rather short, but Silence is only a story in itself, similar with a dream. 

Try it, you might like it :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198023623749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 334, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1636585234}
review: Silence, which is a prequel to another point & click game named The Whispered World, offers beautiful visuals, a decent story and quirky achievements to hunt. Also, my 8-year-old daughter was really into it, so it's a fun game to experience together.

review:
Silence: The Wispered World, del 15 de Noviembre de 2016, es una aventura tipo â€œPoint And Clickâ€, de unas cuatro horas de duraciÃ³n aproximada. Tuvieron la mala idea de complicarla con mecanicas dicifiles, por eso no l0o recomiendo. Un juego es para disfrutar, no para sufrir...
Somos Noah, el hermano mayor de Renie, que estÃ¡ perdida en un reino mÃ¡gico entre la vida y la muerte. 
La grafica es preciosa, con fondos pintados a mano, con una banda sonora de Tilo Alpermann...

HistÃ³ria fraca e mal desenvolvida, personagens superficiais e sem personalidade, jogo curto com final abrupto e decepcionante, diÃ¡logos fraquÃ­ssimos e irrelevantes, trilha sonora praticamente inexistente, tudo exatamente ao contrÃ¡rio do brilhantismo do primeiro jogo.

Puzzles fÃ¡ceis, lineares, nÃ£o hÃ¡ nem mesmo inventÃ¡rio, uma piada de mal gosto no quesito "Adventure Games".

O primeiro jogo (Whispered World) Ã© uma obra prima, personagens cativantes, diÃ¡logos bem feitos, histÃ³ria bem desenvolvida, trilha sonora inesquecÃ­vel, puzzles interessantes (alguns bens difÃ­ceis), e um final Ã©pico e de encher os olhos de lÃ¡grimas. Um jogo memorÃ¡vel e inesquecÃ­vel... Ao contrÃ¡rio de Silence.

Silence Ã© uma sequÃªncia decepcionante e que nÃ£o faz jus ao legado de Whispered World. Era melhor nunca terem feito esse segundo jogo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045336457', 'num_games_owned': 1187, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1531740126}
review:
[b]ATENCIÃ“N, EL ARTÃCULO CONTIENE SPOILERS DE [i]The Whispered World[/i].[/b]

[h1]GRÃFICOS[/h1]
Solo se pueden definir como â€œobra maestraâ€. Es lo mÃ¡s obvio, el juego es realmente increÃ­ble. Los fondos estÃ¡n bellamente dibujados a mano â€“muy parecidos a la primera parte- se superponen para crear una autÃ©ntica ilusiÃ³n de profundidad. Los personajes en 3D estÃ¡n muy detallados y combinan perfectamente con el estilo de los fondos. Los movimientos de la cÃ¡mara son muy fluidos y el juego de luces y sombras hacen que cada escena sea un placer para la vista. Resumiendo se podrÃ­a decir que es una obra de arte actual.
Por ponerle pegas, aunque el juego es visualmente impresionante, carece de la variedad a la que nos acostumbrÃ³ la primera parte. Muchas de las ubicaciones comparten temas en comunes (por ejemplo, una cascada, pues hay tres pantallas que aparece la cascada, desde los lados y desde delante) eso unido a lo corto que es el juego hace que casi no se vean zonas diferentes de Silence.
AquÃ­ quiero hacer un comentario sobre los vÃ­deos. En la mayorÃ­a de los juegos los videos aportan algo bueno, pero el problema es que no se pueden omitir las escenas. Al principio estÃ¡ bien, pero no lo han planificado correctamente y si despuÃ©s de estar 3-4 minutos viendo una escena te sales del juego, cuando vuelvas a entrar tendrÃ¡s que volverte a ver la escena de nuevo. El punto de guardado estaba antes de la escena. Â¿Tanto costaba poner un botÃ³n para saltÃ¡rtelo si ya lo has visto?

[h1]MÃšSICA[/h1]
Aunque es cierto que la banda sonora de Tilo Alpermann no se puede comparar con el extraordinario trabajo de Finn Seliger del primer juego, el tema de sonido complementa maravillosamente lo que sucede en la pantalla, incluso empleando algunos temas del juego anterior. Todos los temas son dignos de descargÃ¡rtelos en tu reproductor habitual para escucharlos cuando quieras.

[h1]HISTORIA[/h1]
El final del primer juego solo implicaba una cosa: Silence es un mundo que estÃ¡ entre la vida y la muerte en el que tu mente solo entra cuando estÃ¡s a punto de morir. Esto hace que la historia de la segunda parte estÃ© muy limitada y ademÃ¡s toda la trama carece el elemento sorpresa que fue el final del 1. En este juego los dos protagonistas son conscientes de esto lo que hace la historia un poco absurda. Sabes que estÃ¡s en un sueÃ±o y que no importa lo que hagas. ATENCIÃ“N SPOILER. El final es casi una rÃ©plica del primer juego, aunque las consecuencias de tu elecciÃ³n final son poco arbitrarias. O mueres y te quedas en Silence o te despiertas y no importa todo lo que has hecho.
La duraciÃ³n del juego es realmente corta. Cuando te estÃ¡s empezando acostumbrar al juego de repente se acaba, dejÃ¡ndote con una sensaciÃ³n de decepciÃ³n. Muchas veces parece que han recortado gran parte del contenido (ya sea por motivos de recursos o de presupuesto). A veces estÃ¡s en un sitio y cambias de pantalla y ya has llegado a otro, no hay una transiciÃ³n lÃ³gica, parece como si estuviera diseÃ±ado para aÃ±adir mÃ¡s zonas y que por alguna razÃ³n no las sacaron. Â¿QuerrÃ­an hacer un DLC y al final no lo sacaron? Para que os hagÃ¡is una idea, el juego te lo puedes pasar perfectamente en 4 horas.

[h1]PERSONAJES[/h1]
Personajes principales (jugables):
[b]Renie[/b]. En este juego pasamos mucho tiempo manejando a un niÃ±o pequeÃ±o y es la primera vez que realmente aparenta que es un niÃ±o pequeÃ±o (gran trabajo de producciÃ³n). PequeÃ±os deslices al pronunciar palabras complicadas, ser ignorado por los adultos que discuten, la increÃ­ble curiosidad, ingenuidad y vulnerabilidad que desprende. Un trabajo extraordinario.
[b]Spot[/b]. Es imposible no encariÃ±arte con el pequeÃ±o gusano verde. Los pasajes donde juegas como Spot son, en mi opiniÃ³n, mecÃ¡nicamente los mÃ¡s atractivos y desafiantes ya que ofrecen una mayor cantidad de opciones de interacciÃ³n. Pero sobre todo, Â¿lo has visto de cerca? Que monada.
[b]Sadwick / Noah[/b]. Este personaje me decepciona. Los comentarios amargados de Sadwick en ningÃºn momento llegan a ser tan entretenidos como en el primer juego, la mayorÃ­a de las veces son simplemente deprimentes (como "Ese es un pozo profundo, tambiÃ©n podrÃ­a saltar"). Â¿De verdad ponen eso en un juego de este tipo? Y no solo eso, la "transformaciÃ³n" de Noah a Sadwick se nota algo forzada e increÃ­ble. Eso de levantar la tapa y decir â€œbueno, entonces, ahora soy Sadwickâ€â€¦ Y los demÃ¡s personajes aceptan eso en todo momento y ni vuelven a hablar de Noah.

Otros personajes y sus interacciones:
El nÃºmero de personajes distintos que aparecen son casi ridÃ­culos, apenas unas diez personas y como en los diÃ¡logos no hay opciones para elegir hace que los pocos personajes que nos encontramos sean planos y â€œesteriotipadosâ€. Incluso cuando un personaje tiene que hacer algo peligroso no se percibe, ya que como no hay opciones para elegir, saber que va a pasar sÃ­ o sÃ­, no te llevas ninguna sorpresa.

[h1]PUZLES Y ACERTIJOS[/h1]
Acertijos. Por llamarlos de alguna forma. No hay ni uno que dure mÃ¡s de 30 segundos. Son cortos y sencillos. AdemÃ¡s no tienes inventario lo cual tambiÃ©n hace que no tengas que pensar si para pasarte una escena necesitas algÃºn objeto que tengas guardado, ya que no tienes nada. Es coger y usar al momento. Los minijuegos son raros y fÃ¡ciles. Parece diseÃ±ado para jugadores casuales que no hayan jugado nunca a este tipo de aventuras grÃ¡ficas.

[h1]EL HUMOR[/h1]
 Para ser de Daedalic no hay mucho que digamos. Silence carece el tono agridulce e irÃ³nico de The Whispered World. En casi todo momento el estado de Ã¡nimo es mÃ¡s bien oscuro, melancÃ³lico y dramÃ¡tico. Tiene sus pequeÃ±os momentos de alivio cÃ³mico pero no acaban de ser bien ejecutados. Tal vez los diseÃ±adores se esforzaron demasiado en intentar sumirnos en la tristeza del juego y se olvidaron de la alegrÃ­a de querer vivir.
Terminando
El juego se centra mÃ¡s en la â€œexperiencia cinematogrÃ¡ficaâ€  -como dirÃ­an los desarrolladores-  que en la propia jugabilidad. Si bien es cierto que el tema visual es uno de los grandes fuertes del juego â€“y asÃ­ lo venden- hace que el juego se resienta. Sin opciones de diÃ¡logo, falta de personajes interesantes, prÃ¡cticamente ausencia de sorpresas, puzles demasiados sencillos y la corta duraciÃ³n del juego hacen que te quedes a medias â€“insatisfecho- al terminal el juego. 
Por lo que salvo que te haya encantado el primero y quieras seguir las aventuras de tus queridos personajes, yo no lo recomiendo y mÃ¡s viendo el precio abusivo que tiene. 
[b]PuntuaciÃ³n: 2/5[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198329281115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1630178309}
review:
Silence kann auÃŸer optisch nicht wirklich mit seinem VorgÃ¤nger Whispered World mithalten.
Die Stimmung ist eine ganz andere als im ersten Teil, weil es allein damit anfÃ¤ngt, dass man in der richtigen Welt beginnt und es einen Bombenangriff gibt. Der erste Teil ist anfangs nur eine Geschichte, die Noah erzÃ¤hlt, wird aber dann Wirklichkeit. Wer den ersten Teil gespielt hat, wird das Ende nicht sonderlich Ã¼berraschend finden.


Die RÃ¤tsel sind sehr unterschiedlich und interessant.
Die Story ist eigentlich nicht so spannend. Man spielt mit abwechselnden Figuren, weshalb es nicht eintÃ¶nig wird. Die Nebencharaktere fand ich nicht sonderlich aufregend. 

Alles in allem wÃ¼rde ich aber sagen, ein gutes Spiel, wenn auch nicht das Beste.

Ach ja: Wer die Credits durchsteht, bekommt eine kleine Belohnung in Form einer sehr kurzen Cutscene.

review:
Pero que pedazo de juego...!! muy bueno grÃ¡ficamente, los personajes estÃ¡n bien por de mas, Renie se roba el libreto por mucho,.

El sumamente resaltable el apartado grafico de esta aventura point and click, los diseÃ±os estÃ¡n todos excelentes, tanto de los escenarios, personajes, animaciones, etc..

Me saque, calculo yo, que el final mas triste de todos....
Tocara re.jugarlo y ver si consigo los otros

Lo Ãºnico malo, los tiempo de carga de los niveles, por ahÃ­ se ponen demasiado lentos.

Edit: podes ver el final alternativo, solo cargando el ultimo save; el final triste el mejor, el menos triste no llega a ser un final feliz... jajaja

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198266334089', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1629394364}
review: I enjoyed this, but preferred The Whispered World (this is a sequel to it). I wish Daedalic hadn't been so influenced by Telltale Games and that Silence had been a more traditional point and click game. Although one thing it has going for it is its graphics: it might be the most beautiful point and click game ever made. It's a shame how long the loading times are between screens, but perhaps that's because I don't have a high-end computer. Also, there's no manual saves and I found it unclear when the save points actually occurred. Perhaps it mentioned it at the beginning, but I took a long break between starting the game and going back to playing it. Maybe I forgot how to identify the save point.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977657096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1627314455}
review:
Stimmiges Adventure, toll prÃ¤sentierte Szenerie (trotz schwarzer Balken, die auf meinem weiten Monitor die eigentlich vorhandene Grafik abdecken, bis sie es noch weiter zum Rand hin nicht mehr tun und hier und da versteckte Figuren zeigen). Aber egal, die AtmosphÃ¤re stimmt, die Charaktere funktionieren und die RÃ¤tsel sind vorhanden, aber nicht zu anstrengend gekÃ¼nstelt. Und nein, ich finde sechs Stunden sind nicht zu kurz fÃ¼r ein Adventure, man braucht sowas nicht ewig in die LÃ¤nge ziehen, das machts nur zÃ¤h.

Ich mag wie die kleine Knutschkugel eingesetzt werden kann, da gibts immer wieder Ã¼berraschende Momente und sogar das Kind nervt nicht. Toll vertont ist das Ganze auch noch.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190933825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1627226833}
review: GrundsÃ¤tzlich kann ich mich Ã¼ber das Spiel nicht beschweren. Es ist optisch super, die Figuren sind liebevoll entworfen und man kann sie gern haben, Spot ist dabei, es gibt auch ein paar lustige Stellen. Doch wer den ersten Teil (Whispered World) kennt, wird hier wohl enttÃ¤uscht sein. Es ist ziemlich schnell klar, wie die Geschichte endet, die RÃ¤tsel sind im Gegensatz zum ersten Teil eher einfach und leicht zu durchschauen und das Spiel ist auch ziemlich kurz. Ich wÃ¼rde sagen, lieber den ersten Teil nochmal spielen, als die Fortsetzung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032705777', 'num_games_owned': 835, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 413, 'last_played': 1624273707}
review:
This is an upsetting squeal to The Whispered World.   I was hoping to play a game with the same quality as the first with story with some nice updated graphics.  The story was .... ok.  The characters that is where the problems are they are just completely unrealistic.  For example a character gets mad at you viciously points a knife at you and angrily says I'm not a murderer.  The main heroes are kind of pathetic but not in the funny way Sadwik was from the original.  There is no inventory system so most of what you have to do is too easy to figure out.  The animation of characters was jerky and had a hard time expressing motions with out hand movements.  Like those underbudget need to produce a show every week CGI cartoons that used to air on tv.

If your looking for a chill stream that doesn't stick to one game check me out at https://www.twitch.tv/justthepassenger !

author: {'steamid': '76561198402073483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1624304487}
review:
Wish i could play it but seems it does not like my system or it has some major bugs. and being an older game i highly doubt it will be fixed so essentially a waste of money.

What i have seen of it looks and sounds like a game i would enjoy, but alas it crashes about ten min ( i know it states 0.9 hours playtime, but this is literally me retrying the same section over and over) into the game, at the exact same spot each time. you place an egg in a nest, egg hatches then boom, screen freezes, puts my GFX card into a weird state whereby i have to restart. Having spent a considerable amount of time searching for an answer to my problem, new save, reinstall etc. nothing helps. In summery i can not recommend i can not play. 

If by some miracle i find a solution and i am able to play, i will revise this. 

1 out of 5

author: {'steamid': '76561198302208299', 'num_games_owned': 287, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 5330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5330, 'last_played': 1623318427}
review:
This Point & Click Adventure game set in the world of Silence is a sequel to Daedalicâ€™s 2009 game [i]The Whispered World[/i]. Though there are some references to its predecessor, this game is entirely playable without ever having heard of the previous one. Those who loved [i]The Whispered World[/i] will find references to it throughout the game, including some returning characters. Despite taking place in the same world, [i]Silence[/i] has a very different feel and aesthetic.

One of the things that I really enjoyed from [i]The Whispered World[/i] was the graphics. The game was made using more traditional 2D animation in a style reminiscent of a 1990s cartoon. It was very well animated and though some content was a bit depressing, the animation style lightened the mood. For [i]Silence[/i], they decided to use 3D animation. I donâ€™t have anything against 3D animation, however, the aesthetic is quite different. The sprites in general have decent rigging and walkpaths, but I found the textures to be an odd mix of smooth yet still angular. The design, overall, wasnâ€™t bad, but was more what I expect in a console game as opposed to a PC game. As a fan of the first game, I would have preferred if more of it's aesthetics were carried over into this sequel.

In [i]Silence[/i], Noah and his sister Renie start off running to a bomb shelter in what seems reminiscent of a World War II plane bombing. Though they make it safely to the shelter, neither is particularly excited to have to stay there for an extended time. In order to comfort Rennie, Noah retells her the story of his time as Sadwick the clown in the world of Silence.  After another bomb drops, caving in the shelter, Noah has to look around for Rennie.  He follows her voice only to find himself, once again, in Silence.  Noah must now embark on a journey find and save his sister.  Throughout the game you switch between controlling Noah, Rennie, or Spot.

The story and writing weren't terrible, but it was more than a little predictable. Some of the writing seemed a little off. For example the main character, Renie, just wasnâ€™t written well to actually sound like a child her age would. Sometimes, her dialogue sounds like a much older than her age and others like a much younger. While I personally found that a little annoying, it didnâ€™t make the game or story entirely unenjoyable. There are quite a few places in the game where you are given two different dialogue options.  This gives the illusion of choice, but doesn't generally have an impact on the overall story arc. At best, you may hear a slight difference in dialogue or see a slightly different animation.  The only choice that really makes a difference is at the end of the game, pick between two endings. Neither ending seems to be a â€œtrueâ€ ending, and personally, I didnâ€™t find either of them satisfying.

My biggest issues with this game were its interface and mechanics. While [i]The Whispered World[/i] was designed exclusively for PC, [i]Silence[/i] was developed for both PC and console systems. This led to a lot of interface and mechanic choices that favor consoles and make for a very different feel in gameplay compared to most Point & Click Adventure games. When I play Point & Clicks, I generally expect to have an inventory that I can interact with, and [i]Silence[/i] doesnâ€™t have one. You may pick something up, but you cannot view your inventory or randomly combine an item. If you can use something, it will show up as you mouse over the object/character. You also canâ€™t utilize a traditional save game system. Instead, the game autosaves at checkpoints. Unfortunately, it doesnâ€™t tell you where exactly those checkpoints are. This can lead to losing a fair amount of progress. These interface issues seem largely tied to making it more playable for consoles, but can somewhat alienate PC Point & Click fans like myself.

The other issue I have with the mechanics is mostly win regard to the annoying balance checks and push/pull objectives they put in the game. There are several places where your character will need to balance on something by moving the cursor to counterbalance. There are also several times when you must grab onto something and drag the cursor to push or pull something. These seem optimized for a console controller.  I played this game on a laptop, and these parts weâ€™re extremely difficult to accomplish on a laptopâ€™s trackpad. My trackpad simply doesnâ€™t have enough distance (at 6 inches/15 cm wide) to cover in order to complete a pull/push or balance well. Many players in the forums recommend playing with an Xbox controller.  Being that I don't have that type of controller, I ended up attaching an external mouse instead. I felt, even with the mouse, the controls for these parts were unusually difficult.   It still required dragging my mouse in the extreme from one end of my mouse pad to the other end (and sometimes past the end of my mouse pad) in order to complete the action.  Using a mouse, however, was still easier than the laptop trackpad for these tasks.. 

Some of the good things about the interface and mechanics are that, like many Daedalic games, there is an option to highlight hotspots. This can really help you out if you are struggling to figure out what to do next. You can also fast click to the next screen as well as through some of the dialogues. Unfortunately, if you are playing multiple playthroughs the many unskippable dialogues will feel even longer to go through.  An option to skip through all dialogues would have made it much more enjoyable for replays.

For a Point & Click Adventure game, puzzles were lacking. It didnâ€™t have very many puzzles (or mini-games) and the ones it did have, were too easy. They simply didnâ€™t feel satisfying to complete.  If you donâ€™t like puzzles and mini-games, this may be a positive aspect for you.  If you struggle with a mini-game, there is an option to skip it.

Achievement hunters will both love and hate this game. On the one hand, [i]Silence[/i] has 46 achievements, giving you plenty to go after. Most Point & Clicks average only 20-30 in a game. It also boasts a nice mix of different types of achievements including ones that are story unlocked, collections, sequence based, repeated action based, and unusual action-dependent based achievements. On the other hand, you cannot get all the achievements in only one playthrough, several achievements are buggy, and thereâ€™s several either-or achievements. If you utilize the checkpoint save feature and a walkthrough/guide, you could probably get all the achievements in two playthroughs. However, youâ€™ll have to complete two whole playthroughs at the minimum, to get them all.  I ended up having to play through many times to reach 100%, and it quickly became tedious.  The good news is that many of the achievements which require multiple things are cumulative over all your playthroughs.

Your first playthrough is likely to take about 9-10 hours. Subsequent playthroughs may be slightly shorter, but not a whole lot due to unskippable cutscenes and dialogue. At full price, that makes this game around $2/hr of playtime if you play through once. Itâ€™s a reasonable price for how much time you get out of it, as long as you enjoy playing the game. This is, unfortunately, one of the games I wish Steam had a â€œmehâ€ rating for.  I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™d really recommend it much except for those who really loved [i]The Whispered World[/i] and want to revisit it in a new adventure. I would warn them though that it's also likely to be a bit of a disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984662640', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1622734499}
review:
If you are a fan of adventure games this one is worth playing; Make sure you play 'A Whispered World' first as this is a sequel.
The 'wiggle the mouse cursor' mechanics are annoying at first, especially if you have a high dpi mouse (I almost run out of screen on multiple occasions) but you soon get used to it.
It has a tragic storyline with two possible endings. Like most Daedalic games there are many achievements if you are bothered about such things.

review: much shorter than the whispered world (ie. the first in this series), very light on puzzling, would class it as more of an adventure than a traditional 'combine various items' point & click .... so so pretty to look at ... our caterpillar companion spot is even more adorable than in the first game - so cute! i loved this ... and perhaps there will be a third in this series (we hope)?? recommended for lovers of cuteness, sweetness, and oh so pretty graphics .... nicely done yet again Daedalic!!
