author: {'steamid': '76561197992694498', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 450, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 538, 'last_played': 1537268319}
review:
[h1]One of the better Deadalic p&c games[/h1]

Silence is a traditional point&click game from Deadalic studios. I always was a fan of the genre but I never got to love Daedalic point&click games and i'm so glad they started making games leaning towards narrative/story driven ones like Pillars of the Earth and State of Mind. I don't know why but there's something in their point&click games that I can't enjoy them. But Silence is one of the better ones.

You travel to a another world where weird creatures live. You meet some companions, friends and foes and try to save the world. The gameplay is pretty standard but I for some reason don't like it. I never liked Daedalic puzzle approach and the whole exploration aspect. I can't even fully explain why. I loved the story of Edna and Harvey but I can't find words how much I hated the gameplay. This is better but still feels a bit similar. Puzzles just are not fun because actions take too much time maybe, the pacing seems weird too. Puzzles in this game are better than lets say Memoria (which I hated, I found them boring and too difficult which distracted me from the story). Fortunately this game has a really good emotional story which kept me going.
But we can clearly see this game probably was the first one which started leaning towards story driven games more. The story is heartbreaking and I suggest you to play it just for the story, especially the ending.

Visual character and world design are great too. Characters look really good and they are adorable. Areas you explore are beautiful although the one at the ending was way too annoying. Other than that this game visually is outstanding.

Music is pretty good and at times it was great but voice acting is ok...ish at best. While some characters sound good, others don't sound well. But i'm used to "ok" voice-acting since i play a lot of lower budget games and it's understandable.

A decent point&click game with emotional story for the fans of the genre.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Great story
[*]Good characters
[*]Beautiful world
[/list]
[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Pacing if off
[*]Puzzles are no fun
[*]Ending si annoying (gameplay-wise)
[/list]

[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/32930811-Kosmos%27s-Cosmic-reviews/?appid=704030][h1]Follow my curator page for more[/h1][/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961623887', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1620587891}
review:
While I did enjoy the story and puzzles, i found the game a little shorter than I would have liked for what I paid for it, and ultimately the ending I chose wasn't a satisfactory conclusion I would have liked and having looked it up, I don't think the alternative one is much better. 

The game is a pretty standard point and click, though somewhat simplified over the normal context menu/scumm style approach to a more single click, things only have one interaction approach. It does have an interesting mechanic with the companion spot. which I though was pretty cool, it would have been nice to have explored that more as its not something that I have seen before.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960615148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1620436845}
review:
I loved The Whispered World 1 with all my heart and Silence is a worthy successor, beautifully written, voiced, with so much love for details.

I enjoyed every second of this experience.
Spot has to be the cutest little buddy ever to exist in a video game. Everything about this game is just charming and the visuals and music are stunning.

Thank you Daedalic for this masterpiece.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994796062', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1597599788}
review:
This game saved my life.

I am 43.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiralling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115820587', 'num_games_owned': 3074, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 330, 'last_played': 1516117616}
review:
Point'n click? Silence c'est la suite de The Whispered World, un des tout premier point'n click de chez Daedalic sorti en 2010. Un jeu que j'avais particuliÃ¨rement apprÃ©ciÃ© Ã  l'Ã©poque parce que assez poÃ©tique et mÃ©lancolique.

+ TrÃ¨s beau, les tableaux sont magnifiques, les personnages 3D bien implÃ©mentÃ©s dans les dÃ©cors, les animations sont bonnes.
+ Musiques agrÃ©ables, le thÃ¨me est plutÃ´t bon.
+ Interface plutÃ´t bien pensÃ©e.
+ Un peu de poÃ©sie quand mÃªme, mais il faut Ãªtre patient.
+ Ã‰nigmes (trop?) logiques
+ SystÃ¨me d'indices paramÃ©trable, excellente idÃ©e.
+ Plein de succÃ¨s Ã  la con qui poussent Ã  essayer un maximum d'interactions.
+ La fin
+ 5h Ã  finir, ouf il Ã©tait temps

- Aucune originalitÃ©, tout est prÃ©visible et a Ã©tÃ© dÃ©jÃ  fait mille fois.
- C'est niais.
- Narration pas toujours claire, certains passages s'enchainent sans explications.
- TrÃ¨s peu d'Ã©nigmes, toutes trop simples Ã  mon avis.
- Pas de possibilitÃ© de skipper les cinÃ©matiques.
- Pas de sauvegarde manuelle, et les auto se font uniquement lors des temps de chargement. Ultra frustrant quand on quitte le jeu aprÃ¨s une cinÃ©matique de 5mn et qu'on doit tout se retaper.
- Personnages tÃªtes Ã  claques.
- Des ** de QTE dans un point'n click?!
- Le cul entre 2 chaises, j'ai envie de dire que c'est un jeu prÃ©vu pour les petiots mais en mÃªme temps je n'y laisserai pas jouer mon gamin.

Pas terrible donc. Silence c'est un peu la merde enrobÃ©e dans un papier d'or. Vraiment splendide visuellement, mais trÃ¨s ennuyeux. Ã€ prendre comme un dessin-animÃ©, ou comme un (joli) Telltale (Ã§a reste cependant un bon cran au dessus d'un Telltale en terme de gameplay).

author: {'steamid': '76561197980176939', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1615334581}
review: Disclaimer: I played for 0.2 hrs before deciding to judge this game. I'm sure the story is some sort of heart warming tale, but I can not deal with how slow paced and boring it is. I like slow paced games that can keep my attention, this is not one of them. I was already bored by the time the opening scene was half over. I got the the shadow puppets and noped out. The game has a clunky feel to it. Like it's a college project or something. The writing is kinds of crap too. "I didn't mean to scare you"? Yeah, you did and you were right to do so. It's a freakin war. She should be scared to leave the bunker. Clicking on an object puts you into a mini cut scene feeling thing of exposition about socks that is pretty annoying. The illusion of choice in the dialogue felt utterly pointless. The character didn't even say what I chose. Should have been left out of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076705047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 1248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1248, 'last_played': 1614290403}
review:
A brilliant, emotional, heart-wrenching story about a brother and sister doing their best to grow up in a war-torn country. It's about the unbridled creativity of a child's mind and the beauty and tragedy of escapism. 

The graphics are nicely stylized. there are barely any mechanics to speak of per se, but they are not needed either as the story is your main driving factor and the game is wise enough not to put anything else that can distract you from it. 

There's no need to say anything more about it. If you want a story that can test your resilience to tearing up, try this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198241192086', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 232, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 710, 'last_played': 1613296417}
review:
Silence ist kein klassisches Adventure, d.h. eher wenige und einfache RÃ¤tsel, kein Inventar und kein frÃ¶hliches Kombinieren... das hat mich aber nicht gestÃ¶rt. Es kommt mehr wie ein Telltale-Game rÃ¼ber, fÃ¼r mich ok. Insgesamt hat mir das Spiel wirklich gut gefallen. 

AtmosphÃ¤re:
Leider weniger AtmosphÃ¤re als in Teil 1. Teil 1 hat es geschafft mit jedem Kapitel eine eigene Stimmung bei mir zu erzeugen und eine entsprechende AtmosphÃ¤re aufzubauen. Hier ist die AtmosphÃ¤re nahezu gleich Ã¼ber das gesamte Spiel. Dennoch schÃ¶ne Musik, gute graphische Darstellung. Die besten Screens und immersivsten Momente kommen hier allerdings in den letzten 30 min des Games, genau davon hÃ¤tte ich mehr gewollt. 

Story:
SchÃ¶ne Story, aber leider sehr vorhersehbare Handlung, kein Spannungsaufbau. Es hat eine komplette deutsche Synchro, was das Erleben der Story sehr angenehm macht. 

Charaktere:
Flache Charaktere, die bekommen Ã¼berhaupt keine Geschichte. Nur Renie gefÃ¤llt mir in dem Kontext. Selbst Noah/Sadwick kommt fÃ¼r mich zu flach rÃ¼ber. 
Insgesamt mochte ich Renie sehr und Spot ist auch sÃ¼ÃŸ. Shana ist super dargestellt, auch wenn ihr Auftritt kurz ist. 
Aber: Das ist nicht Sadwick - so gar nicht! Seine Charakterdarstellung ging fÃ¼r mich gar nicht. 

Spielzeit und Technisches:
Mit knapp 6 Stunden recht kurz und es bleibt auch so viel offen, wo noch Potenzial gewesen wÃ¤re. 
Es gibt keine eigene SpeichermÃ¶glichkeit, nur Auto-Save - echt mies. 
Diese langen Ladescreens nerven so hart. Sie dauern sooooo lang. Immer wieder. Und wieder. Ahhhhhhh!!!
Mies auch, dass das verbuggte Achievement 'Guter ZuhÃ¶rer' bis heute nicht gefixt wurde.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034348551', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1613343993}
review:
Pros:
-Gorgeous game. It's really, really beautiful, the designers clearly poured their heart into the art. If you are into lovely art, this game might be worth playing for the aesthetics alone.
-Pleasant music. Artistically speaking, this is a very good game.

Cons:
-Unskippable cutscenes. Seriously, how the hell does any modern game come with unskippable cutscenes? Slow and long to boot. It's extra irritating because there are no manual saves, and the game saves automatically before the cutscenes, so you are forced to rewatch them every time you come back to play.
-No manual saves. You want to grab that achievement you missed in the middle of the game, or replay a cute part? Too bad. Gotta start over from scratch. And again, you can't skip cutscenes, so it's a long way to go. 
-Extremely flat voice acting, especially for the little girl. The only character who has actual personality and emotion in their delivery is the warrior girl. Unfortunately, said personality and emotion boil down to treating everybody around her like crap.
-A tiny cast of shallow and/or unlikeable characters. Even if you start warming up to any of them (I ended up kinda liking the bulky guy), it ultimately doesn't matter because you are explicitly told from the beginning that they are not real and that going home will erase them. This isn't presented as a moral dilemma either (like "is it right to go home if it means erasing Silence?"), the only hesitation comes from the bond between the siblings, the rest of the cast is always treated as casually expendable.
-Little to no freedom to explore or experiment. You don't even have an inventory.
-Dialogues are neither funny nor interesting, and in some cases they are actively painful (like in the rock song).
-Very unsatisfying endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345553779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 670, 'last_played': 1610816975}
review:
[h1]Solides, kindgerechtes Click-Adventure[/h1] 

Silence is eigentlich der Nachfolger von "The Whispered World", aber so wie ich sollten auch andere Speiler kein Problem haben, der Story zu folgen, denn alles Wichtige Ã¼ber den ersten Besuch des Waisenjungen Noah in dieser Fantasiewelt "Silence" erfÃ¤hrt man am Anfang bzw. durch GesprÃ¤che im Spiel. Die Spielzeit betrÃ¤gt um die 7h, wer auf Achievements aus ist, sollte mindestens zwei DurchlÃ¤ufe einplanen. Ich persÃ¶nlich fand, die Geschichte hÃ¤tte etwas lÃ¤nger sein kÃ¶nnen, zumal ein nicht unerheblicher Teil des Spiels aus Filmsequenzen besteht, wo man gar nichts zu tun hat. Die Anzahl der RÃ¤tsel ist also Ã¼berschaubar.

"Silence" ist einfach zu bedienen, eine Maus reicht vollkommen aus. Trotz dieser spartanischen Bedienung hat man nicht das GefÃ¼hl, das ewas fehlt, auch, weil man auf ein exzessives, zu durchwÃ¼hlendes Inventar (Rucksack o.Ã¤.) analog zu anderen Spielen verzichtet hat. Passend dazu sind auch die Aufgaben in "Silence" einfach bis mittelschwer, und die Hilfe (mittlere Maustaste oder Leertaste) blendet verfÃ¼gbare Aktionspunkte auf dem Bildschirm und/oder einen Hinweis ein (konfigurierbar).

Da das Spiel nicht gewaltfrei ist â€“ Messer und Bomben kommen nicht nur in der Kriegswelt der Rahmenhandlung vor â€“ ist es fÃ¼r kleine Kinder trotzdem ungeeignet.

An vielen Stellen im Spiel hat der Spieler die MÃ¶glichkeit, eine Entscheidung zu treffen. Oftmals ist es fÃ¼r den Fortgang der Geschichte vÃ¶llig egal, welche Option mal wÃ¤hlt, manchmal (recht offensichtlich, wann) ist es aber eine Entscheidung zwischen Leben und Tod. Ja, man kann in diesem Spiel gelegentlich sterben, aber selbst dann wird man nach kurzer Wartezeit auf den letzten Speicherpunkt zurÃ¼ckgesetzt,

Ach ja, Stichpunkt Wartezeit: Das Warten mit schwarzem Bildschirm beim Szenenwechsel nervt. Neist dauert es 10s, selbst wenn man den gleichen Raum bzw. die gleiche Szene gerade zuvor erst betreten hatte. Und ich habe eine schnelle SSD! Ansonsten gibt die Performance keinen Grund zur Klage, selbst mit einer etwas schwÃ¤cheren GeForce 1050 Ti im Notebook habe ich 60fps (mit Panel synchronisiert).

Die Grafik selbst ist gefÃ¤llig und zum Spiel passend in einer Art Malstil gehalten, also nicht fotorealistisch. (Aber deutlich ansprechender die vom VorgÃ¤nger!) Die Szenen wirken durch leichte Bewegungen der Wolken, Staubpartikel, Dunstwolken oder auch der gerade inaktiven Personen sehr lebendig und sind auch sonst eine Augenweide. Etwas schade ist, dass nur 16:9-Modi zur VerfÃ¼gung stehen, auf meinem 16:10-Bildschirm habe ich schwarze Balken unten und oben. Immerhin bleibt das SeitenverhÃ¤ltnis konstant, da stÃ¶rt das nicht.
Auch die Musik ist nicht schlecht, wenngleich nicht gerade mit Ohrwurmhits.

Bugs oder Probleme hatte ich bisher keine.
Die Achievements sind ziemlich viele, darunter etliche, die man beim Durchspielen sicher bekommt, einige recht dumme (Lasse den Furzpilz 10 furzen â€“ eher was fÃ¼r dressierte Affen) und einige anspruchsvolle, die den Begriff Errungenschaften wirklich verdient haben.

FÃ¼r  Kinder ab ca. 12 Jahren und erwachsene Fantasy-Fans mit kindlichem GemÃ¼t gut geeignet.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993855291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 364, 'playtime_forever': 449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1608288452}
review:
I had a nice time playing this game! Point and click games tend to be difficult with near impossible action to deduct using 76 points in a precise order that doesn't seem logic...Here it makes sense, you know how to move forward, you know what to do, when, where...
The story is kind of weird, and it looks like there was another game before that or maybe it's just part of the story, but still I loved the atmosphere, design, concept...
The music is not major but it's adapted to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053532460', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1606535150}
review:
Precursor for this review, I did NOT play the whispered world, I understand that this is a sequel so I am likely missing some or a lot of context for the rest of the game.

Silence is a nice cut short game but unfortunately falls short with dialogue options that wind up having the character saying something completely different usually something quite nice like "ask about the big bang theory" then comes out "eat shit and fuck the big bang theory" this made the characters feel really estranged to me, Also not helped by the story being really predictable but not very engaging. made me not care for them as much which since the ending SPOILERS: has a heavy emphasis on death and letting go of those people, but since I feel disconnected from the characters that are dying I can't bring myself to feel anything for them. The ending felt authentic but unfortunately everything beforehand kind of betrays it.

Concluding, great potential, would love to see what the team could do with a better story, not to say this story is the bad, but not very good either just fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261767211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1605786020}
review: Played the first Sadwick game almost a decade ago! and loved it! This one is no exception! The ending is quite deep for a cartoonish looking point and click. The puzzles aren't that hard though, but the art style is just gorgeous! definitely recommended!

review:

Soundtrack was the best part of the game very chill, nice little time water if your interested

author: {'steamid': '76561198101314886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2198, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1411, 'last_played': 1635565633}
review: Really wish there were more games like this one. I hope the developers continue to make games as beautiful and interesting as this one, as well as other series like Deponia. As someone who loves playing point and click games, this one is easily one of the best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010077003', 'num_games_owned': 500, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1604164019}
review:
3/5
Probabilmente questo gioco ha deluso o sorpreso molti di quella che l'hanno giocato conoscendo il predecessore. Se da un lato Ã¨ infinitamente piÃ¹ appagante dal punto di vista grafico, dall'altro non Ã¨ la classica avventura grafica Daedalic, ma un ibrido tra un'avventura grafica e un'avventura dinamica con tanto di movimenti del mouse per spostare oggetti o stare in equilibrio. Gli enigmi sono infatti molto facili, non essendoci praticamente un inventario e decine di oggetti da combinare, bensÃ¬ solo 4 o 5 interazioni per schermata che comunque non sono mai piÃ¹ di due o tre. Del resto come scritto sembra quasi un film di animazione di Hollywood, la storia regge bene pur ricalcando quella del precedente e nonostante i personaggi ne siano anche a conoscenza. Probabilmente quindi se fosse stata un'avventura grafica piÃ¹ in stile della precedente sarebbe stato un'ottimo titolo, invece, sebbene apprezzi il coraggio, non mi ha entusiasmato la sfida degli enigmi.
Nel complesso consigliato comunque per l'originalitÃ , ma solo in sconto e secondo me Ã¨ necessario conoscere il predecessore per apprezzarlo in pieno.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996355644', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1610224971}
review: pretty fun

author: {'steamid': '76561198035734731', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1479482640}
review: This game is beautiful and has some good ideas but the gameplay is so easy that it's virtually non-existent and the game is so short that it's over before you even started. If you want to play a game only for the experience this is a game for you, but if you loved the first Whispered World for the world building and interesting puzzles you should just leave this one alone.

review:
Silence est un jeu adorable, magnifiquement rÃ©alisÃ© et bien colorÃ© malgrÃ© les thÃ¨mes sombres abordÃ©s. Les personnages y sont attachants, et Spot est un Ã©lÃ©ment relativement original pour rÃ©soudre des Ã©nigmes (puisqu'il peut adopter trois formes de base et en "dÃ©bloquer" certaines Ã  certains passages de jeu). 

Cependant, qualifier ce jeu de point'n'click Ã  proprement parler serait mensonger, il ressemble plus Ã  une sorte de livre interactif qu'Ã  un vÃ©ritable jeu d'aventure. Les Ã©nigmes sont simples, et se rÃ©solvent facilement. 
Les choix de dialogue n'influent malheureusement pas du tout sur le scÃ©nario, seule une fin alternative vous sera proposÃ©e Ã  la toute derniÃ¨re scÃ¨ne du jeu, selon ce que vous dÃ©cidez de faire. 

En point nÃ©gatif, ce jeu est court, trop court. A peine 3h en prenant biiiien mon temps pour tout explorer, et pour rÃ©soudre les Ã©nigmes. Cependant, n'aurait-il pas Ã©tÃ© trop rÃ©pÃ©titif s'il avait plus long ?

author: {'steamid': '76561197990090707', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1600445775}
review:
Finished Silence.

Silence is an adventure and the successor of The Whispered World. After an airstrike, you wake up in the land of Silence. In this, a false queen claimed reign who sent her Seekers to search for the splinter of the mirror in the throne room. This splinter is said to have magical powers. The false queen needs this splinter to claim her final power. You play Noah/Sedwick and Renie, his sister, to find your way in Silence. You join the rebellion against the false queen, find the splinter and try to get back into your own world.

Silence is a decent adventure, though the "adventure"-parts are very, very reduced: there is basically zero inventory, resulting in very limited interaction options. The main process is simply to click on the hot spots and see the story evolving. As such, the demands of the game are very, very low. It plays rather more like an interactive movie.

The story continues the theme of The Whispered World meaning: it beautiful, melancholic, sad and adorable at the very same time. Though the game is over in a couple of hours. The game does not bear any real challenges and thus lacks to deliver any feeling of success or mastery on some "riddles".

Pros:
* Nice story (with a bitter ending though).
* Gorgeous graphics.
* Cute Renie.

Cons:
* Only one save game.
* Very short gameplay.
* Underwhelming riddles.

7/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561199067528726', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 477, 'last_played': 1600325603}
review: This is a beautiful game with a good story line. If you haven't played The whispered world first, I highly recommend it since this game is a sequel and will help with the story and some of the references that it brings up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969961000', 'num_games_owned': 301, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 352, 'last_played': 1597581252}
review:
[h1] Silence: The Whispered World 2 Review [/h1]

I've played the first game a long time ago, it was nice though I'll admit, didn't remember much of it until I started playing this one.

Now, [b]Silence[/b] is beautiful point & click adventure game with nicely drawn characters, good voice acting and a lovely story.

It also got a very simplistic view on gameplay, there is no real inventory and everything is basically done with a click on either the right, left or middle (scroll) buttons of the mouse.

Unlike most point & clicks though, there are sequences in [b]Silence[/b] where your characters can die, there are also very few choices with actual consequences but the few that are there are pretty big decisions.

I'll also want to point out that I really loved the character of [b]Spot[/b], absulutely adorable.

That said, the lack of regular save options and the reliance on checkpoint is a sore spot for me because it means that in order to complete all game achievements you actually need to re-play the game from the start at least 2 more times, a regular save system with save slots, even a limited one whould have allowed for achievement hunting more efficiently and more comfortably, without having to replay through unnecessary parts of the game.

The ingame hint system is also nice but it's also way too easy to use to a point that some may get used to relying on it, I found myself using it even when I didn't need it just because it was a click away and was one with the option to show hotspots, separate buttons for hotspots and hints whould have been better in my opinion.

Overall, I really enjoyed playing [b]Silence: The Whispered World 2[/b] and I think it's a real gem that I'd recommend to any adventure gamer out there.

[b][u]PROS:[/u][/b]

[list]
    [*]Good Visuals
    [*]Excellent voice acting
    [*]Simple gameplay
    [*]Good story
    [*]Good, balanced difficulity level
    [*]Hint System
[/list]

[b][u]CONS:[/u][/b]

[list]
    [*]Save system based on checkpoint, no manual saves
    [*]You can die sometimes
    [*]Hint System
[/list]

[b]Overall Score:[/b] 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198014698888', 'num_games_owned': 924, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1596922633}
review:
This is the first point & click adventure game I've enjoyed enough to finish in a long time.  This game features a captivating story and some great animations to accompany it.  The point & click puzzles are very light and serve more as a means to keep you engaged as the story is told rather than the primary mechanic to keep you engaged.  I personally really enjoyed that I didn't have to spend hours clicking on every item in a scene to hear some trite dialog and instead was able to keep the story moving rather quickly.  Many point & click fans may find this to be a detriment, though, as there really aren't any meaningful or difficult puzzles.

Big aspect I did not appreciate is an unnecessary use of profanity throughout the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995596423', 'num_games_owned': 1765, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1595864933}
review:
[i]Silence[/i], like [i]The Whispered World[/i] before it, is a compensatory fairy-tale and, like all compensatory fairy-tales, has a strong undertone of tragedy beneath its colourful, happy-go-lucky fantasy. A powerful and well played metaphor for the tragedy underlining the gleeful world of Silence is Sadwick, â€œthe tragic clownâ€, â€œthe clown that never laughedâ€, [i]The Whispered World[/i]â€™s depressive protagonist and also a central character in [i]Silence[/i]. But, unlike in the first game, which had to carefully and subtly build up for the big reveal at the end, here the storyâ€™s compensatory nature is made explicit from the very beginning and the fact that you know it and the game doesnâ€™t have to restrain itself in order to conceal it makes it ten times better and allows for some moments of unbridled creativity and adventure game design brilliance that arenâ€™t usually possible when the developers constrain themselves, confining their creativity within the boundaries of building a â€œproperâ€ story. Although it has its share of plot twists and big reveals, the story in [i]Silence[/i] is only sketched in thin lines and the developersâ€™ imagination runs freely, creating many memorable moments of pure adventure happiness. Like, for example, the episode with the psychedelic flowers or when Rennie dives among the clouds with moth Spot at her side, which is so gratuitous and surreal, so out of context and unrelated to the already darkening plot that you immediately sense it for what it is: the last moment of serene, overplayed happiness, before the unavoidable tragedy sets in. A moment of pure joy, when you know tragedy is closer than ever, you feel it lurking in the background, youâ€™re aware that the game is softening a terrible blow which you are already beginning to feel in your stomach, but youâ€™re happy all the same. Youâ€™re flying with Spot through the clouds and youâ€™re unreservedly happy in that fleeting moment, you wish for it to last a little bit longer and youâ€™re grateful that the game offered it to you before dragging you through the bitter ending.
 
I loved [i]Silence[/i] for many reasons, but I especially loved it for that moment which is one of the finest adventure games can craft and offer these days.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165722536', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1593376730}
review:
I would like to love this game, as I love Daedalic games, and it has some good moments in it. However, there are certain aspect that really disappointed me.

Pros.
- technically well made (graphics, music, animations, sounds, etc)
- joypad support
- Renie and Spot are so cute

Cons.
- oversimplified puzzles
- game is too short

What triggered me: (Spoilers ahead)
- the game is a direct sequel to "The whispered world" (which was... well, not so accessible, but in the end it delivered a good plot). However, instead of building upon a new idea, this game spends its short time by making the characters remind you how good the prequel was.
- the ending is identical to the prequel, and the characters have been telling you about this since the beginning of the game.

in the end this feels more like a reboot than a full new game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025716472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 536, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 536, 'last_played': 1593427619}
review:
The problems are simple 
- There's only about 3 actual puzzles in the whole game. The rest is a matter of click here, click there, with very little actual deduction required. This is exacerbated by the lack of inventory screen; instead the uber-modern context-sensitive controls will automatically prompt the use of each item on whatever thing you need to use it on, just to provide maximum assurance that you won't have to think for yourself at any point.
- One of the main characters is a little girl who you're clearly meant to think is sooo cute and find the sight of her getting upset to be so emotionally distressing that it provides you all the motivation you need to save the day. Unfortunately, she does not have this effect due to her voice actor, who is probably an actual child so I don't want to be too harsh, but she barely seems to understand the words that she's saying, resulting in most of her lines being read in a flat, emotionless manner that just makes her kinda annoying.
- The ending is pretty much just a retread of the ending to The Whispered World. There's actually two endings to choose from, but you don't really learn anything new. You're clearly meant to see both in order to get the full picture, but to me that somewhat lessens the impact of them both. One of them could be interpreted as a sequel hook, but sadly I'm not sure I care enough anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052510862', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 469, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1592590292}
review:
The Whispered World Ã¨ stata una ag classica che piÃ¹ classica non si piÃ¹. SIlence, che ne Ã¨ il seguito in qualche modo, Ã¨ un gioco di totale rottura anche da quelli che erano gli standard di Daedalic di allora. Fu un esperimento, secondo me in parte riuscito, di cercare di inserire dinamicitÃ  visiva e regia alle classiche avventure punta e clicca. Dove il cliccare non doveva essere necessariamente riferito al semplice raccogli l'oggetto ma anche ad azioni contestuali o di "movimento". Era un po lo stile delle prime avventure di Telltale, che avevano azzeccato la formula rimanendo fedeli ad un discorso di gameplay ma con un movimento generale della parte visiva che dava dinamicitÃ  al tutto, rendendo le opere molto piÃ¹ televisive. 
Silence nel particolare Ã¨ anche bello da vedere se si considerano gli anni e i limiti produttivi di Daedealic. Bello nel senso che le atmosfere, le scene, i set, sono ben concepiti e molto fiabeschi. La parte finale Ã¨ molto dinamica visivamente e mi Ã¨ piaciuta tantissimo. Secondo me questo era un modello da ripercorrere. Forse rende le ag piÃ¹ semplici Ã¨ vero, ma di certo le rende meno anacronistiche. 
Atmosfera, magia, sentimenti ed emozioni in un'esperienza anche angosciante e tetra. Bello. Ovviamente non privdi difetti ma bello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096980945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1592063450}
review:
Incredibly beautiful and incredibly sad! Also tons of cute and funny moments! The visuals are amazing, outstanding cutscenes and most adorable characters; you're going to meet the cutest caterpillar-puppy in the whole world! The gameplay is easy enough, just try-and-error, so the game feels more like an interactive movie. That said, it's ten times better (both visually and story-wise) than your average Hollywood movie.
This is the sequence to the Whispered World, you kind of need to play that in advance to understand the whole story. The Whispered World was also cute 'though not quite as stunning and I felt a little depressed playing it, because the main character is always sad. Playing Silence I had tears in my eyes at the beginning and in the end... But I would definitely recommend it anyway, it's absolutely gorgeous and in between it was funny and witty...

author: {'steamid': '76561198002134811', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1590550748}
review: Silence is quite a beautiful game, with a solid story and good characters. I realized fairly soon after starting that this is actually a sequel to The Whispered World, due to all the references to past events, but even without playing that game the story here can stand on its own. It does still kind of assume you've played the first game, with some characters being introduced for the first time like they're old buddies of yours, which can be a bit weird. Regardless, what we have here is a nice narrative adventure that doesn't take very long to finish at all. Puzzles are mostly very easy, as I think the modern attention span no longer supports trying to decode some obscure logic and making no headway for hours. This lets the focus settle mainly on the story, characters, and visuals. For all the establishing of characters though, the game pretty much ends right as you're getting more invested. A lot of production value went into making this game, so I understand why it's limited in scope, but it's still a bit disappointing that it wasn't a little longer. Still, if you're looking for a pleasing and bite-sized adventure game to spend a few hours on, this would be worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020875095', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 444, 'last_played': 1650891658}
review:
While not really a classic point and click adventure game, I did enjoy it, especially since I had just finished its older and much more complicated brother, "The Whispered World", so all the characters were fresh in my mind. 
The graphics are really pretty but unfortunately the game is quite short and it doesn't have many different areas to explore. It has 2 different endings, similar to the first game. 
In terms of gameplay, you don't have any inventory, so the gameplay consists in mostly clicking stuff and hoping you click on the right thing. Do I recommend it? Yes. But keep in mind I do like walking simulators and all that, so I don't mind a game that's light (read that doesn't really have any) on puzzles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069602281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1589548272}
review: Beautiful game.  It works on many levels,.  On one it is cute, playful and endearing, but there are deeper issues to do with love, death, war, bonding and survival which can feel confronting .  I loved the game but felt uneasy at the end, perhaps influenced by recent health lockdown requirements and other real life situations.  It is well worth the time to explore though.  A gem for your library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067750196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1588903553}
review: Silence is a beautiful game and is also quite imaginative. Going from the grim world to the fantasy land that is Silence was interesting. Especially since the brother has been there before. Spot the worm is a bizarre but neat tool to make the puzzles more varied. The story line is interesting, though I must say some of the characters make me wonder how they will ever save the world. lol. Very enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045739251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1588189298}
review: Cute game! I played the first game years ago and loved it so much. It was one of my favorites.  This was beautifully done.  I don't think I like it as much as the first, but definitely love it.  Great story!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080695835', 'num_games_owned': 334, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1588110217}
review: This game was not anything like I expected it to be. It was so heartfelt and gorgeous. I loved every second of it. This is one of the few games I have played all the way through in one sitting. BEAUTIFUL. I enjoyed the puzzled and the interactions and all of the characters. So happy I purchased this game and can't wait to play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053561676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 485, 'last_played': 1590120581}
review: Hm, can't really recommend this game. The game really is short, that's not always a bad thing. However, I did check to make sure I wasn't playing the demo. This game to me feels and plays more like a demo of a potentially larger game.  By the time you meet all the main characters to start the this great adventurous journey, the game comes to its ending scenes, make some choices, thank you for playing, role credits, done.  Kind of like this review, short and done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198440309009', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 848, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1586549877}
review:
[h1] Silence, The Whispered World 2  [/h1]
The game will be played from 3 diffrent perspective, for one from a little girls, 
for the second from a teenage boys and lastly from a little green creatures. 
This game has no inventory like in most other Daedalic point&click games, this is neither good nor bad,
because in most other Daedalic games there are inventories which can be filled with 20 items
and this can be annoying to find out what you can do with them.
[h3] Pros: [/h3]
[list]
[*] [b] Interesting Puzzles and Minigames[/b]
[code] For once it's something new: Balancing minigame, pulling things to the side minigame, etc.
Puzzles are not challenging, but neither boring[/code][/list]
[h3] Cons: [/h3]
[*] [b] Mostly the generic point & clicking[/b]
[code] When it comes to the P&C it's overall the same thing for 2 decades...
There are multiple P&C games each year coming out, but in the end (beside the story) it felt just being the same[/code][/list]
[h3] Informativ: [/h3]
[*] [b] Beautiful Visuals and World, but...[/b]
[code] Gorgeous world and characters are decent animated, but at some locations you have these big creatures
and the best thing to let them look like their moving is to move/stretch outlines[/code][/list]
[h2] Verdict: [/h2]
In conclusion a good game, but in the end it's just your usual point & click adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116198783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1584683843}
review:
I've played so many of Daedalic's games, and some of them rank among my favorite Point-n-Click titles. I was very excited when this game was announced, and I struggled to wait for it to go on sale for a price I could swallow. 

The visuals in this game are stunning, and I loved the art. I kept getting distracted staring at some of the details of Renie's costume, and it was a treat to see. And the story was the sort of heart tugging content that you would expect from the developer.

BUT.... but... from what I hear, sacrifices had to be made to cover the hefty price tag of producing this game, with its stunning visuals. And that sacrifice was the very thing that makes me love Daedalic's titles:  engaging  puzzles and story rich content.

Now, if you're not a fan of the point n click genre, then this review might not mean anything to you, and you might actually greatly enjoy the game. 
But if you are a fan, keep reading:
 
This title has done away with player inventory--instead, if you pick something up, it is automatically applied if you interact with something related. And areas/interactions were greatly limited (excepting the time exploring the town, which was a highlight). Essentially, it was so easy to 'solve' game puzzles, that it felt more like playing a visual novel, rather than actually solving anything. And I really missed that. (I left the game running in the background quite a bit, but my actual playtime must have been less than 2hrs). 

In addition to restricting available areas to explore/engage in, the story seems like it was significantly pared down. There were all these lovely character designs, and I loved their initial impressions. Daedalic is wonderful at making you care about characters. Hell--the animation/quirks of Spot are enough to make you love him. But the characters are cut short. The story scratches a surface and brings up questions, but then it ends--it surprised me, how quickly it happened. 

As much as I loved, loved, loooooooved the visuals of this game... the simple truth is I would trade them for a full story and actual point-n-click puzzles. I missed those. I really missed them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014321545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1583873472}
review:
I'm only recommending this game because it seems rude to give it a bad review after all the work that has gone into the graphics.

But the actual game is aimed at children new to point and click genre ... not adults. The puzzles were far too easy and it's a very short game.
Only buy if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063209433', 'num_games_owned': 601, 'num_reviews': 236, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1581626098}
review:
It seems point&click adventures can still be enjoyable even in 2020 - or at least Silence definitely is. Great above-average fantasy story, interesting puzzles and excellent voice-acting. Typical Daedalic art style. If you're into story-based games and don't mind point&click adventures, then this is something you should give a try to.
It's not a demanding game so I was able to play it on my second low-power laptop just fine.
Also, works perfectly with a Steam Controller.

review:
Buena avent. grÃ¡fica sin tener que recurrir a los cansinos minijuegos de encontrar objetos a los que tantos otros juegos recurren demasiado. De las mejores que he jugado, y he jugado a unas cuantas! Historia interesante, pero hacia el final no se sabe bien que es lo que hace el espejo.. En este punto lo recomiendo encarecidamente.

Logros: tiene un par, Sherlock Holmes y Oyente Fiel, que se tienen que jugar con controlador SÃ o SÃ, sino no te los da como vÃ¡lidos. el problema estÃ¡ en que la acciÃ³n de mover objetos, se bloquea constantemente con el Controlador y tienes que darle a "Cargar Ãºltimo punto de control", como 3-4veces a Cargar en cada movimiento, hasta que te deja moverlo (por un bug, supongo). Es muy molesto >_<.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090017341', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1582241869}
review:
Kurze Info vorab: Ich habe weder Deponia noch andere Teile der Entwickler gespielt sondern direkt mit Silence gestartet. Viele hier sprechen ja davon, dass dies ein Nachfolger zu einem vorherigen Spiel ist. Aus meiner Sicht ist das Spiel alleinstehend schon fantastisch und kann ohne Probleme gespielt werden auch wenn man die anderen Spiele nicht kennt. 
Also:
Gestern angespielt (daher die kurze Spielzeit) aber schon innerhalb der ersten 10 Minuten so begeistert gewesen, dass mir klar war: Diesem Spiel musst du einfach ein Review schreiben.

Die Musik in diesem Spiel ist wundervoll, eine permanente GÃ¤nsehaut ist garantiert! 
Der eigentliche Grund wieso ich so schnell dazu geneigt war ein positives Feedback zu geben ist Folgendes:
Bisher hat noch kein Spiel geschafft mir bereits wÃ¤hrend des Intros (oder eigentlich generell) TrÃ¤nen in die Augen schieÃŸen zu lassen. Ich gebe zu, nach dem emotionalen Intro brauchte ich dann direkt mal eine Pause. 

Nach nur einem Kapitel von dreien  kann ich natÃ¼rlich noch nicht viel Ã¼ber die Story sagen.
Es ist ein Point&Click Spiel mit wirklich schÃ¶nen Grafiken und absolut sympatischen Hauptcharakteren.
Zwei Geschwister versuchen die Stadt Silence zu retten und haben dabei Ihren kleinen Freund Spot dabei. Es gilt kleine, einfache RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen bei denen sich die Entwickler wirklich einige schÃ¶ne Details ausgedacht haben.
Objekte mehrfach anzuklicken (auch mit verschiedenen charakteren) kann sich lohnen (besonders fÃ¼r Achievments)

Wer Lust auf eine schÃ¶n gestaltete Story mit vielen witzigen und absolut niedlichen kleinen Ãœberraschungen hat sollte diesem Spiel eine  Chance geben! Ich werde mich nachher auf jeden Fall wieder dransetzen und es sicher fÃ¼r die Achievments auch Ã¶fter spielen. 

Update folgt =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041521475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1582282753}
review:
Veramente molto carino: una storia a tratti spensierata e giocosa con immancabili gag imbarazzanti, ma anche a tratti a volte tristi e malinconici.
Come storia, anche se sembrano essere presenti tante scelte, alla fine si riducono solo a modificare i dialoghi subito successivi, quindi volgarmente parlando stiamo parlando di un gioco su binari in piena regola; solo la scelta finale effettivamente serve a cambiare la storia, selezionando tra due finali uno piÃ¹ malinconico dell'altro (uno specialmente sarÃ  in grado di far venire giÃ¹ una lacrimuccia ai giocatori piÃ¹ sensibili), ma comunque entrambi molto azzeccati con la storia.
Se alla fine, la trama vi risulta un po'senza senso, fate finta che questa sia una storia raccontata da una bambina . . .
Consigliato ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198025267880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1579991820}
review:
Silence is a sequel, though it really doesn't need to be. It's a sequel to The Whispered World, (which is a game that I watched the trailer years ago but didn't actually want to play.) The framing device at the beginning of the game sets you up to the conceit of the game, which is a world created by dreaming. That's all you really need to know, so when characters seem to recognize other people and places from the first game, you just have to think "yeah, it's a dream. Everyone just knows stuff in their dreams" and you move on. Otherwise, this game could completely stand on its own. 

In general, it's a short (~6 hours for me), but story-rich point and click adventure game. There's no inventory combining, which sucks a little of the difficulty out of it, and there's not a whole lot of areas where you can move between screens and combine items from different areas, so the challenge level is low. The puzzles are thankfully also not stupidly obtuse, so there's never a moment where you say "Wait, that WORKED? WHY????" Everything makes sense in the game world.

The pros:
+The characters are very distinct and memorable
+You have a sidekick named Spot who is adorable, but who can shapeshift at your command to solve puzzles. Very unique element for a point and click.
+Music is great
+Art is good, especially after watching the trailer for the first game.
+Story is beautiful, sad, sometimes creepy, and what made me want to play the game in the first place after playing the demo.
+Choices! This isn't a Telltale type "the characters will remember this" game, but your choices unlock achievements, which motivates you to play the character differently. There are also some ways you can die, which is not super common anymore since Monkey Island changed that standard, but it restarts you from whatever puzzle can kill you, so you don't have to worry about saving, which is nice.
+The puzzles may not be that hard, but there is a great variety of them. So it's not just "pick up item, use item" ad nauseum. There's balancing on things, using your sidekick to bust open bars, switching between characters

The neutral:
~ I only mention this because I saw some reviews that mention this: Daedalic is a German company. It's not bad lip-syncing...it's dubbed. It's localized. They didn't fail at their job. They're making the game more accessible by having it localized into, like, 5 languages, I think? But whatever, some of the subtitles don't match what the characters are saying occasionally. I don't think it's a big deal, but maybe you might not like the fact that it isn't precision work.

The cons:
- Again, the game is short
- Again, puzzles are not that challenging

Even those cons are not really cons for me for this game. The puzzles are interesting enough but not immersion breaking, and never too out there so that you can focus on the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071461334', 'num_games_owned': 809, 'num_reviews': 304, 'playtime_forever': 190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1579712131}
review:
Okay... so far:
- bad lip sync
- transfer to 3d is not that great IMHO
- game's... pacing (?) feels weird
- lots of loading for a single screen game running from SSD
- not a fan of QTE-like events especially when they are timed
- a lot of scenes have an annoying sound playing on loop
+ rather pretty

Wow, that's not a lot of redeeming qualities.
Dropped it after chapter 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983290992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1579130467}
review:
"Silence" is a game that I really appreciated a lot. Because Daedalic Entertainment finally took some of the complains people had with point-and-click games and made for a game much more pleasant to play - without really breaking the experience for point-and-click puritans who want their games challenging and unforgiving.

Daedalic has in these last years presented itself as one of the last havens for point-and-click games, as the genre felt into obscurity with the rise of 3D gaming. Characters could now roam scenarios more freely, rather than being limited to where you would click. But there's an unique charm in this genre, and Daedalic wanted to preserve that.

The problem with those games, however, is that they could be very cruel to players, often not telling them what their objective even is, and hidding essential tools for progression in places  hard to spot. Not to mention you could have to combine items you would never think of combining. But "Silence" really thinks about all of these issues, as it desires to make for a gaming experience all players can enjoy.

Some would say that, in this regard, "Silence" is a casual game. But if you want to have that pure point-and-click experience, you can perfectly ignore the Space bar (the hint key) - there's even an achievement for that. And if you're stuck and don't know what to do, you can just see what the task at hand is. The game won't just tell you what to do precisely; it rather tells you what your objective is, and it's up to you to figure out how to accomplish it.

The story is beautiful; the game is actually a sequel, and I didn't know that beforehand. But thankfully, not knowing the lore doesn't keep you of having a basic understanding of that world. The characters are truly wonderful, and while they can be easily identifiable archetypes, it doesn't diminish their appeal. The voice acting in general, and for Noah and Renie in particular, is fantastic, albeit the lip synching is faulty (this may be because it's a bilingual game). The story is funny when it wants to be, but it has this tragic aura over it, without ever feeling overly dark - I would rather compare this game to a 80's high fantasy than to a Guillermo del Toro movie.

The 3D scenarios are a sight to sore eyes, and the soundtrack by Tilo Alpermann, a blessing to sore ears. They further immerse players into that world - regardless if they played the first game or not.

But here's for a complain, regarding the technical details (I hate when I have to do this). You have to play the game with the V-Sync off, or you'll be stuck on a globe at the very beginning of the game (curiously enough, this inadvertently granted me an achievement). At peak resolution, subtitles don't appear. But those are minor issues that you can easily remedy in configurations.

I loved this little jewel of a game. This is the first time I truly loved a point-and-click game. It's a point-and-click game for people who don't like the genre, and I can't recommend it enough. Here's for a non-spoiler: when you beat the game, regardless of which ending you'll get, don't skip the credits.

author: {'steamid': '76561198444484176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 439, 'last_played': 1577988996}
review: Silence is deep in story but the gameplay (even knowing it's a point and click game) lacks a lot tbh . Sometimes a bit too roundabout with going back and forth between scenery to get what you need for your "puzzle" and it can get rather slow by always needing to play out every scene again that goes along with an action. Anyhow, the ending quite touched me as well the overall story. Great visuals too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048865490', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1631617526}
review:
It's like a game made by Supergiant games, but with a smaller budget. It has a wonderful artstyle, moving soundtrack and an interesting fantasy world that could be explored. For a point 'n' click adventure game it feels one step above others of its genre - it implements a couple cool gimmicks that enrich the gameplay. However, it falls short when it comes to voice acting and character animation. Some moments it looks good, others - stiff. I found German to have the most fitting voices for each character. No matter what, everyone's delivery still sort of falls short and the timing is often a bit off.

If it wasn't for the off-putting voice acting and a bit more comprehensive lore (often found myself thinking I was playing some sort of sequel, game kept expecting me to just know characters, events), I would really be in love with this game. It's still worth playing even with those flaws. The music, the art and the world are worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991202316', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1575050594}
review:
I haven't finished this game yet, but the initial presentation and story blew me away! This is the sequel to The Whispering World, which I found a chore to complete. I did eventually, and started to play this game. I'm not sure if it is required the play the last one, but there does feel some more gravatus with the story when I knew what happened in the previous game.
There are some dark scenes in this game as well, which causes a weird uncertainty between the whimsical and the dangerous. 

Just having a game where I am uncertain where the game will lead is refreshing regardless of the final destination.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050637112', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1279, 'last_played': 1573287839}
review:
[h1] Daedalic Entertainment Are You Serious? [/h1]

This game is the sequel for Whispering World which was one of my favorite puzzle/adventure games of all times. I was very happy to play this game and was very satisfied with the story,art and music but yes gameplay is super odd where you need to drag all the way to the other edge of your desk with your mouse to push something. The story is also kinda short and endings are pretty vague. And obviously and mostly what really made me angry was the fact that the [b]achievements are bugged[/b] Here i played the same game about 3 times not knowing why on earth im not getting the achievements, and playing all over again thinking that I probably missed something. Then desperately I searched the forums and found out that the achievements were bugged, I tried many many workarounds found in the forums and in the internet. But none worked for me and I'm not a person who would use a software to get achievements.  I tried deleting all my saves and starting all over fbut that never worked either. I heard this is indeed has been reported to the developers but in vain they never did anything about it which is disappointing. Thus,  I cannot recommend this game to any achievement hunter maybe for the story itself I will strongly recommend it to anyone but yeah for the achievements just nope. An incredible waste of my time to be honest and a lot of frustration.

Zagadki sÄ… same w sobie Å‚atwe (nie mamy choÄ‡by okna z ekwipunkiem), a gra podpowiada jeszcze gdzie uÅ¼yÄ‡ jakiego przedmiotu. Moje zaciÄ™cia wynikaÅ‚y tylko i wyÅ‚Ä…cznie z gapiostwa, a nie nieumiejÄ™tnoÅ›ci rozwiÄ…zania zadania. TwÃ³rcy postanowili sztucznie wydÅ‚uÅ¼yÄ‡ tytuÅ‚, dodajÄ…c wzajemnie wykluczajÄ…ce siÄ™ osiÄ…gniÄ™cia, ktÃ³rych skompletowanie wymaga przejÅ›cia gry... co najmniej trzy razy, bo nie moÅ¼na wczytywaÄ‡ zapisÃ³w.

Graficznie niby nie mamy fajerwerkÃ³w... ale poÅ‚Ä…czenie postaci 3D i teÅ‚ 2D wypada zaskakujÄ…co dobrze, a to, co widzimy na monitorze, zapiera dech w piersiach. KreskÃ³wkowe postaci i peÅ‚ne detali dalsze plany sÄ… super! Muzyka jest cudowna - ponura zresztÄ… jak caÅ‚a gra.

"Silence" kupiÅ‚o mnie przede wszystkim historiÄ… i klimatem. Jako gra wypada tak sboie, ale akurat to dla mnie liczy siÄ™ nieco mniej. Polecam raczej osobom, ktÃ³re chcÄ… siÄ™ zrelaksowaÄ‡ i/lub nieco podoÅ‚owaÄ‡, a nie przygodÃ³wkowym wyjadaczom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017033103', 'num_games_owned': 1426, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 470, 'last_played': 1572983334}
review:
While I liked it a bit more than its prequel, it's really disappointing to see that it classic point and click gameplay was dropped for something closer to a Telltale game. The choices don't really matter, the side characters are barely fleshed out and the story is predictable, especially if you've finished the first game.

At least the visuals and the music were flawless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104177230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 569, 'last_played': 1572803591}
review:
"Silence" ist die Fortsetzung von "The Wispered World" und gleichzeitig doch eher ein eigenes Spiel.

Die Geschwister Noah und Renie landen nach einem Bombenangriff in der mysteriÃ¶sen Welt "Silence", die von den "Suchern" der "falschen KÃ¶nigin" geplagt wird. Ein Splitter aus dem Spiegel, den Sadwick in "The Wispered  World" zerbrochen hatte (der auch zur ZerstÃ¶rung dieser Welt gefÃ¼hrt haben sollte) muss gefunden werden, damit jene besiegt werden kann. Sowohl alte, als auch neue Charaktere treten auf. NatÃ¼rlich darf bei diesem Abenteuer das Multitalent Spot nicht fehlen. Dabei sind wunderschÃ¶ne Grafik & Musik von der herzlichen Geschichte [spoiler] mit traurigem Verlauf [/spoiler] nicht trennbar.

Zu Beginn des Spiels bekommen wir von Noah kurz und knapp die Geschichte von Sadwick erzÃ¤hlt. 
AnschlieÃŸend stÃ¼rzen wir uns in das Abenteuer. Gespielt wird mit Noah [spoiler](welcher gegen Ende des Spiel zu Sadwick wird)[/spoiler], Renie und Spot (mit all seinen VerwandlungskÃ¼nsten). 

WÃ¤hrend Sadwick in "The Wispered World" nicht sterben konnte, kann das hier in "Silence" Noah passieren [i] (es gibt sogar eine Errungenschaft dafÃ¼r).[/i] Neu ist auch eine gewisse Entscheidungsfreiheit bezÃ¼glich Dialog und der darauf folgenden Handlung [i] (z.B Verstecken & am Leben bleiben / nicht verstecken & sterben).[/i]
Die RÃ¤tsel sind recht einfach gestrickt. Hier und da muss man ein wenig GrÃ¼beln, kommt aber dann trotzdem auf die LÃ¶sung [i] (die Leertaste kann einem die BÃ¤ume vor lauter Wald zeigen).[/i]

Mir persÃ¶nlich hat "Silence" mehr gefallen als "The Wispered World".
Die Geschichte und die beiden Hauptcharaktere haben mich mehr ergriffen und die Grafik und Musik noch mehr bezaubert.
Ebenso ist die Freude Ã¼ber den Handlungsspielraum bezÃ¼glich Dialog und groÃŸ.
[spoiler] Leider wird die Freude Ã¼ber zwei verschiedene Enden dadurch zur Nichte gemacht, dass beide trotzdem auf das gleiche Ende hinfÃ¼hren. [/spoiler]


Wer gerne Point&Klick Adventures spielt & Daedalic Entertainment mag, wird vermutlich seine Freude an dem Spiel haben.
Ich habe es jedenfalls  genossen :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198256161774', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 306, 'last_played': 1570750247}
review:
Silence Ã  Ã©tÃ© pour moi une expÃ©rience trÃ¨s plaisante. Je ne sais pas vraiment s'il est juste de le qualifier comme un jeu, Ã©tant donnÃ© l'importance de l'histoire comparÃ©e au gameplay. Une bonne partie des actions consiste Ã  faire des choix dans les dialogues, et au niveau des Ã©nigmes, on est loin des point n'click habituels, avec un niveau de rÃ©flexion relativement bas, voire inexistant.

L'atmosphÃ¨re m'a particuliÃ¨rement charmÃ©. CÃ´tÃ© visuel, il me paraÃ®t difficile de trouver Ã§a moche. Les paysages et le traitement des lumiÃ¨res sont superbes. J'ai aussi bien accrochÃ© Ã  la bande sonore avec ses plusieurs titres de piano solo, bien appropriÃ©e Ã  l'ambiance. 

L'histoire m'a Ã©mu. Elle est souvent triste, mais ponctuÃ©e aussi de joie et d'humour. J'ai trouvÃ© touchants les deux personnages principaux et ai bien aimÃ© le fait de les jouer tous les deux pour vivre les aventures de chacun lorsqu'ils se retrouvent sÃ©parÃ©s. N'ayant jouÃ© qu'une seule partie, je ne sais pas l'impact que peuvent avoir nos dÃ©cisions sur le dÃ©roulement du scÃ©nario.   

Les points un peu ennuyeux Ã  mon goÃ»t sont la vitesse de dÃ©placement des protagonistes et les temps de chargement. Pour passer d'un Ã©cran Ã  l'autre, Ã§a m'a pris pas loin de 45 secondes parfois, et ceux-ci ne couvrant pas une large zone, il arrive souvent dans une Ã©nigme de devoir passer de l'un Ã  l'autre, parfois plusieurs fois d'ailleurs, et j'ai trouvÃ© que Ã§a cassait un peu le rythme du jeu. 

Pour une raison inconnue, la plus grande partie des succÃ¨s que j'ai rÃ©alisÃ©s n'ont pas Ã©tÃ© enregistrÃ©s, mais Ã  part Ã§a, aucun bug Ã  dÃ©clarer.

Je conseille Ã  ceux qui cherchent une histoire Ã©mouvante et qui n'ont pas envie de se prendre la tÃªte avec des Ã©nigmes compliquÃ©es. C'est une expÃ©rience d'environ 5h, ce qui fait peut-Ãªtre un peu court pour 20 euros, mais il se trouve assez facilement en promo.

Petit retour sur mon Ã©val aprÃ¨s avoir jouÃ© Ã  The whispered world dont il est le successeur. PremiÃ¨rement, je ne l'ai appris que plus tard, donc oui, Silence est bien la suite d'un autre jeu, et pour ceux qui ont apprÃ©ciÃ© The whispered world, ne vous attendez pas Ã  y voir rÃ©ellement une suite, ce serait plus proche d'un remake. On y retrouve certains protagonistes comme Sadwick et Spot, mais en terme d'Ã©nigmes, Silence est beaucoup, mais alors beaucoup moins fourni. L'accent Ã  plutÃ´t Ã©tÃ© mis sur le visuel, la narration, et la possibilitÃ© de faire des choix. Fondamentalement, la tournure de l'histoire est trÃ¨s ressemblante mais ne vous attendez pas Ã  jouer au mÃªme genre de jeu exactement. 

Merci et bon jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042509103', 'num_games_owned': 445, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 453, 'last_played': 1515026562}
review:
Don't get me wrong, the game's wonderful, graphics are real nice, music is great, etc. You'll find all these things in other reviews for sure :)

Since no one talks about it though: I found the ending really disappointing (and I am not the only one). So I wouldn't recommend it because of that. If, however, you give value to the trip more than to its destination, then you should definitely get this game :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198290445268', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 1249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 504, 'last_played': 1607663410}
review:
Silence Ã© a continuaÃ§Ã£o do jogo The Whispered World sendo um tÃ­pico point-and-click da Daedalic, ou seja, resumidamente sem spoiler Ã© algo com uma histÃ³ria aparentemente bem boba/ingÃªnua que aos poucos torna-se bem mais profunda/madura e Ã s vezes atÃ© sombria, porÃ©m a histÃ³ria de Silence Ã© previsÃ­vel demais (mesmo Ã  aqueles que nÃ£o jogaram o anterior conseguem facilmente entender a trama e pressupor o desfecho).
Outra questÃ£o sobre a histÃ³ria, o jogo comeÃ§a numa pequena cidade sendo bombardeada por aviÃµes na 2Âª guerra mundial, Noah e sua pequena irmÃ£ Renie acabam refugiando-se numa pequeno bunker, Noah comeÃ§a a contar suas aventuras ocorridas no primeiro jogo para entreter sua irmÃ£zinha e de repente ambos estÃ£o em Silence. O problema Ã© que Noah age como um babaca durante todo jogo, seu Ãºnico objetivo Ã© voltar para casa com sua pequena irmÃ£ e para isso acontecer Ã© preciso destruir um espelho que por outro lado irÃ¡ destruir toda Silence, portanto todos em Silence sÃ£o descartÃ¡veis para Noah porque no final das contas todos os habitantes desse mundo irÃ£o morrer quando o espelho for quebrado e mesmo entendendo a situaÃ§Ã£o, vocÃª provavelmente irÃ¡ criar muita antipatia em relaÃ§Ã£o ao protagonista. Acredito que a histÃ³ria teria sido mais interessante caso tivesse sido focada apenas na Renie que Ã© ingÃªnua e nÃ£o compreende aquilo que estÃ¡ acontecendo.
Os grÃ¡ficos, mÃºsicas e efeitos sonoros sÃ£o deslumbrantes e definitivamente sÃ£o o grande destaque, por outro lado sempre que vocÃª trocar de tela acontecera um pequeno loading irritante de alguns segundos (momento tambÃ©m onde o jogo Ã© salvo). Outra questÃ£o Ã© o save automÃ¡tico que acaba atrapalha bastante nas conquistas, portanto serÃ¡ necessÃ¡rio ganhar algumas vezes para poder platinar.

Resumindo, apesar dos grÃ¡ficos e mÃºsicas serem excelentes, nÃ£o gostei tanto da histÃ³ria e Silence ainda Ã© relativamente chato, portanto apesar de nÃ£o ter gostado tanto, Silence nÃ£o merece uma anÃ¡lise negativa porque possui suas qualidades e nÃ£o Ã© um jogo ruim, mas definitivamente nÃ£o estÃ¡ entre meus favoritos Daedalic.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025204938', 'num_games_owned': 2984, 'num_reviews': 489, 'playtime_forever': 276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1568790817}
review:
A vast improvement over the first in the series, this game feels closer to a combination of the Whispered World and a telltale game.  Gone is the annoying and unlikeablely original Sadwick, who's only character trait is to whine more than Caillou.  Now we have an entire cast of characters with more refined traits and logic puzzles that you don't need moon logic to solve.

The ending will be rather predictable for players of the first game, but all in all this is a vast improvement and shows you how quickly Daedalic Entertainment learns from their mistakes and grows in their development.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960372601', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1568821569}
review:
Drugging kids and setting caterpillars on fire 6/10

The only thing is that the gameplay is kinda slow and most of the talking cannot be skipped.
The puzzles are kinda dull too. The story is nice though and the music is ok.
The characters are very bland though, little bit of background would have been nice.
They feel very displaced.

I can only recommend it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999747491', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1568064066}
review:
Der erste Eindruck von Silence ist zuerst einmal: UngewÃ¶hnlich. Wer klassische Adventures mag, der ist zunÃ¤chst einmal irritiert von den EinschrÃ¤nkungen (kein Inventar?) und gleichzeitig angetan von der gut passenden 3D-Grafik. Letzteres bleibt ein grosser Pluspunkt, zumal die Welt von Silence wunderbar, mÃ¤rchenhaft designt ist.
Was die Bedienung angeht fragt man sich schnell: Warum ist das nicht in allen Adventures so? Klar, der anspruch ist einiges niedriger als in klassischen Adventures, dafÃ¼r fehlen (ohne vermisst zu werden) fÃ¼r einmal die endlosen "was bitte muss ich jetzt tun? Mal alle GegenstÃ¤nde kombinieren und alle Bildschirme absuchen"-Passagen. Zumindest fÃ¼r die breite Spielermasse ist das ganze wesentlich benutzerfreundlicher, ohne dabei in vÃ¶llig seichte No-Brainer abzurutschen.
Und dann ist da noch die Story, die einmal mehr unglaublich packend ist. Schade, dass durch die aufwÃ¤ndige Machart wohl der Umfang litt, was wohl der grÃ¶sste Schwachpunkt des Spiels ist. Es hÃ¤tte gut und gerne mehr sein dÃ¼rfen, v.a. auch in Bezug auf die Nebenfiguren. DafÃ¼r ist man in gut einem Abend (ca. 5 Stunden) durch. Und erlebt dann erneut ein wunderbar aufwÃ¼hlendes, packendes Ende.

Fazit: Wer Adventures mag und nicht zwingend auf GehirnknacknÃ¼sse besteht, dafÃ¼r gerne eine gute Geschichte und AtmosphÃ¤re erlebt bekommt mit Silence ein hervorragendes Adventure serviert, das zwar kurz ist, aber das Potential hat, noch lÃ¤nger nachzuhallen.

Wichtig: Wer "The Whispered World" nicht gespielt hat, der sollte das unbedingt vorher tun. Einerseits wird die Geschichte quasi vorausgesetzt und zweitens versaut man sich sonst die grosse StÃ¤rke von "The Whispered World", nÃ¤mlich das unglaublich gute Ende, da es in Silence klar und deutlich wiedergegeben wird.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032974604', 'num_games_owned': 993, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1568002483}
review:
Beautiful, funny, magical. Silence will pull you into its world with its good-great (by video game standards) writing and beautiful art style. This game is the essence of Daedalic's bread and butter and they do an incredible job.

Don't be turned off if you aren't good at point and click adventure games. This one is easily beatable without a walkthrough and even provides very nice built in hints if you do get stuck.

Runs awesome on Linux (in full screen at least). (Expected playtime ~ 6 hours)

author: {'steamid': '76561198086192330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1604321396}
review:
Truly beautiful visuals, but I was disappointed by the story. I felt like it fell short at the end.
Game also is very short, I finished it in 5-6 hours, which I think is still decent for the price, but I expected it to be longer, hence why I felt like the story fell short. And I don't feel like I missed many small interactions that could have raised its lifetime significantly.

Again the graphics are amazing, and if you want to stand looking at gorgeous scenes this game is definitely for you.

This is where I'd like a neutral review. I recommend the first 90% of the game, but I wish I never knew there was only 10% left.

review: A beautiful game. You will pretty much need to play "the whispering world" before this though, in order to catch the many references within the game. review:
Un gioco con un ottima grafica ricca di dettagli sia nell'ambiente che nei personaggi.
La storia e composta da enigmi e da scelte che rendono la storia intrigante.
Questo gioco nella sua semplicita' raccoglie molte emozioni che ti coinvolgono fino alla fine del gioco .... storia ben fatta !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198190395919', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1565696743}
review:
Wer den VorgÃ¤nger "the whispered world" gespielt hat, wird dieses Spiel lieben. Es ist detailreich und schÃ¶n anzusehen. Die Musik lÃ¤sst einen trÃ¤umen und man trifft auf viele Charaktere aus Silence. Es ist ein Point&Click Spiel mit einfachen bis mittelschweren RÃ¤tseln. Sie sind nicht mehr so schwer wie in "the whispered world", da kein Inventar mehr vorhanden ist und man mit Dingen agieren muss, welche in greifbarer NÃ¤he sind. Das Spiel kann einen bis zu 6 Stunden fesseln und immer tiefer in die Welt eintauchen lassen. 



Spoiler




Das Ende jedoch, hat mein Herz gebrochen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025798569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 388, 'last_played': 1565401100}
review:
Yes the game is really beautiful (as is the music) but most of the the story is really slow, not so funny (I find the way Sadwick is lessened kinda disturbing), and not so enjoyable. Maybe without the secondary characters the game would have been better in fact. Luckily there is Spot.

Not so bad game if you buy it during the sales. Otherwise I wouldn't recommand it.

Non la considererei una vera e propria avventura grafica... peccato perchÃ© il capitolo precedente "The Whispered World" era decisamente piÃ¹ bello.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068817861', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1557432505}
review:
Silence is one of the best Daedalic Games I've played environmentally speaking. The graphics, the character designs, the filters, the animations are so wholesome I just cannot say anything bad about it. 

If you are not familiar with the predecessor (The Whispered World), you may find some of the drama and references illogical and be unable to commit to them. It's normal. They do play the reference game a lot. 

However, if you like point and clicks such as Broken Age, for example, then this one will probably be your cuppa tea. Even for the fans of King's Quest - try it; I am almost certain you will enjoy this small game.
