author: {'steamid': '76561198251852362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1560969060}
review:
Silence ist der Nachfolger von "The Whispered world". 

[b]Vorab zum VorgÃ¤nger[/b]: Ich spiele gern und viele Point and Click - und ich habe den ersten Teil sehr lange und gerne gespielt, er gehÃ¶rt zu meinen liebsten P&C. Die Grafik ist niedlich und der Humor herb und toll, ein Mix aus Melancholie und dÃ¼sterer sarkastischer Melancholie ;) An dem ersten Teil spielt und knobelt man recht lang - so ging es mir und ich denke einigen. Die RÃ¤tsel sind teilweise sehr schwer und oft muss man an verschiedenen Orten nach LÃ¶sungen suchen, hatte also mehrere Orte zur VerfÃ¼gung. Es war - und ist - ein anspruchsvolles und niedliches Point and Click.

[b] Nun zu diesem Teil: [/b]
Ich habe mir einiges von diesem Spiel versprochen, einiges wurde erfÃ¼llt, einiges leider nicht.
Ich habe es bislang 1x durchgespielt und ein zweites Mal angefangen. 
Ich gebe dennoch eine Kaufempfehlung (vor allem als Sparangebot, ggf. im Paket wie ich es vor geraumer Zeit gekauft habe) ab.

Pro:
- Grafikstil weiterhin niedlich und hÃ¼bsch.
- Musik passend und schÃ¶n.
- AtmosphÃ¤re ist einfach auch passend. Sowohl die reale Welt als auch die Welt Silence.
- keine harten RÃ¤tselnÃ¼sse, man braucht keine KomplettlÃ¶sung, es ist fÃ¼r Kinder geeignet und zum entspannen wie von anderen auch schon geschrieben
- es hat Wiederspielwert wegen Charakterentscheidungen und Ausgang
- die eine Stelle im Spiel, wo man mit Spot bei den magischen Kisten ist und hinter der "Sprungtrommel" hervorschauen kann und er komisch quiekt. ;) Diese Szene hat mich lange sehr erheitert. ;)

Contra:
- Das Spiel ist nach kurzer Zeit durchgespielt, wenn man den Spiegel zerstÃ¶rt. Es ist einfach zu kurz.
- Die RÃ¤tsel sind wirklich sehr leicht. Die Balance zwischen "zu hart" und "zu leicht" gelingt hier fÃ¼r Erwachsene nicht so gut. Wobei ich sagen muss, dass mir der VorgÃ¤nger auch etwas zu schwer war, im Planetarium hing ich selbst mit KomplettlÃ¶sung ewig.^^
- Es ist sehr linear, trotz der Episoden, in denen man zwischen Charakteren wechseln kann.
- Das neue "RÃ¤tselfeature" Balancieren mit der Maus finde ich nur stÃ¶rend, ich weiÃŸ nicht, was das soll?
- kein Inventar bei einem Point & Click.. das hab ich noch nie erlebt..
- Die Charaktertiefe ist nicht so hoch, zu keiner der beiden Hauptfiguren, wie ich finde.

Ich hoffe, die EinschÃ¤tzung kann euch helfen. 
HÃ¼bsch ist es auf jeden Fall, ich bereue meinen Kauf trotz Kritik nicht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007711307', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1561990573}
review: I think this game is absolutely beautiful, the art style is amazing. The puzzles are creative and the story is very engaging. Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys point and click games and  an enriching story

author: {'steamid': '76561198029435301', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1559588359}
review:
A very well and beautiful crafted 3d adventure game.

Voice acting and story telling is excellent!

The game is not very long, but you get some decision making for replayability.

The puzzles are not too hard, but they stretch out the game enough to make the experience feel satisfying.



All in all, I would say if Telltale games would have gameplay like Silence (in terms of puzzles and searching the sreens and looking at stuff), they wouldn't have gone bankrupt!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079559968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 502, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1561896725}
review:
Silence is an otherwise average fairly short point & click adventure, made awesome by its artwork and story. It takes place some years after the events of The Whispered World and BOY have things taken a turn for the worse since then. It kinda makes you think Sadwick should have chosen the other mirror. But then there is little sister Renie to protect this time.

Although it's a sequel you don't need to have played The Whispered World to enjoy Silence. There are some reoccurring characters but the entire plot of The Whispered World is explained in the first act. But I will say having played both games will give the story more depth.

I thoroughly enjoyed this game and if point & click adventures is your thing Silence is definitely a must-have.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996354180', 'num_games_owned': 947, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 446, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 446, 'last_played': 1561782496}
review:
I didn't realize this was the sequel to The Whispered World until I started playing it. I somehow got it in my library in some bundle last year and let it lie fallow for quite a while. Decided to give it a try this week and was pleasantly surprised. The graphics are lovely, and the voice acting is solid. Renie, the main character, in particular is charming beyond belief.

There are some significant changes in this game compared to the first one. It is 3D instead of 2D, and the interface has been greatly simplified. This is both good and bad. There are almost no inventory puzzles, which makes the game a lot easier. Whereas in the first game I got stuck a number of times, in this one I was able to just cruise along with almost no breaks. The only thing that's a little annoying is that the icon will change based on the type of interaction you can do with objects in the environment, but sometimes the icon doesn't make sense, e.g. you'll see an eye icon when really your character ends up doing a physical interaction more in line with a hand icon. And you don't actually get to select inventory items to use, since you'll never have more than two items at once. You simply move over hotspots, and it you can use an inventory item, it will highlight with that icon.

So, getting that out of the way, let's talk about the story. As in the first one, there's a sense of hopeless melancholy hanging over the whole affair. The beginning is pretty sad, and the game never really lets up. There are fun and light moments, but the sense of impending doom makes it tough to relax. And there is a choice at the end that [spoiler]no matter which way you choose, has a sad ending where the two main characters are forever separated[/spoiler]. So if you're in the mood for something uplifting, this isn't it.

Also, the game is incredibly short. My time is slightly inflated because I left the game idling a couple times. I'd say you'll get five hours of total playtime here. And there are interesting characters and situations that are introduced and then not really fleshed out,  unfortunately. Really the entire premise of this series is a depressing one, so be ready for that. I definitely wouldn't recommend it at full price, but on sale, if you're a point-and-click fan, you can do worse.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969643946', 'num_games_owned': 931, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1561113211}
review:
Honestly, I didn't really like this point and click adventure.

I found both the general pace and the controls to be sluggish and the story was a little overtly sentimental and kind of shallow for my tastes. The side characters in particular felt pointless for the most part and sections of the game felt like completing a list of chores with no compelling reason to do so.

I can see why other people might enjoy it though, the art and music are both nice and if you're susceptible to sensitive naivety (and I usually am - that's not a knock!) I'm sure you'll enjoy the story.

Unfortunately I'm old, and I've seen this kind of thing before in the past, done better.

review:
Honestly... I was impressed! This adventure got me nearly same as the epic Brothers.

So... what to say and don't spoil anything?
Simply, this a very beautiful point-click adventure where finally You don't have to bother to much with huge inventory stuff ; )
The story is the most important thing here (who play the first game get some advantage).

Normally I'd say that I will give this game app. 70/100.
Because of endings I give 72/100... but becuase of SPOT, I will give 80/100 ; )

author: {'steamid': '76561198047251358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 761, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 761, 'last_played': 1560077917}
review: I'm sorry I play loads of RPGs but this is just simply boring. The story is so boring, and the puzzles are just what the hell? Sometimes it took so long for me to just complete a puzzle because I missed one step and it was not clear what should I do next. The characters are all boring and everyone seems to be emotionless. The voice acting, boring too as it was monotonous and it was unreal. Everything about this game is just bad. I spent 12 hours finishing this game unsincerely, as I was just looking online on how to complete each levels. I finished the game only to get the achievements and because I've spent some money on this game so I don't want to feel guilty leaving it just like that. I'm very sorry, but I wouldn't recommend it. I played many RPGs, and many are not good, but this one is just... bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162381766', 'num_games_owned': 629, 'num_reviews': 547, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 381, 'last_played': 1560017252}
review:
Un'ottimo titolo che ha dalla sua parte la grafica e la storia a tratti toccante. Il contro ? Il gioco stesso. Non c'e inventario e gli oggetti si usano tutti nella zona. Insomma, sono piccole stanze di fila, con enigmi logici e vari mini giochi. E per la prima volta Ã¨ meglio usare il joypad al posto del mouse, perchÃ¨ il gioco stesso Ã¨ studiato per essere usabile con il pad. Quindi, se credete di prendere un'avventura grafica nel senso classico del termine, vi sbagliate. Ma Ã¨ un gioco che merita il vostro tempo anche se non lo consiglio a 20 euro vista l'etÃ  del gioco, ma a metÃ  prezzo lo consiglio a tutti gli amanti delle avventure grafiche e non. ^_^ 

P.S: E' gradevole anche se non avete finito il primo capitolo. ^_^

P.s 2: Riguardo prendere i vari achievement, sono piuttosto scoccianti, per via che non c'e nemmeno una selezione capitolo e siete costretti a rigiocare dall'inizio l'intero gioco.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979348554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1559527647}
review:
I become less and less patient with sloppy writing as I get older, and in particular I find I no longer have time for characters who are written to be horrible or unbelievably dumb because otherwise the plot wouldn't have a feeble excuse to move forward. Noah is as much of a depressed whiner as Sadwick was and is also a jerk, but besides that, several times in the first two chapters you don't get a choice except to let him be stupid and/or an ass. "Yank the secret message that isn't even meant for you out of her hands." ONLY OPTION. She will just stand there staring at it until you be a jerk like the game is forcing you to. Or, oh, hey, let's take a big whiff of the hallucinogenic flowers and then be too stupid to realize what's obviously going on!

Give me the game that's entirely about Renie. She's, like, what, six? and she's more capable and likeable than Noah is.

About the time I hit the third unskippable mouse-balancing sequence requiring motions that were apparently far too subtle for me to manage, I gave up. Pity. It was a pretty good story and I liked everybody so far but Noah. The villainess sounded pretty good too.

PS. If you were expecting a lot of nonsensical token-trading puzzles ("give the tuba to the ostrich") like in Whispered World, forget it. Any "what do I do now" puzzles are confined to the immediate scene and the clickables there, and are usually extremely obvious--or at least they were up to the point where I gave up.

I am very disappointed, because I expected this to be the game where the developer fixed all the annoying things he did wrong with Whispered World. He fixed a lot of those, yes, and substituted things that were even more annoying. Now we have a cryptic somewhat-interactive movie with invisible checkpoint saves, an even worse protagonist, less humor, less interest, and annoying mouse stunts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127780125', 'num_games_owned': 1443, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1616719178}
review:
[h1]TGEXP Reviews: [u]Silence[/u][/h1]
â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†â˜†

Well, I've already played [i]The Whispered World[/i], so why wouldn't I give Silence a go?

[h1]Soundtrack[/h1]
The soundtrack plays upon the area youâ€™re in. It manipulates your emotions. Itâ€™s not the in-your-face kind, though the instrumentals can become rushed when dangerâ€™s afoot.

But the graceful sounds of the piano, the sad underlying tones of melodic strings, it all enhances the game youâ€™re playing. It builds you up, and never once did it let me down.

[h1]Characters[/h1]
I think the characters are all great. From the people, to the creatures, toâ€¦uh, a couple of rocks.

You get some of the same characters that you saw in The Whispered World, plus some new ones.

One thing I didnâ€™t like about the characters in Silence is that theyâ€™re nowhere near as fleshed out as in its prequel. Sure, some of the same characters can appear, but they donâ€™t appear for long, and they donâ€™t have that big of a role to play. Even with the newer characters, itâ€™s like Silence teases you with showing a concept of a character you enjoy, but never end up giving you everything.

Thus, youâ€™re left wondering what happened to some of them.

Who knows? We (the gamers) donâ€™t.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Silence is a beautiful world full of bizarre fantasy that begs to be admired.

The graphics are stylized amazingly well, and the background as well as all the objects around your character(s) make you want to interact with everything. Even though you can only move so far and only interact with so much.

It almost feels disappointing to be so confinedâ€¦but definitely one of my top favorite artistically pleasing games to play.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
Itâ€™s a point and click game, but unlike most Iâ€™ve played, you donâ€™t get an inventory of items to use throughout the world. Instead, you need to interact with the environment itself, or use someone else to progress further.

There was one point where I couldnâ€™t figure out how to get through an area. I looked it up, in case it was a glitch that others had suffered through, but not much was said about it. In the end, I stopped playing the game for a few months before coming back to the save file. Turns out, I forgot to interact with something, because I didnâ€™t notice it before.

So yeah, the areas arenâ€™t difficult. But sometimes the puzzles just donâ€™t make since, or you may find yourself not noticing that one little detail.

Of course, hitting the spacebar once in a while may helpâ€¦

[h1]Verdict[/h1]
Itâ€™s about a 6-hour game. Itâ€™s not bad, either, but it does have its flaws.

While I do suggest you play The Whispered World before you play this one, itâ€™s not necessary to play one before the other. But you do get a sense of some of the characters from the first game.

Aside from that, you may just not understand the characters, or the meaning behind it all.

[b]Game on,[/b]
TGEXP

review:
Por un lado, la secuela de The Whispered World es una de las aventuras grÃ¡ficas mÃ¡s hermosas que jamÃ¡s juguÃ©, y el sistema de puzzles, para cuya resoluciÃ³n contas con un inventario casi inexistente, esta muy bien diseÃ±ado.

Por el otro, lo que empieza como una buena historia, de a poco se va convirtiendo en una trama endeble con un desarrollo de personajes flojo y un final decepcionante. Cada aspecto prometedor, cada detalle bien colocado en la primera mitad termina convirtiendose en nada mÃ¡s que una promesa vacÃ­a que te convences de que te quedes hasta el final, pero no mÃ¡s que eso.

NingÃºn elemento rescatable compensa el jugarlo. Y esa es la Ãºnica tragedia digna del primer juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030953657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 117, 'last_played': 1557349179}
review:
Ich bin ein riesen Fan von ClickAdventures und habe schon dutzende gespielt
WhisperedWorld ist und bleibt dabei mein liebstes.

Silence fÃ¤llt fÃ¼r mich leider nicht einmal in dieselbe Kategorie wie sein VorgÃ¤nger.
- kein Inventar und eigentlich auch keine RÃ¤tsel (meist ~4 Sachen auf dem Screen von denen man die richtigen 2 nacheinander anklickt)
- QuickTime Events
- nervig viele Cutszenen
- Interaktionen die ganz klar auf Controller ausgerichtet sind
- jeder Szenenwechsel ist ein ~7 Sekunden schwarzer Screen, da hier das Spiel speichert (AutoSave - man kann nicht aktiv Speichern). Das ist unglaublich frustrierend wenn man kurz etwas auf einer Szene erledigt und wieder zurÃ¼ck wechseln muss

author: {'steamid': '76561198082490006', 'num_games_owned': 605, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1555756095}
review:
You can easily skip that game if you already have finished the whispered world. 

I don't get why the hell you had to make sequel of the game, where ending matters, project that ending onto the new playable character, so there is no even interest in sequence of events inside the story, because you know, what will happen.
Also the game is too short, if there would be player-friendly save system and less tedious gameplay, I think I would finish it in one evening. 

Puzzles are unchallenging, new characters are very shallow. Plot is poor, if you have seen whispered world... Probably only pros are music and Spot. Ah, and graphic for quests is neat enough. 

So I would not like to recommend that even to casual players, try first game better: yep, it has some flaws too, but there world of Silentia is multifaceted at least.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998826737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1553565774}
review:
I very much enjoyed this game, but it isn't for everyone. The world of Silence is very creative, the visuals are often stunning and the idea behind the story is intriguing. But long load times, uneven pacing, audio issues and an abrupt conclusion with loose threads keep it from being great.

I tried the game on a whim (and on sale) solely because of the art style, and it is an amazing art style. There is a lot to like here but also some flaws that might deter players. Iâ€™m only going to list my negatives. I liked a lot about the game but I find what people like about something almost never helps me decide if I want to play it or not.

Short - This is the biggest flaw is that it simply feels too short. Length of games is a relative thing. Some games overstay their welcome just a few hours in while others donâ€™t feel long enough after hundreds of hours. Just as Silence starts getting into the adventure, the game comes to an abrupt end and several loose threads get left by the wayside. It feels like Silence ends in the middle.

Voice and Line timing - The acting feels a bit uneven, sometimes pretty good, sometimes just okay, but never great. Add to that the lack of pauses between line deliveries and conversations can feel awkward. Itâ€™s not bad, just not great.

Lack of Choice - There are several points you can select response or actions, but regardless the choices donâ€™t mean much. This was a bit frustrating as I wanted to spend or know more about some of the characters, but thatâ€™s not an option. This is a very liner game.

Point and Click - Totally subjective. Iâ€™m not a fan of point games. Still the interactions were fun if a bit tedious.

Load Times - This one hurt a lot, upwards of 20 seconds in some cases. The load times between screens in the same area really hurt the pacing.

Replayability - Because of the lack of choice, thereâ€™s no reason to play it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427163005', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1552214939}
review:
not the game I expectad it to be, but amazing none the less.
the puzzles where too easy, but it's becuase it is meant to appeal for a broader cast of gamers and can actually serve well as a gateway game for new 'adventure puzzle' gamers. the story is very compelling and you can easily get emotionally invested in it. The artwork is mastrfully done and if you enjoy a games scenert you can find yourself just staring at it for a while and admiring the work invested in it. it's not nescerry to play the first game in the series (Whispering world), but it does help better understanding the context that is only briefly explained.

the game is too short though, and it seems a lot of content was made and left behind. But keen observers can find many sublte content and hints about the world and some of the characters who don't get enough screen time, somthing I tend to appriciate more when done subtly than obviously. Such as a character acting odd and wearing diffrent facial expressions than expacted from her behaviour in the rest of the game (barely visible in first playthrough since it's early in the game) when talking about a place that is a "couples spot", hinting about the characters past. or noticing the two characters that serve as scenerty are later seen again in the game.
[a bit hard to explain without spoiling]


many did not like the ending, but I loved it. In order not to spoil it - all I will say is there is that you should watch the final cinematic atleast twice if not three times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205895069', 'num_games_owned': 785, 'num_reviews': 306, 'playtime_forever': 453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 452, 'last_played': 1552146510}
review:
Un juego correcto mezcla de Point&Click tradicional con algunos elementos de los juegos de Telltale. Les quedÃ³ un hÃ­brido donde no hay repercusiones claras de las decisiones que se toman y a la vez los puzzles son mÃ¡s bien simples porque no hay que pensar que elemento del inventario usar por lo cual termina siendo encontrar el orden correcto de hacer las cosas o cual es la forma correcta de Spot.
La historia no me pareciÃ³ tan novedosa habiendo jugado el juego anterior (Whispered World) y lo mismo pasÃ³ con el final.
Lo que mÃ¡s destaca es el apartado visual y auditivo. El juego se ve increÃ­ble y las voces estÃ¡n muy bien.
En la parte negativa lo peor son los tiempos de carga entre pantallas que varias veces cortan la inmersiÃ³n en el juego por la larga espera. Algunas secuencias del juego que se resuelven con el mouse (mantener el equilibrio, volar por las nubes) tampoco quedaron del todo bien logradas.

Puntaje final: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198263427469', 'num_games_owned': 442, 'num_reviews': 246, 'playtime_forever': 286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 286, 'last_played': 1550854979}
review:
A good game with usual gameplay but great story and atmosphere.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1663414929
I am not great fan of point & click games. I bought Daedalic bundle 2 years ago and closed all games after 15 minutes of gaming. I just didn't want to play them.

This game is an exception. Visuals are very good. The begging of the story is great. Voice acting is good (especially for little girl). A lot of cute characters (I liked especially the caterpillar).

Also, I found point & click part of the game not hard but very relaxing.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1663414876
 If you find this game on a 60%+ discount - take it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076873743', 'num_games_owned': 5239, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1550350547}
review:
This game looks great.  I used a xbox controller and it worked fairly well.  You may have some rare times where it takes a few extra seconds to click where you intending to click but it is not a big deal.  Sometimes your character can kind of walk off to a different area than you clicked which is slightly annoying but again it is not too big of a issue.  The "Sherlock Holmes" achievement is bugged and I don't feel like going into the files to pop the achievement.  I was going to go for 100% achievements but after seeing how this one did not pop when I used no hints I'm not going to bother.  
The story moves a long nicely and is mainly driven by Noah (Sadwick) and Renie.  I thought both of the endings were a improvement over the first game.  Spot seems to get a little more love and camera time in this and rightfully so.  The soundtrack is good as you would expect.  The game does a good job of putting in some humorous situations and dialogue just like The Whispered World did.  
This is a top tier point and click game even though it is on the shorter side.  Obviously I will recommend it but probably try to wait for a sale if you can.  I'd also like to note that I think this series if it were to continue on would really translate into a good rpg game using this Silence World even though its unlikely Daedalic Entertainment would go that route for this series.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995598287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1549244876}
review:
The Whispered World is a game I recommend to people just getting into the adventure game genre. I feel like it tackles the vast majority of what is required of the genre and bats strongly.

Excellent characterization, dialogue, voice acting, artwork, sound design, puzzle design, world building etc. etc.

After experiencing Silence, I cannot say remotely the same things.

This is a guilty fanfiction masquerading under the guise of one of my favorite creations.

nightm4re says a much more elaborate and kind version of my sentiments towards the game.

The core difference being that I very much do not want to encourage any developers from pursuing this kind of end. They took something *dripping* with life and artistic creativity, and reduced it to a cookie cutter mass market piece of garbage. The 3D graphics for characters are not only utterly unnecessary for the medium, but also a significant contrast to the more traditionally rendered backgrounds and art styles. Spot in particular doesn't appeal to me.

A number of interesting and promising ideas are presented within this 'game' and then not developed. The joins between scenes feel like there is story we are not privy to, leading to sometimes jarring disconnects in terms of narrative pacing.

nightm4re listed 10 characters. And this is technically accurate.

However, 2 of those are returning, 1 is a non speaking bug, 2 are background characters with perhaps 3 lines of dialogue, and one is literally only mentioned by name.

All in all I have to hope this was a 'big business decision' forced upon the developers. No you can't be creative and allowed the space to make a sequel that builds on all of the plot points and concepts you laid out at the concept stage; you must make it 3D and high res to appeal to the kidz. Maek Munies. 

Sadly I don't believe this to be the case.

If you enjoyed the Whispered World, my honest recommendation is to avoid this work. It successfully pulls on your nostalgia and primes you for something great that it has absolutely no capacity to deliver on.

It could quite easily have stood on its own, as a play on the same concept but in choosing to invoke the name of TWW, it set itself up to fail.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960499853', 'num_games_owned': 1512, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1549209999}
review:

Como punto negativo, el doblaje en inglÃ©s es bastante malo, sobre todo de la niÃ±a protagonista, que en ocasiones rompe totalmente la immersiÃ³n, utilizando un tono que no encaja con lo que el personaje estÃ¡ experimentando.

TambiÃ©n hay algunas partes que, sin ser difÃ­ciles, requieren un poco de prueba y error, y pueden llevar un rato por la lentitud de algunas animaciones.

Je le recommande pour les amateurs, mais avec un gros mais presque indÃ©finissable. ( Je sais, c'est la critique la moins constructive du monde, je vais essayer de poursuivre pour Ã©diter cet avis plus tard. )

review: Segunda parte de la que fuera una de las grandes aventuras grÃ¡ficas de los Ãºltimos tiempos, The Whispered World. No es una aventura grÃ¡fica al uso, por lo que no esperes mezcla de objetos, muchos personajes o elecciÃ³n de diÃ¡logos, etc. No obstante, es bastante original, pues a pesar de todo se desarrolla como si fuera una, incluyendo un uso muy novedoso del ratÃ³n (mantener el equilibrio en determinados momentos, "tirar" de cosas, etc.). Es sencillita, pero su apartado grÃ¡fico y sonoro, que son espectaculares, y el querer saber cÃ³mo continÃºa la historia, la hacen recomendable.

review:
I think a perfect game for smal childeren (6-10 maybe 12) or something... a little dark at the start but very easy gameplay and fun puzzles. (reminded me of freddy fish )

graphics are very nice aswell

author: {'steamid': '76561197978075118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1546093131}
review:
The artwork, the soundtrack and just the complete atmopshere is like a dream. It also has a nice story but also too simple puzzle and a short playtime (took me good 5h). Nevertheless it has been a while since I enjoyed a game from start to end this much. Is it a perferct point and click adventure? No, not at all. But I wouldn't solely categorize it as a point and click game, I think of it more as one of those "Art" games packed into a point and click adventure. This is the mindset you should start the game with. 

Pros: 
- Lovely characters 
- Good story 
- Amazing graphics and atmosphere 

Cons: 
- Very short 
- Easy puzzles

author: {'steamid': '76561198176604455', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1545742321}
review: I absolutely LOVE this game. Its so beautifull and also a bit diffecult. It would NEVER be the game I would buy, I am more like a shooters fan. I got this randomly by a friend and tried after a while playing it. And I liked it. So please if you have never played games like these don't judge without playing it. Sometimes I got angry, like the level with the big ass Bee. But then I passed it and everything just has gone normal since then. Really hope people use this review to think more then judge first.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078996445', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 707, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 589, 'last_played': 1544978442}
review:
I had this in my Steam library for a while but was reluctant to play it becase The Whispering World is so terrible.  It might be the worst game I've ever played all the way through -- worst voice acting in game history, one nonsensical puzzle after another, badly written dialogue that goes on and and on.  And then the ending of that game, just infuriating, never been so mad at a game as I was after watching the ridiculous, manipulative ending to the Whispered World.

Well as bad as The Whispering World is, Silence is much better.  For starters Renie is a WAY better protagonist than the awful Sadwick.  Sadwick is still annoying in this one but much less so than in the Whispered World, and he isn't in the game that much.  Knowing the asinine ending of Whispered World makes the setting for Silence more tolerable.  Graphics in Silence are quite good, music is good, voice acting is much better, and it's short enough not to overstay it's welcome.  There aren't a lot of puzzles, and the ones there are are quite easy, but at least they make sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198250353150', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 112, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1544850693}
review:
I don't understand why this game has 92% positive reviews. Must be highly visual people who disregard everything else.

This game doesn't deserve to be called a sequel to the brilliant game Whispered World. Only good thing that stands out about this game is the graphics, but that doesn't save the game that has an underdeveloped plot with more holes than Swiss cheese ([spoiler] why the Seekers are blind if their only purpose is finding a shard that you can't hear?[/spoiler]), and the sad excuse for Sadwick (dat pun).

[spoiler]If you love Sadwick like I do, you won't enjoy his return in this one. He's not being himself at all, he's just an edgy Noah trying to be the original Sadwick and it's cringeworthy.[/spoiler]

The humour is good Daedalic quality and that's the only thing I enjoyed in this game. I don't really care about the graphics. Whispered World had good enough graphics for me, and it's way better game than this one can ever try to be. 

This game is definitely NOT worth the full price. Buy it on sale or something if you really want to experience this mediocre, short and easy point n click and don't have anything better to spend your money on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027942416', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1544492099}
review:
If you like adventure games, this one is a must have. The art style fits perfectly with the story, and it is a beauty. The characters are relatable and after a while convincing. And the scenario, it is actually pretty good. All things you would look for in a good adventure game. As a bonus, the puzzles in this game don't require you to do mental gymnasitcs such as using a monkey instead of a monkey wrench. Every puzzle is solvable with what is in the screen (or in the surrounding screens).

And best of all the game runs perfectly well in Linux.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971308505', 'num_games_owned': 143, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1543790364}
review:
This game is crazy gorgeous. If you like any point and click game this one is worth it just for how it looks. The music is great as well.

The story is nice but you can tell whatâ€™s gonna happen. The story is made for an younger audience and this shows in the gameplay also. You donâ€™t have an inventory but rather the character knows what to use where. This also means you never interact two thing with each other to make something new. If I haven't been clear enough, the gameplay is easy. I am recommending this strongly for any children like 7 and up to 15 or around those ages. If I had played this game at an age of around there I think I would of remembered it for the rest of my life.  For 18 or older it really isnâ€™t a must by. Itâ€™s nice looking and fine but the story is too obvious for adults and the gameplay too easy. Unless youâ€™ve never played a point and click before.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127872503', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1545181801}
review:
I have finished The Whispered World previously, being lured in with its cartoonish charm and thought to myself. Wow. What a load of hot garbage. I am no stranger to obscure puzzles, but that game was pushing it (and flaunting it too!)
So it can be easy to understand my scepticism when I saw the trailer for this game at the end. The idea that the original was trying to present seemed to be quite finite and properly put through and I wasn't about to break my head over pretentious unsolvability to see the same thing again. But damn it am I a sucker for visuals.
I am overall glad I took the risk. While it is a completely different and streamlined experience, the medium was more suitable for this kind of story. Short concise and easy leaves more room for a nice little plot that strikes a balance between childish and adorable, and dark and serious without relying on major twists. The voice acting was okay, although the models weren't animated in a coordinated way, creating a jarring dissonance that will probably ruin the immersion for some.
I played with a controller and lining up the character to face the right interactive hotspot is a pain at times, but probably isn't the issue with the mouse.
The game is plain gorgeous, oozing art made by loving hands in every scene and piece of character design (except maybe for Spot. His transition to 3D made him only more annoying). The original leitmotif got revamped for this soundtrack and sounds more dreamy than ever.
There will be nice snippets of information about the world everywhere you look and every decision you make.
This is the 3D point and click adventure game that washed the ashes off my tongue left by Syberia 3.

review:
Ich habe den VorgÃ¤nger geliebt und ich wÃ¼rde sagen, dieses Spiel ist ein wÃ¼rdiger Nachfolger.
Insbesondere die Soundtracks empfinde ich als gut gelungen und alleine das bringt mich dazu dieses Spiel zu empfehlen.
Mit detailierterer und andersartiger Grafik (mehr in Richtung 3D) und einer dÃ¼steren Story (jedoch kein Horror) hat mich dieses Spiel insgesamt so gefesselt, dass ich es fast in einem Zug durchgespielt habe und im Anschluss fast ein zweites Mal nur um alle MÃ¶glichkeiten, die ich zuvor ausgelassen hatte, noch auszuprobieren.
FÃ¼r alle Fans von PointNClick Adventures, Telltales und Ã¤hnlichem definitiv zu empfehlen.

Der SpielspaÃŸ und dessen LÃ¤nge hÃ¤ngt insbesondere mit der Erfahrung mit solchen Spielen zusammen. Ich habe in etwa 3-4 Stunden fÃ¼r den ersten Lauf gebraucht, weil ich mir ganz in Ruhe die Welt angesehen und die Story gelesen/gehÃ¶rt habe; fÃ¼r jemanden, der aus fÃ¼r mich nicht verstÃ¤ndlichen GrÃ¼nden, dies nicht tut, der KÃ–NNTE THEORETISCH EVENTUELL auch schon nach 2 Stunden fertig sein. Allerdings versaut man sich damit vermutlich jede Art von Freunde an diesem Spiel :)

~Juyas

Ausserdem lohnt sich das Spiel schon alleine wegen dem niedlichen Spot, der soviel mehr Charme hat als der Spot aus dem alten Spiel. Allerdings hÃ¤tte es etwas lÃ¤nger sein dÃ¼rfen...

author: {'steamid': '76561198030861235', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 974, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1555267384}
review: Buono solo dal punto di vista grafico, discreti i personaggi e le loro caratterizzazioni. PerÃ² noioso. Alla fine tutto o quasi si risolve nel far fare a Spot, il vostro pet, qualsiasi cosa, anche le piÃ¹ impensabili, andando a tentoni e provando a cliccare con lui nella sua forma normale, appiattita o gonfiata. E le abilitÃ  di Spot sono tante e tali che veramente buona parte del gioco va risolta con lui. Personalmente mi sono annoiato tanto che le ultime parti le ho fatte con la soluzione sotto pur di finire in fretta. Aggiungo poi che spesso si Ã¨ bloccati in soli due o tre quadri con pochissimo da fare, non esiste una gestione dell'inventario, nÃ© sostanzialmente la capacitÃ  di raccogliere oggetti o di combinarli. Se poi considerate che per passare da un quadro all'altro o anche da un personaggio all'altro ci sono dei caricamenti che (inspiegabilmente) durano diversi secondi (in un buon pc gaming) aggiungete la ciliegina sulla torta che dice di non prendere questo gioco. Posso consigliarvelo solo a 2 o 3 euro se siete curiosi di giocarlo. Ma a mio avviso sarÃ  noia e tempo perso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046415748', 'num_games_owned': 1649, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1534097144}
review:
[b]Silence Ã© um jogo indie do gÃªnero Point and Click onde dois irmÃ£os se veem presos dentro de um mundo fantÃ¡stico e precisam desvendar quebra cabeÃ§as para escapar dele. Mas as coisas acabam nÃ£o sendo tÃ£o simples assim.[/b]

[h1]HistÃ³ria, universo e atmosfera[/h1]
Como um jogo Point and Click, o foco sempre serÃ¡ a histÃ³ria e como ela serÃ¡ contada segundo as escolhas do jogador. A premissa Ã© simples, dois irmÃ£os que chegam a este mundo fantÃ¡stico e a meta Ã© escapar dele, mas ao longo da narrativa alguns mistÃ©rios surgem e a histÃ³ria ganha contornos inesperados. Mesmo os personagens sendo pouquÃ­ssimo trabalhados, atÃ© porque nÃ£o Ã© um jogo muito longo, eles sÃ£o carismÃ¡ticos e vocÃª simpatiza rapidamente com eles, o que Ã© um ponto a ser destacado. O universo apresentado Ã© rico, com seres interessantes, construÃ§Ãµes lindas, cenÃ¡rios primorosos e uma atenÃ§Ã£o dobrada aos detalhes sonoros do jogo. Vale destacar a trilha sonora tambÃ©m, que casa muito bem com os cenÃ¡rios.

[h1]Pontos que deixam a desejar[/h1]
O jogo tinha tudo para deixar uma Ã³tima impressÃ£o e se estabelecer como um Ã³timo jogo, porÃ©m, nenhum jogo Ã© perfeito. Existe uma sÃ©rie de problemas que prejudicaram o meu aproveitamento ao longo da gameplay; alguns mais sÃ©rios e outros menos relevantes.
O que mais ficou evidente para mim e que me fazia dar longos suspiros quando o notava sÃ£o os puzzles. NÃ£o os quebra cabeÃ§as em si, que nÃ£o chegam a ser muito desafiadores, mas que nÃ£o prejudicam a experiÃªncia. Meu problema com eles Ã© a motivaÃ§Ã£o para existÃªncia deles. Os puzzles vÃ¡rias vezes decorrem de acontecimentos ridÃ­culos, parecem que existem simplesmente para aumentar o tempo de jogo. Um exemplo do [b]inÃ­cio do jogo[/b] ilustra bem isto: vocÃªs encontram um pÃ¡ssaro preso dentro de uma planta carnÃ­vora gigante e, a fim de tentar livrar este pÃ¡ssaro, um personagem que estÃ¡ te acompanhando tenta retirÃ¡-lo e acaba ficando com seus braÃ§os presos junto ao pÃ¡ssaro. Este evento acaba te obrigando a ficar uns 20 minutos buscando uma forma de soltar o braÃ§o desse companheiro, sendo que ao soltar ele vocÃªs simplesmente seguem em frente. Toda a sequÃªncia de quebra cabeÃ§as existe com finalidade Ãºnica de estender o tempo de jogo, sem acrescentar nada de novo.
Outra coisa que considero um problema sÃ£o as escolhas de diÃ¡logo, que 99% das vezes nÃ£o alteram em nada o andamento do jogo e que vÃ¡rias vezes nÃ£o refletem o que acaba sendo dito pelo personagem. E, por Ãºltimo, os loadings, que acontecem em uma quantidade muito exagerada e que sÃ£o demorados.

[h1]Levanto tudo em consideraÃ§Ã£o, vale a pena?[/h1]
Silence estÃ¡ longe de ser um jogo perfeito, mas tem uma narrativa que acaba compensando um pouco esses problemas, lhe fazendo aproveitar o que estÃ¡ sendo contado e fazendo esquecer um pouco os pontos negativos. Para pessoas que jÃ¡ estÃ£o acostumados com jogos Point and Click, talvez este seja uma boa escolha e um bom representante dos jogos indies desse gÃªnero, mas para jogadores que nunca jogaram nada deste gÃªnero e buscam algo para ingressar nesse novo mundo, Silence pode nÃ£o ser um bom jogo para comeÃ§ar, talvez seja melhor escolher algum jogo da Telltale Games que te interesse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268575047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1541324767}
review:
[strike]I only just realized, 2.5 hrs in, that [b]this game is a sequel,[/b] and things make more sense now. The whole time it felt like Noah and Renie have a familiarity with the world that I'm missing out on, and now I know why. I was going to give it a thumbs down for being confusing, but now I'll give it a tentative thumbs up since there's a reason. I'm going to play The Whispered World before finishing it, but I [b]definitely recommend playing them in order.[/b][/strike]

Update: I tried The Whispered World for like 20 minutes and that game is a hard no-go for me. It's extremely slow and feels... old. I don't know how else to describe it. In terms of gameplay, graphics, and voice acting, Silence is far superior. However, there's a very clear expectation that you've played the first one and without that background, things just feel unnatural. With that in mind, I can't recommend it.

review: Superb animations and graphics and voice acting and the storyline is quite interesting too. Also, the puzzles all make sense (no moon logic). I also found that the main characters were quite lovable. Overall, one of the best adventure games I've played recently.

author: {'steamid': '76561198427374354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 244, 'playtime_forever': 429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1540848960}
review: A beautiful and imaginative light fantasy point & click adventure game, in the vein of Alice in Wonderland or Labyrinth. Gorgeous artwork, good voice-acting and inventive puzzles. It's not very long nor difficult to complete and should take you an afternoon or two to play through. It has heart, though, and I found it a highly enjoyable gem of a game. Ideal for first time adventurers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198437637724', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 429, 'last_played': 1611755119}
review: Wirklich ein sehr schÃ¶nes Spiel. Sehr viel Liebe rein gesteckt in die Geschichte und auch in die Gestaltung. AuÃŸerdem sehr niedlich gemacht, vor allem die "Raupe" Spot :) Ob man jetzt im Normalfall 20â‚¬ bezahlen will,muss jeder selber wissen, ich persÃ¶nlich habe es aus der GameStar Zeitung^^. Ist super gemacht aber mit 7h Spielzeit ungefÃ¤hr (auÃŸer man will vielleicht alle Erfolge), etwas wenig,aber das sieht jeder anders. Auf jeden Fall echt zu empfehlen. Die RÃ¤tsel sind auch sehr schÃ¶n gemacht. Also auch ebenfalls ein Spiel fÃ¼r Kinder. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198073985235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 401, 'last_played': 1540856323}
review:
Silence ist fÃ¼r mich immer noch ein atemberaubendes Spiel mit einer wunderschÃ¶nen Umgebung. Daedalic hat sich mit diesem Point & Click wieder einmal selbst Ã¼bertroffen!

Ich bin ehrlich, mich hat der erste Teil (The Whispered World) nicht so vom Hocker gehauen & fÃ¼r viel frustration gesorgt. Silence macht es um einiges besser, aber es ist nicht nur ein schÃ¶nes Spiel, denn wer die Story von The Whispered World kennt, hat beim spielen wohl immer ein etwas mulmiges GefÃ¼hl. So ging es mir zumindest.

Wem Inszenierung & die Geschichte dahinter wichtiger sind als spielerische Herausforderungen, wird hier ein paar tolle Stunden verbringen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040522649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 397, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 387, 'last_played': 1657457041}
review:
I've never finish a poin't and click game - because I get bored when I'm stuck for hours - except Silence.

Thanks for the story you build, with a fine dedicated and beautifull jobdone on every art point, from sound design to scenario tricking our mind. 

It's a rare jewel in video games genre.


9.99/10 Will always regret my final *choice* because it was the *final* choice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016045299', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1539815479}
review:
[h1]A beautiful disappointment[/h1]
So here goes my first Steam review for a game that was very important to me.
Playing the original "The Whispered World", I was simply overwhelmed by its unbelievably beautiful world and its music that would leave a mark on me for years to come.
I was delighted by the announcement of a second installment of the series, wondering if it could ever capture the magic of what made part I so special (especially since I'm not a big fan of 3D in point and click adventures). 
Briefly said: It couldn't.
There may or may not be [b]SPOILERS[/b] up ahead.

[b]What was good about the game?[/b]
[list]
    [*][i]The visuals![/i] - To adress the obvious first, this game looks downright gorgeous. Beautifully hand-drawn backgrounds, similar to those in the first game, are layered to create the illusion of actual depth, the detailed 3D characters match the style perfectly. Well-timed camera movements and shiny particles make every scene a joy to look at.
    [*][i]The music![/i] - While the soundtrack by Tilo Alpermann may not be quite as memorable as the work of Finn Seliger in part 1, it beautifully complements whatever is happening on screen, employing a lot of themes from the previous game. These dreamy, beautiful tunes are definitely a worthy addition to my spotify library!
    [*][i]Renie![/i] - A lot of the time is spent playing a little child, and I can only say I've never played a child this credible before in a game. Little slips while pronouncing complicated words, being ignored by arguing adults, the curiosity, the naivety, the vulnerability - Everything about Renie is adorable.
    [*][i]Spot![/i] - You can only love the little green worm. The passages where you play as spot are -in my opinion- mechanically the most appealing and challenging, because they offer the most options of interaction. And have you looked at just how cute he is?
[/list]

[b]What was bad about the game?[/b]
[list]
    [*][i]Sadwick / Noah[/i] - I'm disappointed by this character. Sadwick's embittered comments are never as entertaining as in the first game, most of the time they're plain depressing (such as "That's a deep pit, I might as well just jump down.").
Apart from that, the "transformation" from Noah to Sadwick feels somewhat enforced and incredible. He just picks up the cap and goes "well, k then, I'm Sadwick now.". To be honest, I found it strange that every other character accepted him as Sadwick right from the moment he had the cap. No bloody word about Noah was lost ever again.
    [*][i]The characters / dialogues[/i] - There weren't many. A total cast of approximately ten characters isn't much to begin with, and since there are [b]no optional dialogues[/b], the characters stay flat and stereotypical. Even when you get the choice to bombard two of your (previous) fellows, the decision doesn't feel hard or impactful, since you just haven't had much opportunity to familiarize with them.  
    [*][i]The playtime[/i] - For a sequel, the game is surprisingly short. Once you've acclimatized with the world, the game is already over again, leaving you with a slight feeling of disappointment. It feels like a lot of content has been cut just in favor of the gorgeous graphics, which must have devoured tons of resources. Many times, you hop from location A to B without a logical transition. This makes the game feel like it has originally been planned to feature more locations, which have been cut due to budget and deadline reasons.
    [*][i]The story[/i] - The end of the first game logically implied only one thing: Silence is a world between life and death, where you only go in your mind when you're nearly dying. This premise somewhat limits the story of part II: The whole plot lacks the element of surprise that was the ending of part I. Instead, the protagonists are fully self-aware, which makes the story rather pointless. Right from the start, you know that you're in a dream and that all you do doesn't matter anyway. The ending is a plain replication of part I's ending, but so much less well-written. The consequences of your choice in the end are a little arbitrary (meaning that in one ending Noah dies / is in a coma and in one ending he wakes up, even if everything has taken place in Renie's mind.) and the ending itself feels very abrupt. You don't learn about the fate of side characters, the beautiful title track sets in and before it gets "epic", it fades out. That was really dissatisfying. 
    [*][i]The puzzles[/i] - The game is fully aimed at mainstream players and needs to appeal non-adventure-gamers due to its high budget. The puzzles suffer from this: There is no real inventory (you carry only one item most of the time, which solves puzzles solely in the current screen or the two adjacent screens.). There are no real combination puzzles, the minigames are fun but rare (and easy). All in all, not much thinking is required to play through the game, which I guess was absolutely intentional to enable casual gamers to experience the full game.
    [*][i]The variety[/i] - Even though the game is visually stunning, it lacks some of the variety I was used to from part I. Many locations share a common theme and since the game is so short, you don't really get to experience the full color palette of Silence.
    [*][i]The Daedalic humour[/i] - Umm... There wasn't too much of it. Silence mostly lacks the bittersweet, ironic tone of The Whispered World. Most of the game's mood is darker, melancholic and dramatic. The moments of comedic relief are there, but not always well-executed.
[/list]

[b]Takeaway[/b]
The game focuses more on being a "cineastic experience", as the devs put it, instead of a classic adventure game (Hi, Telltale!). While this is a huge step in terms of visuals and presentation, the typical adventure gameplay suffers from it. No optional dialogues, a lack of interesting characters and surprises, dumbified puzzles, no real inventory and a short playtime leave you somewhat dissatisfied after finishing the game. On the other hand, it's been just too damn delightful to return to this beautiful world, play as your beloved characters Sadwick and Spot while also experiencing the world through the eyes of a child, and embrace the soothing tunes while admiring how gorgeous everything looks.

[i][u]All in all, still shut up and take my money, Daedalic. But please don't forget your fanbase while acquiring new players.[/u][/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198023666926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1772, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 478, 'last_played': 1642837347}
review: Good game, little short and maybe not as complex and hard as it could be but it have decent story and connection to  Whispered World  . Visually it's a masterpiece, beautiful marriage between 3d and hand painted 2d, real eye candy. Animation could be better especially lip sync but it's not that big of a deal and game is still enjoyable to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088271559', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1539226519}
review:
This is a point and click adventure game with a few other interesting mechanics built in. You play as Noah and his sister Renie in an absolutely GORGEOUS environment. Each scene in the game poses some amount of progression and changes the results of interactions as you progress, and it features an absolutely fascinating story that takes you back into the imagination of a young child. The extra mechanics such as balancing and using spot's different forms work into actions and solving environmental puzzles laid out for you that keep the story moving forward and keep you interacting with the world of silence. I highly recommend this game for anyone who is looking for a fun fantasy story.

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197995295537', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 286, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1537949356}
review:
SILENCE (Whispered World 2)
+ Beautifull Artwork ! 
+ "easy" puzzles 
+ Sweet Story ^^

Had a savegame breaking bug caused by hitting ESC while dying.
Savegame got corrupted..i could restart/reload, but there always were graphic glitches.
Had to start a new game, after that everything worked fine.

- achievement hunters need more than one walkthrough, because theres only 1
  checkpoint save

author: {'steamid': '76561198063825413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 804, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1537792002}
review:
Das Spiel ist noch gut.

Es ist ein Point & Click, das etwas zu einer Telltale-artigen Darstellung tendiert. Wie sein ausfÃ¼hrlicher Titel (Silence: The Whispered World 2) andeutet, ist es eine Fortsetzung von [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198063825413/recommended/268540]The Whispered World[/url], aber nur, weil hier wie dort die Welt Silence eine Rolle spielt.

Die kleine Renie und ihr Ã¤lterer Bruder Noah geraten durch einen Luftangriff in die mÃ¤rchenhafte Welt Silence, die sie bereits kannten (so wie man in die Welt eines Romans "eintaucht").

Auch Silence ist in Aufruhr. BÃ¶sartige, insektenartige "Sucher" greifen sie an, die KÃ¶nigin ist recht machtlos, Rebellen stellen sich ihnen entgegen. Es bleibt aber knuddelig-mÃ¤rchenhaft.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1521840630

Die Geschichte mÃ¤andert durch verschiedenste Situationen, die Ã¤hnlich einem Traum auch oft episodenhaft bleiben, hin zu dem (letztlich vorhersehbaren) Ende, wo man sich entscheiden muss.

Nun gut, der Grat ist schmal, und man kann gerne alles wunderbar dramatisch und anrÃ¼hrend und ganz toll ansehen. Bei mir wollte es sich nicht recht zusammenfÃ¼gen. Der Kampf um Silence wurde dann sogar den Nebenfiguren Ã¼berlassen und blieb unklar.

Insofern fÃ¼hlte ich mich nicht so bewegt, wie es die Macher des Spieles sicherlich im Sinne hatten. Gut gemacht sind aber ganz sicher die Hauptprotagonisten, insbesondere Renie, die mal frÃ¶hlich wie auf einem Badeausflug ist, schlaue Ideen liefert und dann doch ganz Kind ist.

Das Gameplay ist zwar ein P&C, aber stark an eine Visual Novel im Stile von Telltale angenÃ¤hert. Es gibt kein Inventar, also nur jeweils hÃ¶chstens ein Objekt, das man an anderer Stelle einsetzen muss. Es gibt ein paar Aufgaben, die etwas (wirklich nur etwas) Geschicklichkeit erfordern, wie das Balancieren auf einer Kugel.

Manchmal muss man einfache Dialogoptionen wÃ¤hlen, die aber meist nur minimale Unterschiede bewirken.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1521839200

Etwas komplexer wird es dadurch, dass sowohl Renie als auch Noah gesteuert werden kÃ¶nnen, die manchmal voneinander getrennt sind. Das Zusammenarbeiten mÃ¼ssen ist aber Ã¼berschaubar. Auch Spot macht die Sache manchmal komplex, weil er sehr viele verschiedene Gestalten annehmen kann (Flach, Normal, Rund, Aufgeteilt, Brennend, etc.).

Dennoch: die Aufgaben sind Ã¼berwiegend sehr einfach. Bei manchen Aufgaben habe ich aber nicht verstanden, was eigentlich los ist (wozu also was zu tun ist) und bei manchen Situationen kam eine unresponsive Steuerung dazwischen: eine Handlung schien nicht ausfÃ¼hrbar; erst nach mehreren Versuchen (das muss man erst mal ahnen) klappte es dann. Daher musste doch (obwohl die RÃ¤tsel einfach sind) ein Walkthrough her.

Sehr spaÃŸbremsend sind die erheblichen Ladezeiten zwischen zwei Screens. Mein PC brauchte meist zwischen 5 und 12 Sekunden zum Laden einer Szene, die man oft nur kurz besuchen musste, um vielleicht etwas auszuprobieren oder weil es nur eine kurze Zwischensequenz war. Auch Animationen brauchen viel Zeit, was an sich ja nett ist, aber manchmal nerven, wenn man sie zum x-ten Mal sieht.

Die Grafik ist hervorragend. Sehr schÃ¶n modellierte und animierte Figuren vor wunderschÃ¶n gemalten Hintergrundbilder, z.B. der traumhaft-burgÃ¤hnlichen Stadt.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1521842004

Der Sound ist auch gut. Die Musik ist wohl speziell komponiert und eingespielt, die Sprecher sind ebenfalls sehr gut. Als Sprache steht Englisch und (an sich) Deutsch zur VerfÃ¼gung. Dummerweise wurde mir beim ersten Start im OptionsmenÃ¼ nur die Sprache fÃ¼r die Untertitel angeboten (glaube ich) und so habe ich das Spiel lange auf Englisch gespielt.

Die Steuerung war nicht fehlerfrei. An sich kann man das Spiel gut mit Controller spielen. Der "Vorteil" ist, dass die Hotspots so noch leichter zu finden sind. DafÃ¼r reagierte das Spiel manchmal nicht auf meine Eingaben. Mein Contoller ist etwas betagt und vielleicht nicht mehr ganz top, aber bei anderen Spielen funktioniert er noch ziemlich gut. Hier brauchte es oft viele Versuche. Das Umschalten (weg) vom Controller funktioniert allerdings nur im HauptmenÃ¼, was sehr irritierend ist. Mit der Maus hatte ich wenig Probleme.

Es gibt viele Errungenschaften, die zu erlangen man wohl mehrere DurchlÃ¤ufe durch das Spiel, das keine ZwischenstÃ¤nde erlaubt, erfordert.

Pro & Contra:

+ Aufwendige Grafik
+ Guter Sound (Deutsche Sprecher)
+ Eine nette Hauptdarstellerin

o Oft Visual-Novel-/Telltale-artiges Gameplay

- Ãœberwiegend sehr einfache RÃ¤tsel
- Eine vielleicht gute Geschichte (ich fand sie aber nicht toll ausgefÃ¼hrt)
- Es fehlte jeglicher auflockernder Witz
- Steuerung (durch Controller) etwas hakelig

Wertung: 6/10

Ich habe ja (mit der Zeit) Telltale-Spiele geliebt. Der Versuch von Daedalic, Ã¤hnliche Wege einzuschlagen, kam mit Silence bei mir nicht so gut an. Dazu war die Geschichte fÃ¼r mich nicht wirklich fesselnd, auch wenn sie ja so gefÃ¼hlvoll erscheint. Aber das muss man selbst abwÃ¤gen, ebenso, ob einem das gebotene Gameplay zusagt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037252653', 'num_games_owned': 660, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 314, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 314, 'last_played': 1536970717}
review:
This game was a rather disappointing experience. Silence is a sequel to one of my favorite games of Daedalic's previous works, The Whispered World. While the chance to 3d models and environments looks quite good it had not impacted the gameplay very well. Doing anything, even the simplest of tasks, takes an unreasonable amount of time. Loading between screens took quite a long time too, although that could just be because of my aging hardware. The story itself was alright but very poorly told. Voice direction is a joke, and the pacing of the dialogue is bizarrely rushed in both the German and English audio. The music was passable but not memorable. 

In conclusion I would probably recommend that anyone curious about this game go play The Whispered World instead, and maybe pick this up if they're desperate to experience another trip into familiar territory.

review:
(Einen detaillierten Eindruck vom Spiel bekommt man hier: [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HT0XZiH-sfY&index=37&list=PLNcEOocQhKzh7G2-Q0YnoZABzWhGO3zYo] Taugt das was? - Silence [/url])

Ein wunderschÃ¶nes Point&Click-Adventure, das leider einige Probleme hat. So wirken beispielsweise die eingestreuten Geschicklichkeitsspielchen und Quick Time Events ziemlich Ã¼berflÃ¼ssig. Man hat den Eindruck, dass sich die Entwickler hier an erfolgreicheren Adventures von Telltale (The Walking Dead usw.) orientieren wollten, ohne wirklich Ideen zu haben, wie sie solche Spielelemente sinnvoll in Silence integrieren kÃ¶nnten.

AuÃŸerdem sind die RÃ¤tsel von wechselhafter QualitÃ¤t. Viele lÃ¶st man geradezu automatisch, indem man einfach nur alle Hotspots auf dem Bildschirm anklickt, sodass man Ã¼berhaupt nicht nachzudenken braucht, andere wieder kann man gar nicht durch nachdenken lÃ¶sen, weil man auf das Eintreten vÃ¶llig unvorhersehbarer Ereignisse angewiesen ist. An manchen Stellen bin ich zum Beispiel eine Weile festgehangen, weil ich nicht darauf gekommen bin, dass ich den Weg noch einmal ein StÃ¼ckchen zurÃ¼ckgehen musste, damit etwas passiert. Dass ich nicht darauf gekommen bin, hat wiederum einen Grund, nÃ¤mlich die vielen Ladezeiten. Bei jedem Wechsel von einem Bildschirm zum anderen bekommt man zunÃ¤chst einen Ladebildschirm vorgesetzt. Das ist vor allem deshalb nervig, weil man stÃ¤ndig zwischen Bildschirmen hin und her gehen muss, um RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen, manchmal sogar dreimal hintereinander, was dann sechs Ladebildschirme fÃ¼r ein einziges kleines RÃ¤tsel bedeutet. An dieser Stelle dachte ich mir: â€Das kann der Entwickler doch nicht ernst meinen! Die LÃ¶sung MUSS doch irgendwo auf diesem Bildschirm hier sein!â€œ Aber falsch gedacht.

AuÃŸerdem hat man den Eindruck, dass das Spielprinzip vereinfacht wurde, um es fÃ¼r den Mainstream und die Steuerung auf der Konsole zu optimieren. So wurde zum Beispiel auf das genreÃ¼bliche Inventar verzichtet. Das finde ich gar nicht mal prinzipiell schlecht, da ich auch auf dem PC gern mit Controller spiele und ich es, ehrlich gesagt, nie so toll fand, in einem Adventure stÃ¤ndig mein ganzes Inventar durchprobieren zu mÃ¼ssen, ob sich irgendwas kombinieren lÃ¤sst. Aber wenn man schon solche EinschrÃ¤nkungen vornimmt, sollte das Spiel dann auch gut mit Controller funktionieren und das tut es nicht. Man braucht oft einige AnlÃ¤ufe, bis die Figur den Gegenstand anvisiert, den man haben mÃ¶chte. Das ist vor allem an einer Stelle im Spiel schlimm, an der man ein Tier einfangen muss, das sofort flÃ¼chtet, wenn man nicht schnell ist. Nach etwa einem Dutzend vergeblicher Versuche mit dem Controller habe ich an dieser Stelle zur Maus gegriffen und es dann sofort geschafft. Aber das sollte ich nicht tun mÃ¼ssen.

Wieso ich dem Spiel trotz all dieser MÃ¤ngel noch einen Daumen nach oben gebe? Nun ja, es sieht zunÃ¤chst mal verdammt gut aus. Die Story ist ebenfalls gut, auch wenn sie vielleicht ein bisschen zu stark auf dem VorgÃ¤nger The Whispered World aufbaut, um denjenigen noch zu gefallen, die den ersten Teil nicht gespielt haben. Was mich aber wirklich Ã¼berzeugt hat, sind sie gut geschriebenen Dialoge und die liebenswerten Charaktere. Vor allem die furchtlose, kleine Renie hat es mir angetan. FÃ¼r ein paar der Nebencharaktere hÃ¤tte man sich aber noch mehr Zeit lassen dÃ¼rfen und auch insgesamt ist das Spiel mit 5 bis 6 Stunden Spielzeit etwas kurz geraten. Aber trotz aller Kritikpunkte muss ich sagen, dass sich der Ausflug nach Silence letztendlich gelohnt hat. Ich hoffe aber sehr, dass es mir der Entwickler beim nÃ¤chsten Mal nicht mehr so schwer macht, sein Spiel zu mÃ¶gen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960318168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 742, 'last_played': 1535747278}
review:
While I enjoyed playing Silence, I cannot recommend it.

First, the most positive aspect: 
The Story is very good and, as an additional bonus, you get to meet some characters from "The Whispered World". Your sidekick, the caterpillar Spott, is really cute. Through his actions, the game tends to be more funny, but the overall story is rather sad and thought provoking.

Now the huge BUT:
Gameplaywise, Silence is a lackluster Point- & Click-Adventure. There are not that many scenes, with only a few Hotspots. Most puzzles are focused on 1-2 vital points and are derived from these. Sometimes, you have to use the same Hotspot for several occasions. Overall the difficulty is very low.
In addition, there are no real dialogues. You can talk to other characters, but you can't choose what to ask. In some cut-scenes, you can choose one of two answers, but whatever you choose, has no effect on the story. Its just a one-liner.
And now, something that never ever came to my mind when playing a Point- & Click-Adventure, but here it is: The mouse-control is horrible. Many items can be pushed or pulled. For these actions you have to drag your mouse and its not working all the time. These kind of gameplay elements seem to me like a concesion to the console release of this game. With a gamepad it might be fun or at least ok, but with mouse-control it just feels plain wrong.
I have played 2,5 playthroughs to get 100% and still I am at only 12h playtime. Therefore SIlence is not a long game, which is okay if the gameplay would have been more satisfying. There is no real challenge. To stretch the time of the game even further, the cutscences are not skipable. And there are a lot of cutscences..

Overall I can only recommend this game to people who really [b]really[/b] liked "The Whispered World" and have no other Point- & Click-Adventure to play.

review: There isn't manual saves, just autosaves at unknown checkpoints. So when you quit, you don't know when the game will continue and there isn't a way to skip already seen cutscenes... And loadings between scenes are very long.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056737914', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 281, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 281, 'last_played': 1535058619}
review: This one is hard to judge. I never played the original so I went into this blind. It has a very Jim Hensony feel to it in its weirdness..almost like Dark Crystal or Labrynth. Its a beautiful game though the characters are a bit on the ugly side. My biggest complaint is the dialogue. Without spoiling the MCs especially the guy will say things that contradict something he will say literaly 5 seconds later. LIke "This guy know this" then you find out the guy doesnt know that then he says "Why doesnt the guy know this?" I get there is a plot point for why this might be the case but just some of the dialogue is weird. I am going to recommend this game but only on sale because of the price and how short of a game it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022207400', 'num_games_owned': 945, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1535299357}
review:
Also eine Sache vorab. Ich werde spoilern + ich kann nur eine Kaufempfehlung an die Besitzer von 1 eins geben/ nicht geben.
Ich finde das Spiele ist ohne VorgÃ¤nger definitiv nicht zu empfehlen, weil dir zu viele ZusammenhÃ¤nge fehlen.

Kann ich das Spiel empfehlen?
Jein!
Warum ja: Es ist bildlich einfach nur ein Augenschmaus. Die Welt ist zum verlieben. Die Charaktere sind nett und Sympatisch. An manchen Stellen im Spiel dachte ich mir nur "ach ist das schÃ¶n. ich wÃ¼nsche ich wÃ¤re gerade dabei".

Warum nein. Die Spielmechanik ist primitiv bis kaum vorhanden. Es hÃ¤tte als Serie vielleicht gleich gut, wenn nicht besser funktioniert. Die Story macht ohne VorgÃ¤nger wenig Sinn. Das Ende ist sehr kritisch zu beachtet. Ich mag nicht, dass in einer Version man den Spiegel zerstÃ¶rt und irgendwie das "schlechte" Ende hat weil Noah tot ist. Wenn man aber den Spiegel repariert (sich dafÃ¼r entscheidet tot zu sein) Ã¼berlebt Noah. Sry aber diese Entwicklerentscheidung mag ich nicht.
AuÃŸerdem hat man das Spiel viel zu schnell durch. Gerade wo ich dachte "ah jetzt gehts los" --> Ende...
Ich mag auÃŸerdem nicht, dass man mit mehr Fragen zurÃ¼ck bleibt als man das Spiel angefangen hat trotz VorgÃ¤nger wissen. z.B. wenn wollte Kyra heiraten?

Ich kann das Spiel zu 51% eher empfehlen. Also nur 1% mehr... aber NUR weil ich den VorgÃ¤nger so geliebt habe und dieses Spiel im Sale gekauft habe.

FÃ¼r alle Besitzer des VorgÃ¤ngers empfehle ich einen Kauf bei ca 5â‚¬ bis max 7,50â‚¬. Das Spiel ist leider echt nicht mehr Wert. Kein Widerspielwert (die Achievments sind witzlos und eher ermÃ¼dend). Die Story ist ok aber zu kurz, Ende ist kontrovers und Nebencharaktere dann doch zu belanglos wenn auch sehr sympatisch.
Die Entwicklung innerhalb der Story hat mir zwar gefallen aber war auch nicht zu schwer zu erahnen. Bis auf das abrupte Ende vielleicht. Das kam echt plÃ¶tzlich.

Also nochmal in kurz.
Ich empfehle an: Besitzer des VorgÃ¤nger + Sale,
Ich empfehle nicht an: Wer sich eine groÃŸe Story erhofft, knifflige RÃ¤tsel sucht

author: {'steamid': '76561198014016938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1534593105}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041832614', 'num_games_owned': 2162, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1374, 'last_played': 1682786022}
review:
A story about two kids hiding in a bunker during a bombardment.
The bunker gets hit by a bomb, and both kids awake in the world of Silence.
Well written and beautiful animated point and click adventure.
Adorable characters, especially Spot, a super-caterpillar that can transform into a bridge among other things.
Fully voiced and no need to play the first part (The Whispered World).
A real masterpiece,  10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198068983474', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1533359040}
review:
You play as two sibblings, Renie and Noah. Exploring the world of silence on a quest to get home. I don't want to spoil the story cause that's what makes the game good but suffice to say - it's pretty dark with some good comic relief. 

I really liked this game even if it has its issues.

Pro:
Great story
Interesting characters
Beautiful
Dark
Music

Con:
Gameplay is kinda slow
Load times (even using SSD drive) ruins the immersion and makes progression a bit frustrating

Other:
The puzzles you need to solve to progress are for the most party pretty good however to some extent they can be frustrating cause they take too long due to gameplay mechanics.
You should install it on an SSD drive or you'll spend as long in loading as playing the game. (My CPU also might have been a bit of a chokepoint - using an i5).

Overall: 7.5/10 the story makes it up for some poor gameplay mechanics and makes the game worth playing.

review:
Das Spiel hat mich direkt in den Bann gezogen. Sei es die wunderschÃ¶ne Szenerie..der passende Soundtrack sowie die Charaktere...Renie und Spot hab ich gleich ins Herz geschlossen :) Die Stimmung find ich sehr emotional...
Leider ist das Spiel doch recht schnell durchgespielt...Und es gibt 2 Enden?! Das Ende ist sehr knapp gehalten ;( obwohl ich gerne gesehen hÃ¤tte was mit den anderen Charakteren sowie Spot passiert ist....:( die wurden am Ende leider garnicht mehr erwÃ¤hnt...und schade das es kein Ende gibt an dem Renie und Noah wieder zusammen in der realen Welt erwachen...auch wenn sie die da nichts erwartet auÃŸer Kummer und Leid...
Trotzallem hÃ¤tte ich das Spiel noch ewig spielen kÃ¶nnen ! zu schade das es nun vorbei ist..aber ich bereu es nicht gespielt zu haben :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060857661', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1532321603}
review: This game is a sequel to The Whispered World. At no point in time does it tell you its a sequel and you dont miss anything if you haven't played the first game. Personally I didn't like this game, It feels terribly easy for a point and click adventure , even more so since you can press space and it will show you all the interractions on screen and give you a hint on what to do. This generates a conflict between story and gameplay, the story has some mature elements but the gameplay feels aimed at people new to the genre. The best part of the game is the art, The main characters remind me a bit of fable and the backgrounds are nice and have some interesting scenery. After finishing it I went back to the first game and its art is completely different, It uses a more cartoon feel compared to this one. (maybe to differentiate the two parts further?). The game is 6 hours long at max, While I didn't enjoy my time in Silence as much as I thought I would, I can see the appeal for fans of the first game. I recommend getting it on sale unless you REALLY REALLY love the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093476565', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1532121044}
review:
Silence Ã¨ il seguito di The Whispered World ed Ã¨ ambientato qualche anno dopo il suo predecessore. Questa volta i protagonisti sono 2: Noah, il protagonista di The Whispered World, e la sua sorellina Renie. La storia comincia nel nostro mondo, dilianiato dalla guerra, e prosegue poi su Silence (il mondo in cui Ã¨ ambientato anche il primo episodio), dove Noah dovrÃ  ritrovare la sua sorellina ed insieme poi dovranno riuscire a tornare nel nostro mondo. La storia Ã¨ molto carina, sviluppata bene fino ai 3/4 del gioco, e poi subisce una brusca accelerata, come se si avesse fretta di chiuderla. CiÃ² nonostante resta una bella storia, pervasa da un alone di malinconia, che personalmente mi Ã¨ rimasto anche dopo la fine del gioco.

Graficamente si passa dal grafica cartonesca del primo episodio a quella in 2.5D, inizialmente l'idea mi ha fatto un po' storcere il naso, ma quando ci ho giocato invece l'ho trovata molto carina, sia per quanto riguarda i personaggi (soprattutto Renie e Spot), che per gli scenari, alcuni davvero incantevoli. 

Le musiche del gioco ben accompagnano lo svolgimento della storia, alcune sono anche molto rilassanti. Il doppiaggio, purtroppo solo in inglese, mi Ã¨ sembrato di un livello piÃ¹ che adeguato.

Gli enigmi del gioco sono abbastanza semplici, alla fine si tratta soltanto di trovare l'oggetto giusto per risolvere l'indovinello o di parlare con il personaggio che ci puÃ² indirizzare, non ci sono mai oggetti da combinare tra di loro oppure enigmi astrusi che possono bloccare il giocatore. Anche chi Ã¨ novizio delle avventure grafiche non avrÃ  problemi a completare la storia.

Come longevitÃ  del gioco, siamo intorno alle 7-8 ore per una prima run, ma ci vogliono almeno 2 run se si vogliono vedere tutti i finali e prendere tutti gli achievement steam. La seconda run Ã¨ molto piÃ¹ veloce, in quanto si possono saltare anche tutti i filmati ed i dialoghi che non interessano. 

Sicuramente lo consiglio sia agli appassionati del genere sia a chi piacciono le belle storie, mezzo voto in meno per i finali, tutti mi hanno lasciato l'amaro in bocca.

Voto 7/10
