author: {'steamid': '76561198107822003', 'num_games_owned': 690, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1640774378}
review:
I love this game. I'm really glad that it was in a recent humble bundle - I never heard of it before, which is quite sad; this gem really should be more well-known.

The characters are so [i]real[/i], the faces so expressive, and the voice acting is so good that you can't help falling in love with all of them. The story is beautifully melancholic, if confusing at a few points (I recommend interacting with everything until the texts start repeating to get more of the story).

The game only has two flaws. First, there's a bug that makes one achievement nearly impossible to get (if you care about those, play with a controller instead of keyboard and mouse), and from what I read, Daedalic doesn't seem to care. Second, and far worse, though: It's too short. You get four or five hours with those great people, and then you're done.

I'd really love to see a sequel to Silence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017723245', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 216, 'last_played': 1531246541}
review:
I've played the previous game in the series, and honestly didn't enjoy it too much. 
I saw this game and thought it may improve on the good concepts from the first, but sadly, it was worse.
The game was short, the characters were lacking, and the gameplay felt like I'm being forced to interact with the game just to feel like I'm actually "playing" and it's not just a story all by itself...

I was rather disappointed, but perhaps I was too hyped before playing (by all the good reviews and my hopes for a better installment in the series).

If you really liked the previous game, give it a shot, otherwise, I don't think it's worth your time.

review: this game is easily a childrens game but its pretty fun even for adults. wiht a heart warming story and fun characters and a creative animation, great voice acting... i wish there were more games like this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093623385', 'num_games_owned': 69, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1530179263}
review:
I would give this game a good 8/10. 
The game play was very nice as well as the scenes and music. The ouzzles were mostly easy but a few took longer to crack. The story itself I enjoyed very much and involved many suspensful moments. It's a cute game and fun to play and for 20$ it was worth it. I really enjoy games that feature your choices have the effect on what happens in the game. It was interesting to play and my stream enjoyed it very much!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967283277', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 370, 'last_played': 1530216007}
review: Silence is not a bad game. It has some nice parts, like the music and some of the art. But the rest of the game is very meh. The puzzles are Telltale-style simple combinations, neither memorable nor interesting to solve. The story and script is downright bizarre, with major characters appearing, saying very little, then disappearing in short succession and I definitely would not have understood what was going on if I hadnâ€™t have played the prequel (The Whispered World). Both of these games are pretty depressing too - and without any noticeable moral or reason in this game. All in all, I couldnâ€™t really recommend Silence - there are so many better point and click games out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236200726', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1595991537}
review:
This game was a delight to play. The graphics were beautiful and the character voice overs were better than most games I have played. I thought the puzzles were difficult to solve in most cases (it might have just been me) because it took me some time to figure out what to do, but once you do get it, it makes you appreciate the minds of the creators. Very well thought out. 
I also liked being able to go back and forth between characters, so if I was stuck in one place, I could go to the next character and come back to it later.  My only critisizm were the two endings. I felt like they both just ended abruptly. In one case, it would have been nice to have seen the outcome play out. This game took me about 15 hours to finish and I only got 19 out of 46 achievements.  I will probably play it again to try and best that score! Definatly one of the better games I have played this year!

I also wanted to add my graphics card is an on-board Intel 3000 and I had no problems at all even though the recommended minimum for Intel is 5000

author: {'steamid': '76561198224473684', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 422, 'last_played': 1530066992}
review: Silence was an amazing story rich game that kept me captivated the entire way through. The puzzles were mostly easy enough with comon sense mixed with a little imagination. I am glad I got to play through an amazing game that allowed me to be taken to a different world stress free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119241215', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1554621103}
review:
Es un juego exelente. SIn mas.
Tiene una historia de magia y fantasia a la altura de Disney , bien creado, con un apartado grafico que deslumbra y con personajes altamente carismaticos. 
Espero la segunda parte con ansias; oajala la haya.
Si te gusta la aventura grafica, compra tranquilo , no te vas a arrepentir.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059623957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 400, 'last_played': 1529859018}
review: The game is beautiful in every way. Most puzzles made sense, but they weren't too easy. Only things I disliked were the inability to skip dialogue and cutscenes, as well as no save when you want options that I've gotten used to in Daedalic's point-and-click games. All in all, a great experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378005200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 225, 'playtime_forever': 347, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1529842536}
review:
Nice little game with a pleasant story. Worth a playthrough. Buy it on heavy sale or within a large bundle. Only about 6 hours long, so not worth the $20 price tag.... It has regular references / comments about a "previous game" throughout the dialogue, which is kind of annoying - especially when there is no mention of this "other game" in the Silence description. So not a direct sequel but it's linked to another game. Doesn't ruin the game, but there is a few "what the hells" when a character mentions the past.

Graphics is beautiful and runs fine on Windows 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998118312', 'num_games_owned': 2100, 'num_reviews': 388, 'playtime_forever': 734, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1529448674}
review:
Rating: 7/10
Overview: Point and Click Adventure

The Good:
+ The scenery looks beautiful and really makes the world of Silence come to life. Easily the highlight of the game
+ The story is well told with interesting characters.  
+ Logical puzzles 
+ Great soundtrack 

The Average:
+/- A very short game, clocking in at around 3-5 hours depending on skill level

+/- This is much easier than most other point and click games, people looking to get into the genre will love this game while others looking for a challenge will feel disappointed. 

+/- This is a sequel to A Whispering World, although you donâ€™t have to play it before hand, it does help a little bit. 

+/- Load times felt a bit too long for me. 

The Bad:
- Cutscenes and most dialogue can not be skipped. 
- glitchy achievements. 

Conclusion:
I really enjoyed my time with the game, but it was hard to ignore some of the more serious flaws presented. Those looking for a nice light-hearted fantasy story will enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198444467070', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1529285067}
review: The game graphics look great. I love how the game is structured to step through the story. However, I found it to be exhaustively slow to progress through the game. It takes way too long to do the simplest of tasks. I made it to the tar pit at the beginning of the game and turned it off. The story seemed really promising but the game takes way too long to progress. I would recommend this game to anyone who enjoys taking a LOT of time moving through this games unique pace. Not for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046881436', 'num_games_owned': 421, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1529220102}
review:
Silence is a short and bittersweet tale of Renie and her brother, Noah, as they travel the realm of Silence in an effort to save each other, and ultimately the realm itself.

This is a puzzle, point + click adventure game. The puzzles aren't anything too tedious save for the occasional bug which may result in the need to revert to the last checkpoint. The game is presented beautifully with its intricate and highly detailed hand painted art and lovely compositions that set the atmosphere and help to convey the emotions of the game and its environments. 

Save for the main characters, you have a few as an aside, some a cameo from the prequel, others new. These characters aren't fleshed out as well as they could be, but serve their purpose in keeping the story moving. 


Ultimately I think Silence is a good game in its own right. The visuals are absolutely stunning, the sound design is competent if not, avegerage for a Deadalic title, and the gameplay is not so tiring to dissuade one from finishing the game. At roughly 7 hours for the average playthrough it can be comfortably completed with little stress. 
 
The only problems I had is that I believe the game to be hampered down by its own design. The characters, save from Renie and Noah, are hollow and bland. The voice acting is weak and entirely unbelievable and only serves to pull you out of the game. This was my biggest gripe as it's one of the most prominent. It only serves to undermine the potential value of interest you have in these characters as their performances are substantially less than stellar. Unfortunate and quite comical that the bulk of the talent was cast into two talking rocks. 

The sound design as I've experienced with Daedelic games seems to be somewhat muffled, nothing truly sounds crisp and clean, but just a not entirely luster polish. The puzzles aren't rewarding as their challenge mainly comes from experimentation of clickables on the screen, and most/all can be solved with little effort. There's a few reported bugs in the game which served to completely undo some people's experience, and I myself had to revert to a previous checkpoint due to a glitch.

To compliment all of this the game features two possible endings - which were somewhat abrupt - and dialogue choices which only prove to be entirely pointless and serve as an illusion of choice. 

Overall:
Story 7-8/10
Characters 5/10
Gameplay 6/10
Sound 7/10
Visuals 10/10

Recommend picking up on sale, it's still tidy and clean little game, if one can overlook its problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016913653', 'num_games_owned': 305, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 321, 'last_played': 1528966550}
review:
[h1]A Compact Experience into an Established World.[/h1]

I got Silence in a Humble Bundle. I didn't realize it was the sequel to The Whispered World. While it didn't seem necessary to play the first there were some references to it and you might be more investested in the characters and world if you do play that one first. However, I did not.

[list]
[*]I really liked the hint system. Middle Mouse Button.
[*]The end save game is perfect for allowing you to see multiple endings.
[*]The story is interesting.
[*]The art is fantastic.
[*]The switching between characters is a really good change of pace.
[/list]

Even though, I hadn't played the first game its still possible to get invested in these characters and the story. I never felt like I was struggling with the controls or with what to do next. These are pretty big things for me because it allows for me to get immersed into the game. I have so many games in my backlog this was a perfect glimps into this story without having to play the first one.

[url=https://www.twitch.tv/collections/w_RrzCjxNxX9vw]Get a sneak peak by watching my Twitch play through.[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198076030480', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 326, 'last_played': 1528662357}
review:
I wish I could recommand it, because I did enjoy playing it. Sadly, every time I left the game and came back, there were more bugs. At one point in the middle of chapter 2, between a cutscene and another, the game did a  jump forward, leaving me to guess a very big chunk of the story. The reverse also did happen, the game back tracking between loading scene. I was stuck having to do many puzzle I already did with renie and sam while I was way forward in the story with Noah and kyra. 
I guess it's a good game if you aren't as unlucky as me with the bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027058501', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 432, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 432, 'last_played': 1527984256}
review: This is a very beautiful game, I just loved looking at all the backgrounds and animations and the English voices are pretty decent.  The story however is a little weak, especially compared to the first game which was longer and had more characters to interact and talk with. While I do like the new characters in this game they just aren't featured enough. It feel like there is an act missing from the game and the end is far too abrupt. Overall though this is a pretty good game, especially after playing The Whispered World before it. Now we just need a third game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200980770', 'num_games_owned': 343, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 450, 'last_played': 1527729678}
review:
Silence te trÃ¡s aquelas experiÃªncias visuais exuberantes e um enredo cheio de mensagens sobre o amor fraternal, companheirismo e o combate contra o mal. Ele Ã© dramatico e infantil, e isso sÃ£o mÃ©ritos. A histÃ³ria dos protagonistas Ã© fruto de uma infÃ¢ncia sofrÃ­vel durante uma guerra, onde ao se esconderem em um bunker, uma bomba atinge eles e os deixa em coma. Ambos, se vem no mundo dos sonhos Silence para que participem de uma breve aventura para poderem acordar.

Este point & click Ã© curto, porÃ©m ele aborda muito bem as consequencias da coragem, teimosia e crueldade. E cada um dos personagens que aparecem, pode muito bem caracterizar unicamente algumas caracteristicas humanas. O jogo tambÃ©m Ã© muito engraÃ§ado e aventuresco. Ele tem puzzles que nÃ£o sÃ£o uma dor de cabeÃ§a, mas te fazem perder um pouco de tempo de vez em quando. Eu tive sensaÃ§Ãµes de Child of Light em alguns momentos, e isso foi muito prazeroso... E finalmente o final. 

Ambos os finais trazem consequencias que eu gostaria muito de comentar, mas nÃ£o quero dar spoiler, mas posso dizer que mesmo seus finais felizes, ambos sÃ£o disfarÃ§adamente chocantes e cruÃ©is. Recomendadissimo. NÃ£o Ã© uma obra prima, mas Ã© um jogo muito acertado na sua proposta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198369689010', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 862, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1571852511}
review:
Silence, c'est un monde empli de fantaisie et de poÃ©sie, d'une grÃ¢ce et d'une beautÃ© Ã  couper le souffle...

S'il m'est difficile de dÃ©crire les Ã©motions qui m'ont Ã©treinte durant ma premiÃ¨re traversÃ©e de cet univers en perdition, je peux nÃ©anmoins affirmer que les OST qui ont transpercÃ© mon coeur pour en extraire les sentiments les plus purs, les graphismes d'une beautÃ© irrÃ©elle, presque fragile et l'histoire poignante n'y sont pas pour rien.

Des personnages riches aux caractÃ¨res et physiques variÃ©s, des puzzles originaux, une histoire d'aventure et de fraternitÃ© palpitante, des Ã©motions finement recrÃ©Ã©es, des graphismes Ã  couper le souffle et une bande-son parfaisant l'ambiance, tous les Ã©lÃ©ments nÃ©cessaires Ã  la confection d'un excellent jeu sont, Ã  ma connaissance et Ã  mon humble avis, rÃ©unis par Silence.

La rÃ©flexion qu'induit Silence est elle aussi trÃ¨s intÃ©ressante. La vie et la mort sont bien entendu au coeur de celle-ci, mais on trouve Ã©galement quelques pistes sur sa place dans le monde, l'innocence enfantine et les sacrifices qui doivent ou non Ãªtre faits au nom de la paix et de la libertÃ©.

En somme, Silence est un jeu excellent en tous points. Un guide risque nÃ©anmoins de vous Ãªtre nÃ©cessaire (car aprÃ¨s tout, Silence reste un point'n'click...).

author: {'steamid': '76561198111040148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 508, 'last_played': 1527389243}
review:
Silence ist eins der Spiele die in mir den Wunsch hervorrufen es gebe hier ein Sterne-System. WÃ¤hrend der geschichtliche VorÃ¤nger "The Whispered World" mit stellenweise frustrierend kniffeligen RÃ¤tseln auffÃ¤hrt, hat Silence mehr Fokus auf die Story gelegt, die wirklich charmant gestaltet und mit einigen emotionalen Hightlights versehen ist; sowie einem Storytwist auf den es zwar von Anfang an den einen oder anderen Hinweis gibt, der sich aber erst zur Mitte hin klar abzeichnet. Er mag fÃ¼r die Spieler auch durchaus ein wenig irritierend kommen... aber wir wollen ja nicht zu viel verraten. 

Ãœber die meisten RÃ¤tsel muss man nicht lange nachdenken, wenn man halbwegs aufmerksam bleibt. Sie sind einfach- fÃ¼r meinen Geschmack ein wenig zu einfach- gestaltet, lassen dem Spieler dafÃ¼r mehr Raum einfach die Geschichte zu genieÃŸen. Eine recht kurze Geschichte. Von Sadwick abgesehen, erfÃ¤hrt man auch nicht allzu viel Ã¼ber die verschiedenen Charaktere- und hier empfehle ich das man den VorgÃ¤nger gespielt hat, um die Parallelen zu ziehen. Doch auch wenn man ihn nicht spielt, versteht man zumindest um was es geht und das einer der beiden Protagonisten Noah alias Sadwick durchaus mit Silence vertraut zu sein scheint. - Ein wenig als wÃ¼rde Alice ins Wunderland zurÃ¼ckkehren. Was ich auch befÃ¼rworte ist die Aussage des Spiels und das man am Ende wirklich eine Entscheidung hat- nicht wie bei dem VorÃ¤nger, wo diese einfach  nicht gegeben ist.

Wie gesagt: Geschichte und auch die Grafik sind charmant und die beiden Hauptcharaktere- vor allem zusammen- sind liebevoll gestaltet. Schade ist nur das Sadwick gelegentlich in sein Verhalten aus "The Whispered World" zurÃ¼ckfÃ¤llt. 

Was WIRKLICH ein Ã„rgernis ist: Es kann passieren dass das Spiel abstÃ¼rzt und es zu Speicherfehlern kommt. Hier rate ich eine Suche im Internet. Es gibt auf der Daedelic-Seite zu dem Spiel SpeicherstÃ¤nde zum runterladen, damit man nicht von vorne anfangen muss. 

[b]Fazit:[/b]
Pro: 
[list][*]SchÃ¶ne, charmante Geschichte. 
[*]Keine Frustration beim LÃ¶sen der RÃ¤tsel. 
[*]Entscheidung am Ende
[*]SchÃ¶ne Grafik[/list]

Contra:
[list][*]Gelegentliche Speicherprobleme und AbstÃ¼rze
[*]Zu leichte RÃ¤tsel
[*]Die Story zu kurz[/list] 

[u]Tipp:[/u] 20 Euro fÃ¼r das Spiel sind meines Erachtens zu viel, kauft es euch im Angebot. Dann ist es das Geld definitiv wert. 

Spoiler:
Es betrifft das Ende der Geschichte. Eins der beiden Enden hat noch ein kleines Sequel nach dem Abspann, das gar nicht so unwichtig ist.
DafÃ¼r ist das Andere leicht misszuinterpretieren, da der Hinweis, dass der Schein nur trÃ¼gt gern mal Ã¼bersehen wird (vorsicht groÃŸer Spoiler!):
[spoiler]Wenn ihr euch dafÃ¼r entscheidet den Spiegel zu zerschlagen scheint es so als wÃ¤re Noah tot und Renie nun alleine. Nachdem die Hand jedoch von ihm zu Boden fÃ¤llt und Renie Ã¼ber seinen leblos wirkenden KÃ¶rper weint, zuckt die Hand kurz auf. Achtet darauf. Das kÃ¶nnte zart Besaiteten vielleicht ein wenig Hoffnung geben. ;)[/spoiler]

Es lohnt sich also beide Enden mal gesehen zu haben. Und es kÃ¶nnte ein Versprechen auf einen dritten Teil sein: Yeah!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055301588', 'num_games_owned': 1098, 'num_reviews': 217, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1526756345}
review:
[h1]Silence â–¸ BrÃ¨ve[/h1]

[b]Version vidÃ©o accessible ici : [/b] https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CWwDDQ-TKLs

Globalement, Silence nâ€™est pas du tout mauvais, il est super joli, il offre une histoire assez imprÃ©visible, enfin sauf la fin qui, elle, se sent Ã  des kilomÃ¨tres une fois quâ€™on a compris un peu le schmilblick. Par contre, en ce qui concerne les Ã©tapes intermÃ©diaires, ben Ã§a a Ã©tÃ©. Ã§a sâ€™est bien enchaÃ®nÃ© sans Ãªtre trop prÃ©visible. Donc rien que pour Ã§a, je trouve que câ€™est un bon point. Alors Ã§a nâ€™en fait pas le jeu narratif suprÃªme, surtout que câ€™est trÃ¨s subjectif de ma part mais voilÃ . 

Hm par contre je lâ€™aurais clairement pas achetÃ© Ã  20â‚¬. Jâ€™avais dÃ©jÃ  jouÃ© Ã  la dÃ©mo qui Ã©tait sortie en 2016 et trÃ¨s clairement, jâ€™avais bien aimÃ©. Mais je lâ€™aurais pas achetÃ© Ã  ce prix-lÃ . MÃªme si oui les graphismes et lâ€™histoire sont particuliÃ¨rement agrÃ©ables, ben Ã§a fait cher pour 6h de jeu. Basiquement si tu compares Ã§a Ã  un livre, on va dire que pour 13-15â‚¬ Ã§a devient ok. 

MÃ©caniquement, ben câ€™est un point & click, donc tu pointes et tu cliques avec ta souris pour faire telle ou telle action. De toute maniÃ¨re on le sait trÃ¨s bien, un point & click se base surtout sur une trame narrative et des puzzles que tu peux rÃ©soudre, etcâ€¦ Tu peux pas vraiment innover lÃ  dedans, je veux dire tâ€™as juste un personnage que tu promÃ¨nes en cliquant un peu partout sur les trucs en surbriâ€¦ Ah pardon on me dit dans lâ€™oreillette quâ€™il y a une petite innovation dans Silence, Spot ! En jouant Ã  Silence, vous aurez lâ€™occasion de contrÃ´ler 3 personnages en gros, Renie, Noa/Sadwick et Spot. Basiquement Renie et Noa sont des humains somme toute normaux et ont des capacitÃ©s somme toute normales&. Par contre Spot est intÃ©ressant parce quâ€™il offre une dynamique de puzzle assez diffÃ©rente. Cela dit, on ne peut pas considÃ©rer cela comme une vÃ©ritable innovation non plus, câ€™est juste un personnage avec des capacitÃ©s diffÃ©rentes. Mais câ€™est intÃ©ressant tout de mÃªme. 

En parlant des puzzles, hm je les ai trouvÃ© ni simple ni compliquÃ©. Pour moi câ€™Ã©tait un entre deux. Avec parfois des passages oÃ¹ je bloquais un peu, et parfois des passages oÃ¹ Ã§a passait tout seul.

Quâ€™on se le dise, les deux seules choses qui mâ€™ont gÃªnÃ© dans Silence, câ€™est le fait que tu ais des saves par checkpoint,  du coup tu peux pas quitter quand tu bloques sur un puzzle. Enfin si mais tu vas recommencer au checkpoint. Câ€™est pour Ã§a que jâ€™ai 11h de jeu sur Silence, jâ€™ai laissÃ© mon jeu allumÃ© pour pas perdre lâ€™endroit oÃ¹ jâ€™Ã©tais. Lâ€™autre point, câ€™est cette lenteur peut Ãªtre un peu trop lente ainsi que le fait quâ€™on puisse pas â€œaccÃ©lÃ©rerâ€ une action ou des dialogues quâ€™on a dÃ©jÃ  vus.

Je recommande Silence mais seulement Ã  ceux qui apprÃ©cient la lenteur des Point & click, parce que pour le coup, il est un peu plus lent que la moyenne. Je nâ€™ai pas parlÃ© de la bande son, mais je vous laisse lâ€™apprÃ©cier en jeu, elle est trÃ¨s bien accordÃ© avec celui-ci.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038623950', 'num_games_owned': 646, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1526678270}
review:
Excellent follow up to "Whispered World", just a little bit shorter than I had hoped. The story and the characters were endearing. The graphics great and no glitches/bugs that I could find.

The ending broke my heart, but I guess I was half expecting it. The guys at Daedelic really know how to write stories that touch the heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082837044', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1346, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1346, 'last_played': 1524448761}
review:
I spent $6 on this game getting it on sale and for the price of $6 it was a delightful adventure. 

If you are a fan of point and click adventure this games, this is a good one. The animation is colorful and fun. It's a great fantasy setting. This felt like watching a long movie. The puzzles were easy to solve and continue through. In general this is a good game.

My gut reaction unfortunately was to say no I do not recommend this game. Some of the voice acting was down right off, there was very little, if any, character development, some of the details of the game like the menus did not seem to fit in with the rest of the game, and it just generally lacked the polish of a finished game. My biggest grievance though is that it was just too short. Don't look at my play time, I left it running over night. This game is about a 10 hour game. Just as the plot picks up and the puzzles are hitting their stride and I felt like I was "getting into it" the game was over. I was not expecting a crazy long blockbuster or anything but I was definitely let down.

To go back to my first point though, I only spent $6 on this game. For $6 it was great and that's why I gave it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027994280', 'num_games_owned': 510, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 409, 'last_played': 1525282397}
review:
Silence is a fun, but short adventure. If you are looking for a casual, slightly easy point-and-click adventure this is definitely a fun game for you.

[h1]Pro's[/h1]
[list]
[*]Great looking fantasy world, with fully 3d animated characters 
[*]Sound/music is okay, though not memorable
[*]Throughout the game there is a small companion that allows for some interesting problem solving
[*]More than just pointing and clicking - for example to move some objects you have to hold and drag, sometimes you need to balance by keeping your mouse steady, et cetera

[/list]
[h1]Cons[/h1]
[list]
[*]The story felt confusing. It started with characters talking about people you've never seen in a way that assumes you already know them, and then you end up in a world which is apparently familiar to the main characters even though you've never seen it. I felt like I was playing Silence 2 and had to have played part 1 to understand some stuff.
[*]There are barely any puzzles in the game, and the ones that there are are short, very easy and not memorable. It felt like some of them were placed as an afterthought rather than being part of the game. 
[*]You don't have any inventory, and in regards to interactions with NPC's there is only the occasional dialogue choice. There is barely any experimenting required to continue forwards as there are simply too few options and objects to interact with to begin with. 
[*]The cast of characters that you interact with are very shallow. One of them is being mentioned all the time and seems to have quite some importance, but is actually on screen for 1 small section of the game (literally 1 screen), never to be seen again. For those that have already played, I'm talking about [spoiler]the prophet[/spoiler].
[*]The voice of Renie (one of the main characters) is absolutely horrible. It annoyed me throughout the game and because of her voice I considered quitting so many times 
[/list]

If you are looking for a fun point-and-click adventure to play on the weekend, Silence could fill that gap for you!

[i]Was this review useful to you? [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/26849460/][u]Subscribe to the Izzy Reviews Curator page[/u][/url] for regular reviews for other games![/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198001251929', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1526440096}
review: Too much motions until an action is made, scenes are not skippable, and too much loading.  Boringggggggggg

author: {'steamid': '76561198097520769', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1525862886}
review:
Since you are playing in an "imaginary world", where the story is based on a child, I already expected the game to be lovley.
But this game took it to a new level, not so much the interaction between characters is the best thing, but more the interaction in puzzles(Hint: they got a hint if you don't get on) so you are neither stuck in a zone for too long.
Puzzels, interactions, graphics, music, level design and much more, makes this game one of the best (non fighting)story games, I ever played.
The only thing I could have wished more is that the character dialog got more influence in the story(the story seems to be quite static)
9/10
Note: I bearly read books.This game is close to a book(but better;) )

author: {'steamid': '76561197992550343', 'num_games_owned': 1317, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 696, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1526818793}
review:
Amazing game !

I had some trouble starting the game, but the support of Daedelic Entertainment helped me thru it, even tho it took 2 weeks for them to respond to my issue. I am really glad i took the time the write something to support cause i would have missed out.....

Played thru the story twice and on my 2nd playthru, i was not less entertained as i was on my first.  
- nice graphics and sounds
- good voice actors really bring the characters to life
- real fun interactive puzzles
- compelling (interactive) story

author: {'steamid': '76561198074845294', 'num_games_owned': 1302, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1524948482}
review:
I really enjoyed this. but don't be fooled, it's not that much of a "game" really. you click here and there from time to time, but that doesn't matter you won't enjoy it. I relaxed for three evenings after work and loved every minute of Silence.
It looks great, it has a fine adventure story, likeable characters, nice music. and it all feels like a sunday afternoon cartoon in the best meaning of it. I really love it. sometimes the loading times are annoyingly long, but not like you have time to make yourself a coffee. it just draws you back from the story a little bit at times, but overall I love this.
buy it on sale and play it when you feel like playing, but more for the story and relax than for action packed experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062771675', 'num_games_owned': 406, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1524817621}
review:
I was lured into buying this game on visuals alone, I'm a real sucker for style over substance kinda media, but I am more than happy to say Silence has [i] both [/i] style and substance to bring to the table. A rare feat for any kind of interactive media. Whats more this title's 2016 release saw itself stacked up against its main competition's weakest year. As prolific a studio and talented a development staff that is Telltale Games its 2016 lineup stand as an example of a formula getting stale, between Minecraft: Story Mode and The Walking Dead: Michonne, 2016 was a real groaner year for mainstream point and click adventure fair. So for this game as stylish and imaginative as it is to fly under my radar is a crying shame, but I am damn happy to have played it finally.

From what I've gathered via context clues from dialogue and world-building throughout the story, this [i] IS [/i] a sequel to another game, one which I have bought but have yet to play. At first, once I learned of this I thought I would be left behind as the story ran far ahead of me leaving me clueless as to what was going on. But the way things get explained and how the story is told I was almost always on the same page in regards to where the story was at and what the stakes were. If something confused me it was very adequately explained in that or the next scene. I imagine this is because the cast is made of largely new faces, and our main heroine is a newcomer to everything with only secondhand at best knowledge of the world, so she always has questions about the goings-on. This allows for very naturalistic ways in which characters can exposit plot points or describe nuances to her and avoid the common pitfall of awkward exposition dumps. Gameplay is pretty typical of a point and click title with a few wrinkles added in, like one where you must pull the mouse in a direction to make the player feel like the character is struggling to do something. It has some puzzles but none of them are outright difficult, only mild brain teasers that will only need a short amount of time to figure out. I think it's for the best that the game is light on puzzles, as Silence's strengths lie in its visuals and story.

If I had one criticism though, it would have to be about the voice acting. I played the English Dub in which I found a few things to be off. Particularly, the timing of lines sometimes came too soon, where one character may have a had a witty retort but the audio plays as the other character is still talking. I also felt some of the delivery of lines were a little mediocre, calling out voice acting is something I don't normally do as I respect it as an art form and I won't outright call any of the performances bad, just some lines are delivered awkwardly or are not given enough emotion or urgency. that could easily be down to direction but its little things like a character saying something normally when their body language would suggest otherwise. Mostly just a nitpick, honestly.

By rights, this game should have shown up in the top sellers section on steam for me to have seen it when it released (maybe it did, might've just missed it). But you can fix that! You should totally buy Silence now!

review:
Wer lust hat ein spannendes Abenteuer in einer fremden Welt zu erleben liegt mit diesem Spiel genau richtig. Man betrettet die Welt Silence nach einer kleinen Einleitung, die wÃ¤hrend eines Krieges (2.WK) spielt. Als das Geschwisterpaar in einem Bunker Schutz sucht, doch plÃ¶tzlich schlÃ¤gt eine Bombe ein. Als nÃ¤chstes haben wir den Ãœbergang nach Silence. Doch was ist Silence? Und wie geht die Geschichte aus? Die Wahrheit hinter dieser MysthiriÃ¶sen Welt erfÃ¤hrt man im Spiel und ich mÃ¶chte hier nicht Spoilern, und den Ausgang kann man mit seinen Entscheidungen beeinflussen.

Das Spiel ist eine Mischung aus Logik und Suchen mit einigen Minispielen die recht leicht sind.

Allem in allem ist es ein schÃ¶nes Spiel um fÃ¼r ca 6h Spielzeit in einer anderen Welt abzuschweifen und zu entspannen.

review:
PiÃ¹ che un gioco Ã¨ un film, una storia molto bella con una grafica altrettanto bella. Ci sono momenti di gioco punta e clicca ma a differenza del primo non raccogli oggetti in un inventario, quei pochi che raccogli servono quasi subito, per il resto ci sono solo azioni da compiere e sono anche facili. Verso la fine non fai quasi piÃ¹ niente e ti godi solo la storia.
Questo gioco per me vale tutto per Renie, la bambina, un personaggio davvero meraviglioso e tenerissimo e per la bella storia.

Man kann nur sagen, man mÃ¶chte danach mehr sehen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026383113', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1516131677}
review: This is a direct sequel of The Whispered World, which you would have to play through first to understand some of the characters & parts of what is going on. It is an awesome game with stunning art, the characters are easy to get attached to & you'll quickly become invested in the story. Unlike the previous game, it's more story driven and less of the exploring every area to find the solution.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971006744', 'num_games_owned': 3873, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1522509755}
review:
Maravilloso este Silence, no jugÃ© en su momento a su precuela "The whispered world" y es algo que despuÃ©s de jugar a este titulo harÃ© sin falta, por lo que ya aviso que desconozco ciertos detalles o referencias del tÃ­tulo anterior que seguro que plagan este juego.

Aun asÃ­, lo recomiendo muy fuerte, tenemos una aventura grÃ¡fica point&click en 2,5D, donde por ciertas circustancias de la historia nos moveremos por un mundo mÃ¡gico e inventado, un mundo PRECIOSO, planos abiertos y escenarios increÃ­bles, llenos de detalles y de belleza visual, donde tomaremos el control de una niÃ±a pequeÃ±a llamada Noah de su hermano mayor Renie y su fiel y adorable compaÃ±ero Spot.

Las mÃ©canicas son algo originales, en cada escenario tendremos ciertos objetos interactuables y no dispondremos de un inventario al uso, es decir todo lo que recojamos tiene un uso casi inmediato, a esto se le aÃ±aden ciertos puzzles que aunque no son dificiles, si obligan a jugar bien con las mecÃ¡nicas del juego, sobretodo a la hora de usar a nuestro compaÃ±ero Spot, el cual puede adoptar varias formas e interactuar de forma muy especial con ciertos objetos del escenario.

La historia es tan preciosa como desgarradora, y el juego estÃ¡ constantemente jugando con la mezcla entre la belleza visual y el peligro latente, dandote una de cal y una de arena durante todo el recorrido. Los personajes son maravillosos, caracteristicos, con motivaciones y un buen background detrÃ¡s, tanto la historia como ellos, como el mundo en general tiene un gran peso a la hora de llevarnos de la mano por ese mundo mÃ¡gico y peligroso que es Silence.

Una obra maestra de las aventuras grÃ¡ficas.

review:
Un jeu artistiquement magnifique. C'est beau dans tous les sens du terme, que ce soit dans les graphismes, la mise en scÃ¨ne, l'histoire.

Bien qu'il reste des Ã©nigmes, on reste tout de mÃªme loin d'un point'n click traditionnel comme l'Ã©tait "the Whispered World 1". Plus d'inventaire ou presque, les rares objets Ã  rÃ©cupÃ©rer seront utilisÃ©s tout de suite, et les Ã©nigmes sont globalement simples.

Mais on se laisse charmer par l'aventure et ses trois personnages principaux dont l'inoubliable et mignon Spotty.

Les deux fins sont par contre plutÃ´t dÃ©cevantes, car trÃ¨s vite expÃ©diÃ©es.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042831386', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 630, 'last_played': 1511547062}
review:
[h1]Short version: 82%[/h1]
Silence may have sacrificed the adventure game mechanics of its predecessor to create a character-oriented interactive film instead, but it built an especially strong and emotional story with a great and memorable cast on it.

[h1]Long version:[/h1]
Silence is the direct sequel of [url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/268540/]The Whispered World[/url], but it moved far from the original: 2D graphics turned into 3D, and most of the point â€™nâ€™ click gameplay gave way to something akin to an interactive animated film.

This genre switch means more than not having an inventory screen or the ability to save; it also means that we spend most of our time watching gorgeous pre-rendered cut-scenes, with some occasional puzzles to warrant at least a minimal level of player interaction. These cut-scenes are also a great tool to mask the paper-thin plot and the rather glaringly large rewrites by focusing exclusively on the deep, dialogue-based character drama, which acts as the core content of Silence.

Interestingly, the story uses a similar trick as the Whispered World: it introduces a cast of seemingly developed characters, who, as the game goes on, gradually show that their only role was to increase the symbolic strength of the real protagonistâ€™s journey, a journey about building our own fantasy world to escape the harshness of reality.
This is a double-edged sword, because the game eventually turns very emotional, maybe too much so. The final decision hits like a jackhammer and it will haunt the thoughts of many players almost as much as the tedious and horrible achievement system will fuel the nightmares of completionists.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047460864', 'num_games_owned': 3167, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1522362456}
review:
[b]Silence is the sequel of [url=store.steampowered.com/app/268540/The_Whispered_World_Special_Edition/]The Whispered World[/url], although it's not mandatory to play the first game because there is a summary at the beginning of Silence and the two games are quite different. However, I'd still recommend to start with the prequel for a better understanding of the characters, the universe and its implications among others.[/b]

As mentionned, do not expect Silence to be like The Whispered World : it's not a traditional Point & Click adventure with items to find and combine in order to solve puzzles and move forward. It feels more like a simplified version for a wider audience, a bit in the spirit of a Telltale adventure game, with real-time events, lots of cinematics, dialogues and actions with choices and consequences. There are still items to find and use, but one or two objects at the time at most. The puzzles are mostly easy and obvious, but gradually as you progress it can become more interesting and elaborated, since you have to control three characters and do specific actions with all of them in a certain order.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1338020255

That being said, I enjoyed Silence very much and think it's a great adventure game even so. It's so nice to go back to Silence, find old characters and meet new ones. The main and playable characters are Noah (Sadwick), his sister Renie, and of course the lovely and indispensable Spot ! The story and its progression are fantastic and will entertain you for around 6 hours. The gameplay, as told before, is not like in the prequel ; yet, it's easy to understand, diversified and enjoyable. The art is simply amazingly beautiful for the genre, I was surprised and convinced at each scene ; same with the great soundtrack : I found really nice that they used some musics from the first game as well. As for the voice acting, I remember Sadwick's voice in the Whispered World and how it annoyed a lot of players, and I think they did way better this time, at least for my part I find the voice acting flawless.

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1338017128

There are some negative aspects, for example the loading time is way too long for a singleplayer game and it uses checkpoints as saving system (I like to save and quit the game whenever I want). Also be warned achievement hunters : there are lots of achievements you can easily miss and you'll need to finish the game more than once to get them all.

The Whispered World was a wonderful and emotional experience and thankfully I can tell the same about Silence. The ending was particularly moving, although a bit abrupt and left many questions unanswered. I gladly recommend Silence and would definitely play The Whispered World 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198155945288', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1516571675}
review:
As usual, Daedalic did not disappoint with Silence. The whimsy and dark tones mix together to create a delightfully beatiful world with unexpected areas and aspects of evil. The story is not a simple one of "team of good guys perseveres against evil person." Instead, it shows the challenges people face in what is perceived to be a hopeless situation, when good people justify terrible deeds for the sake of a desirable end.

If you enjoy complex, emotional stories, whimsical and hilarious characters, and engaging puzzles in spades, check out this game. Come to think of it, check out any Daedalic game you can, including The Whispered World, which takes place in the same timeline, and before, Silence.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023140432', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1520953759}
review:
Ho comprato e giocato questo gioco dopo aver letto le recensioni di altri giocatori in cui qualcuno diceva che il gioco era visivamente apprezzabile, piacevole e godibile, ma non aveva sfruttato appieno il potenziale ed era un gioco troppo breve. In effetti neppure 7 ore per concludere il gioco una prima volta, considerando che comunque Ã¨ possibile rigiocarlo per fare qualche scelta differente non sono esattamente un record nella storia degli adventure games.
Il gioco perÃ² mi ha stupito in positivo se non altro per le idee e per la realizzazione. Devo dire che provenendo da giochi diversi la mancanza della scelta del tipo di interazione con il mondo e gli oggetti mi ha un po' spiazzato e ho trovato che alla lunga semplifichi troppo il gioco, senza peraltro intaccare troppo lo sviluppo della trama, ma chiuda chiaramente la porta a molte possibilitÃ . Dopo aver giocato The Whispered World che ho trovato molto carino per la realizzazione artistica, ma che comunque dava troppo l'impressione di una favola per bambini (e forse era ciÃ² che voleva essere?) sia proprio per l'impostazione artistica (disegni molto cartoon che comunque in genere non disdegno) sia per la trama e il suo sviluppo, oltre che la semplicitÃ  dell'interazione del giocatore.
Ed Ã¨ proprio qui che come dicevo mi ha stupito il secondo capitolo: Silence.
Mentre nel primo, Sadwick il clown che di triste aveva anche il colore della pelle e tutti gli altri personaggi, Spot a parte, per carini e simpatici che fossero non riuscivano a farsi apprezzare quanto avrebbero voluto e apparivano parzialmente anonimi e non riuscivano a coinvolgere il giocatore oltre un certo punto; in questo secondo, invece, mi hanno fatto letteralmente innamorare e mi hanno fatto innamorare del mondo di Silence. 
Sono piÃ¹ reali, meglio caratterizzati e di conseguenza credo anche piÃ¹ vivi e quindi anche il coinvolgimento del giocatore ne risente in positivo. 
Daedalic ha imboccato la strada giusta con questo secondo capitolo e anche una molto interessante secondo me.
Nonostante la brevitÃ  del titolo ha creato spunti e posto basi di trama molto interessanti e che se sviluppati come mi piace sperare, in un potenziale e prevedibile terzo capitolo, potrebbero dar vita finalmente a un bell'adventure game di tutt'altro peso e spessore (e si spera durata).
Alcuni punti di questa trama tuttavia ho trovato un po' confusionari e non del tutto chiari, forse troppo poco accennati e non abbastanza sviluppati e uno non indifferente riguarda proprio il collegamento tra Noah e Sadwick e forse anche la "falsa?" regina di Silence, ma non vorrei in una recensione mettere troppi spoiler per chi ancora non avesse giocato.
Posso solo dire che spero che nel prossimo capitolo tutti i nodi vengano al pettine, o almeno quasi tutti.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171569614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1520778477}
review:
I just can't recommend this game. I loved Whispered World, but Silence is just a really sad shadow of that game. The atmosphere, style, story, graphics... everything is super different from WW. I didn't like Noah right from the beginning, and Renie is about the most annoying little girl there is. In my opinion, playing as kids in games never works out.

The puzzles are dumb and most of them are just solved by trying things out, not really logically thinking things through. There are a lot of puzzles in the category of "click mouse button and hold" so that you can shake things or move things. And most puzzles involve Spot.

Also, the sexy and sassy Kyra character is such a clichÃ©. And what's with the giant eyes on the characters???

I'm sorry, but this game is just a huuuge disappointment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063010173', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1520768307}
review:
[h1]Wecke das Kind in Dir[/h1]

[b]Fazit: WunderschÃ¶n, einfach, linear[/b]

Ich habe damals den "ersten" Teil gespielt. Da das aber schon ziemlich lange zurÃ¼ck liegt hatte ich keinen direkten Vergleich (was wohl auch gut ist).

Ich habe dann die Silence-Demo gespielt und war sofort verliebt. Kaufte mir das Spiel spÃ¤ter und sparte es mir mÃ¶glichst lange auf', weil von dieser Art Perlen nicht mehr so viel existieren.

Silence ist ein wirklich wunderschÃ¶nes, kurzweiliges MÃ¤rchen. Sehr linear, sehr einfach und mutet daher eher wie ein interaktives MÃ¤rchenbuch an, als wie ein old school Point & Click Adventure. Die RÃ¤tsel sind nur selten wirklich fordernd - machen aber durchaus SpaÃŸ, vor allem wenn man (mit) Spot steuert. 

FÃ¼r mich hÃ¤tte es gerne lÃ¤nger gehen kÃ¶nnen. Die hier gezeigten 14.8h sind durch afk-Zeit verfÃ¤lscht. Mehr SchauplÃ¤tze, mehr RÃ¤tsel...mehr Spielzeit wÃ¤ren schÃ¶n gewesen. 

Allen in allem kann ich das Spiel Kleinen und GroÃŸen MÃ¤rchen-Fans empfehlen, die sich zwei Nachmittage lang leicht und schÃ¶n unterhalten wollen. 

Wer diese Art von auÃŸergewÃ¶hnlichem MÃ¤rchen mit Wendung mag, dem empfehle ich den britischen Fantasyfilm von 2005: "MirrorMask". Der Film ist aber etwas dÃ¼sterer und nix fÃ¼r ganz kleine Kinder meiner Meinung nach.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960278556', 'num_games_owned': 255, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1520726757}
review: Wieder ein Absolutes Meisterwerk was Daedalic hier abliefert. Die machen so Stimmungsvolle Games die von Gameplay und von der Story einfach der Hammer sind. Bitte macht weiter so gute Spiele. Ich liebe Sie.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022726378', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1520480259}
review: Ein sehr schÃ¶nes Adventur Spiel, aber fand den 1 Teil viel besser als den 2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011933591', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 1622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1654386394}
review:
"Silence: The Whispered World" ist das Sequel zu "The Whispered World". WÃ¤re gut gewesen, wenn das offensichtlicher gewesen wÃ¤re vor dem Kauf, da ich den VorgÃ¤nger nie gespielt habe. Im Nachhinein hat sich aber herausgestellt, dass die fehlende Vorkenntnisse einerseits durch gut eingebaute Dialoge ausreichend erklÃ¤rt werden, und andererseits dadurch sogar ein viel besseres Gesamtbild entsteht. [spoiler]Der Grund hierfÃ¼r ist, dass dieses "Silence" nicht von Noah, der schonmal in Silence war, sondern diesmal von Renie erschaffen wird. Diese kennt, genauso wie der Spieler, die Welt ja auch nur von ErzÃ¤hlungen. Das wirkt dann wiederum stimmig. [/spoiler]

Grafisch ist das Spiel unheimlich toll gemacht, und auch der Soundtrack ist gut. Die SpiellÃ¤nge finde ich ausreichend, auch wenn es nicht lange ist. Ich bin ohnehin kein Fan von Spielen die kÃ¼nstlich in die LÃ¤nge gezogen werden. Silence bietet meiner Meinung nach genau das richtige MaÃŸ und liefert eine tolle Geschichte mit nicht so schweren RÃ¤tseln. Das Beste Point'n Click Adventure der neueren Zeit. Verstehe gut, dass die Macher damit 2016 eingie Awards abgerÃ¤umt haben.

Ein must-have als Adventure-Fan, auch ohne den VorgÃ¤nger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023941198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1520168953}
review:
-Es un juego corto, bastante incompleto, aun si jugas su predecesor: "The Whispered World". Mas o menos duran lo mismo y terminan abruptamente, dejando dudas sin resolver. Esta entrega esta muy elaborada visualmente, con un bello OST, buenos actores de voz.  
-[***spoilers***] Todo el juego es una alegorÃ­a de lo que pasa en realidad con los dos hermanos, estÃ¡n inconscientes, luego de que su refugio fuera destruido por una bomba, y la trama de esta entrega, nos lleva dentro del sueÃ±o de la pequeÃ±a hermana, Renie. Nada de lo que pasa en toda la historia del Silencio, es real, es un sueÃ±o de la pequeÃ±a, inspirado por las historias que su hermano mayor Noah, le contaba sobre Ã©se lugar fantÃ¡stico llamado "Silencio". En el desarrollo del juego tenemos personajes sin profundizar, simplemente aparecieron allÃ­, no sabemos sus historias ni nada, solo seguimos un objetivo, que es llegar al Trono de la Reina Falsa y romper el espejo. Tiene algunos puzzles, nada complejos de resolver, tiene decisiones, que, salvo la ultima (la del espejo) no tienen casi peso alguno. Metieron estas cosas, como para rellenar el juego y darle un poco de protagonismo al jugador, para entretener un rato, pero la verdad es muy poco y muy pobre. El final, romper o no el espejo, es en realidad: seguir en el sueÃ±o/fantasÃ­a de Renie, donde se vuelve la Reina y todo en el Silencio vuelve a la normalidad, todos son felices. O, despertar a la realidad, la cruda y difÃ­cil realidad. y dejar el lugar fantÃ¡stico atrÃ¡s.A mi me parece una tonterÃ­a, escapar de los problemas, quedando en un estado de coma, viviendo en un sueÃ±o, por Ã©so tomÃ© la decisiÃ³n de despertar. [Fin de los ***spoilers***] 
-Este juego, merecÃ­a mucho mas, hubiera sido espectacular si lo hubieran hecho mas largo, mas completo, se quedaron en la parte visual y sonora del juego, pero Ã©ste en realidad es hueco, la historia daba para mucho mas, mas por descubrir, mas y mejores decisiones que realmente importen, pero quedÃ³ ahÃ­. Algo bello por fuera pero casi vaciÃ³ por dentro.. una verdadera lastima. Aun asÃ­ lo recomiendo para los interesados en aventuras grÃ¡ficas, pero solo cuando Ã©ste en rebaja. Le doy un 6/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970497519', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1520108777}
review:
A hybrid between a point n' click and a Telltale style movie game. It was different, at least, but I prefer the hard type of one or the other.

The game is beautiful but has a melancholic vibe going on and overall just left me feeling sad and empty. If that was the intention - good work. Not sure if it was though. I felt the writers were trying to convey a point but never quite manage to get it across and left me feeling a little confused.

The art and scene design in this game is absolutely stunning. Well done on that!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994500066', 'num_games_owned': 1041, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 870, 'last_played': 1520713845}
review:
Silence is a world that revolves around teetering between life and death and explores the will to live. 

The main story was captivating with the updated graphics and the (limited) lip syncing.
Unfortunately, the adventure left a large number of questions unanswered and unceremoniously dropped side characters.
The ending was quite a sad heart tug but luckily it's set up in a way for a 3rd installment.

Puzzles were decently planned out -- although a bit obvious and simple. In many cases, I felt that I was blocked from immediately attempting to solve the obvious puzzle -- instead I would need to progress the character to the point where they had to realize there were was even a puzzle!

A quick technical irritant - If puzzles span across multiple scenes... 
Loading Screens can't take 30 seconds each.

I did really enjoy the game however and would definitely recommend it to others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046986633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1518420179}
review:
This game is a sequel to "The Whispered World", a game I enjoyed. Unfortunately, this game contains massive spoilers for "The Whispered World", so if you are interested in playing this game, play "The Whispered World" first. And my recommendation is to stop there.

"Silence" is a very different type of game than "The Whispered World", or most Point & Click games for that matter. For example, in a typical Point & Click game you have an inventory for the character you are controlling and gameplay is based on discovering, collecting and combining the items you come across with each other, the environment or NPCs. In this game, when you pick something up the item goes into your hand and you combine it immediately with something on the screen, or maybe a screen away. I think there was a point where a character had 2 things on them, but this did not add much complexity. There is a heavier emphasis on moving your mouse in a particular direction - which the game tells you - which doesn't really amount to much in practice. There is one recurring character that can occasionally be used to do a few different things, which was nice in "The Whispered World" but since the remaining gameplay is subar, this didn't do much to enhance the overall experience.

The overall experience is closer to an interactive movie than a typical Point & Click game. Puzzles are highly linear. There are a few instances where you have a choice. I did multiple playthroughs to see all the consequences and was very much disappointed by how little it mattered. 

There simply isn't much of a game here and what little there is is far too easy. There is a point where you just undo what you just did with a different character and I thought it was a massive waste of time.

The 3D graphics actually look quite nice, but they do very little besides enhancing the cutscenes because, as is typical for Point & Click games, you can't actually move the camera.

The voice acting is alright, but the characters aren't very good. I get that some people didn't like Sadwick, the main character of "The Whispered World", but I found him far more enjoyable to follow than the main characters in "Silence".

The new supporting characters are especially bad. There are only 3 of them and each is only relevant in the scene you meet them and even then they don't actually do very much. The first and most prominent you are introduced to is the girl you see in the previews. She is implied to have a sad backstory but this never becomes relevant. The second new supporting character is involved in a puzzle and then fades into the background. The third and last one is there to be found and then literally never does anything. There is a bit of a payoff for having them there but it's so little that I am convinced that they could ALL be written out of the story.

I wouldn't be surprised if a lot more was planned for this game but then things had to be rushed to make a deadline. The end result is very disappointing to me. I have played other Point & Click games developed by Daedalic Entertainment and enjoyed them, so I hope that this is only an outlier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032837208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 219, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 219, 'last_played': 1519116567}
review:
einfach nur wow!
Absolut magisch in jeder Sekunde!

Ich empfinde die RÃ¤tsel hier als genau richtig. NatÃ¼rlich - KopfnÃ¼sse wie in The Whispered World oder Deponia findet man hier schon wegen des nicht vorhandenen Inventars nicht, aber die RÃ¤tsel beschÃ¤ftigen exakt so lange, dass es nicht den SpielfluÃŸ stÃ¶rt. Jeder Bildschirm lÃ¤dt zum Experimentieren ein und nicht selten kann man viele optionale Dinge tun und entdecken!

Die Dialoge und Charaktere sind zum verlieben! Zu keiner Zeit unglaubwÃ¼rdig und einfach nur unglaublich charmant!
Die deutsche Vertonung ist toll gelungen und steht der Englischen eigentlich in Nichts nach.

Der Punkt, der am meisten ins Auge sticht ist natÃ¼rlich die Grafik - hier wurde mal eben das hÃ¼bscheste Point & Click Adventure aller Zeiten kreiert. Die Animationen sind butterweich, wirken nie hÃ¶lzern und alles wirkt wie ein GemÃ¤lde - ist aber plastisch wie eine 3D-Welt. Ich freue mich jetzt schon auf mehr Adventures in dieser Engine!


Die Geschichte ist wundervoll erzÃ¤hlt, jedoch will ich aus SpoilergrÃ¼nden hier lediglich erwÃ¤hnen, dass eine tolle BrÃ¼cke von Teil 1 zu Teil 2 geschlagen wurde - inklusive einer schÃ¶n inszenierten RÃ¼ckblende, fÃ¼r alle, die mit Silence erst in dieses Universum einsteigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198340175646', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 199, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1527430171}
review: Such a beautiful game <3 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198136214992', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 193, 'playtime_forever': 896, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 896, 'last_played': 1518773289}
review:
Around 8/10 recommended. This game is really beautiful. The musics are very good, the scenes are marvelous, and the atmosphere is immersive. All those things are of exceptionally high quality. Just this beautiful world alone is enough for the game to worth the full price.

Oh and Renie is so cute <3

The gameplay mechanics are okay for me: not too hard and not too easy. The story is short, but nice and warm, and I do think it is a pretty good depiction of the world between life and death. The characters are okay; Although some plot changes are a little bit sudden, they did successfully make the story move smoothly. The voice acting is also good, though I personally dislike Renie's voice acting... felt a little bit too flat for me.

The achievements are a little bit tedious and it is not easy to get full achievements without some guides...

(And yep, it's about the acceptance of death. [spoiler]Being able to choose death and avoid the cruel reality is pretty nice...[/spoiler])

author: {'steamid': '76561198204756500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1115, 'last_played': 1518017169}
review:
Ich habe das Spiel mehrfach durch gespielt um mÃ¶glichst alle Erfolge zu bekommen.
Dennoch fÃ¤llt meine gesamt Wertung nicht sehr positiv aus.

Ich habe mich auf eine MÃ¤rchenhafte Geschichte gefreut, denn gleich zu Beginn wird man ja mit der Nase darauf gestoÃŸen, um was es geht. 

Der wie ich finde einzige Charaktere den ich richtig gut gemacht finde ist Renie. Sie ist niedlich und frech auf ihre Weise und sie ist echt zum liebgewinnen.

Was mir allerdings fehlt und deshalb schneidet das Spiel relativ schlecht bei mir ab, sind die Auswirkungen meiner Entscheidungen.
Man kann und muss sehr oft Entscheidungen treffen, aber keine wirkt sich wirklich aus. Nicht einmal im Hinblick auf das Ende und das finde ich sehr schade. Denn gerade die Funktion mit den vielen EntscheidungsmÃ¶glichkeiten hat Potential und man hÃ¤tte meiner Meinung nach sehr viel mehr daraus machen kÃ¶nnen.

Selbst Ã¤ltere Spiele wie zum Beispiel Memento Mori hatten schon implementiert, das Entscheidungen im Spiel auch das Ende grundlegend beeinflussen.

Wie schon in einer anderen Review erwÃ¤hnt sind die RÃ¤tsel nicht besonders Anspruchsvoll, dafÃ¼r kann man einen haufen Nutzloser und blÃ¶dsinniger Sachen machen um alle Erfolge zu bekommen.
Hier hÃ¤tte man vielleicht doch wieder mehr wie im ersten Teil auf BlÃ¶dsinnige witzige RÃ¤tsel setzen sollen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983740996', 'num_games_owned': 746, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 483, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 483, 'last_played': 1517733796}
review:
As the explosions came closer Noah grabbed Renie and ran towards the bunker. The bombs from the air raid were closing in when he finally reached the shelter and closed the heavy door from inside. But when a direct hit shattered their hideout the world fell into silence.

Silence is a wonderful adventure game, full of lovely characters that tells a heart-warming, clever story. As a player, you have to control different characters to find your way through the world of silence. And while it seems that this game is for children the overall story is very mature.

Pros
- brilliant story
- very beautiful graphics
- cutest little girl hero in any video game ever
- great voice acting
- good puzzles
- perfect animations
- good music
- very good controller support (when working)

Cons
- controller support only works in big picture mode (very weird)
- most achievements can be missed
- some stupid achievements that can only be gained by repeating the same action over and over again or letting characters deliberately die

author: {'steamid': '76561198080549107', 'num_games_owned': 980, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1517619085}
review:
Silence is a very beautiful point & click game, perfect for when you just wanna relax and play a nice story game.
Most of the characters are just so adorable... Spotty, Renie, Stones, even the potato looking ones. 

The story is really good (low key made me cry) 10/10
And the gameplay was pleasent enough.

review: Absolutely beautiful game with simple puzzles and a lovely story... a lot to pick up about what's going on, on the way if you pay attention to what's going on. Highly recommend. Good luck making the choices you think are best ;-; I chose wrong and I'm heartbroken...

author: {'steamid': '76561198079990100', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1517255196}
review:
I feel like this is one of those games that's going to stick with me for a long time. It's incredibly imaginative and filled with a child-like sense of wonder, yet it also has some seriously dark undertones that kind of creep up on you and hit you right in the feels HQ when you're least expecting it. I love the characters, even if I felt like some of them could have been fleshed out a lot more. Everything with Spot gave me a big smile. 

The puzzles were challenging but fair. I didn't have to consult my walkthrough as much as I usually do in point and click games. It was also a bit unique, in that it gave you a choice for how to handle a couple scenarios. 

My only real problem with it is I didn't realize that it's a sequel to The Whispered World, and I think I was pretty confused at times because I didn't understand some of the references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080580669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1517268531}
review:
A short and cute game!

Pros: The once again beautiful artwork and visuals keeping the trend from the previos game: The Whispered World! Great story overall with some beautiful moments and great acting.

Cons: For the price of 20ish euros it is a bit too much for this overall short game. It feels like the creators just turned the gameplay completely around from TWW and just made the puzzles almost non-existent, which is sadly becoming a trend for most develepors nowadays as they seem to be afraid of making games too hard. The story also felt a bit rushed in the end from the rather good build up at the beginning, which the character development and the overall ending suffered from.

Overall I think the game is worth buying for the right price, meaning a sale of at least 50 %!

author: {'steamid': '76561198269350005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 313, 'last_played': 1517088106}
review:
So I have just finished this game â€¦ and I do feel kind of conflicted.
As I really do want to recommend it but at the same time I am a bit reluctant â€¦
For me this game was an emotional roller-coaster.  You know that kind of book/game/film where sometimes you need hit â€˜pauseâ€™ and just ask yourself â€˜what the heck is going on?â€™ or â€˜did she just do THAT?â€™â€¦.
So yeah, it was a bit hard on my nerves. Nevertheless, I likes the graphic style of the game, I really loooved the music and As for the characters -the caterpillar was adorable, the boy was adorkable - the way he cared for his little sister even in the end, the 3 other ones were a bit meh and not quite developed... I did kinda liked the little girl, who sometimes was just making me want to tear my hair out or shout to the screen â€œwhat are you doing?â€ Like half of the game problems were clearly her fault. And serioulsy... Who licks the mushrooms in the strange magical world you have never been to before?...Or her mood swing - i get that she is a child, but still ...  But no spoilers :) 
I haven't yet played the first game (as apparently this one is a sequel), so I cant really say anything about the story line-continuity or that stuff. The quests were ok, maybe a bit easy, but still funny to do. You didn't feel annoyed by them or their quantity.
I think that this game can â€˜stand by itselfâ€™ and be played without knowing about the first one. 

So in the end, I liked the story, even if both ending did make me a bit teary-eyed (and well, it doesn't happen that often â€“ â€˜Brothers â€“ a tale of two sonsâ€™ is an exception)â€¦  And well, I did hope for a more happy ending, even if from the beginning it was obvious that it won't be all fluff and unicorns >_<

So, yeah, if you are ready to embark on this journey of emotional roller-coaster with not so difficult puzzles and not so clever little girl, but adorable magical caterpillar, than this game is for you, if not â€“ save your time and money and go find something more for your taste.

P.S: I wish they had a 'maybe' recommend button ...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011087058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1516482734}
review:
As a huge fan of "The Whispered World" I was very happy when I got the chance to receive this game. Unfortunately I ended up disappointed. 

The graphics are beautiful and the sound is amazing. But both are just parts of a Point & Click adventure. The heart and soul are the characters and the riddles ... and there the game lost me. The story is predictible very early on, the two main characters are shallow in their development and personally I don't like the voice actors. Sadwick was so lost in the first game, having the whole destiny of the world on his sholders, the other characters around him were different and special. Now - now all you have left are the two funny characters you met only for a short time (I don't want to name them to avoid spoilers) and Spot (because he's so adorable). The game seems so rushed here, because there aren't many characters in the game at all to interact with. And I never once cared much about them anyway.   

The riddles are super easy to solve and often require the same pattern: You find a problem on screen A, move to B, loading screen, pick something up, move back to A, loading screen. Forgot something, go back to B, loading screen. I think you get the issue here. There is no challenge to be found at all and if I have to look at loading screens this often, please make them at least interesting. 

As much as I would like this game, for me it's a 5/10, simply mediocre. It has good moments, it has very weak ones. 
BUT: If you have kids and you want a game to introduce them to the genre, you can think about buying it, they seem to be the target group here, especially with two kids as protagonists, though the story can be a bit dark sometimes. 

I on the other hand would be fine with the next game (if there is one) following Spot on an adventure on his own. He's my favourite ... and that's all I take from this relatively short game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004199954', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 360, 'last_played': 1516786206}
review:
Silence is a point & click game that I can only describe as being "Telltale-ifed". Thankfully, it does not choose to copy the entirety of the Telltale formula but it's obvious from the start that the heavy use of cutscenes and simplified dialogue selection, this game was no doubt influenced by Telltale. It is unfortunate that they decided to go with 3D environment (mixed with drawn backgrounds) and character models this time around but that's just me since I have a thing for traditional 2D. In addition to the visual changes from The Whispered World, Silence features a much smaller cast of characters and environments to explore. The characters of Kyra, Samuel, and Janus are undeveloped and don't share any interesting interactions with Renie or Noah. There's one scene in the game where the characters are sitting around in a campfire, a perfect time for some casual conversation but this is brushed aside for moving the plot along. It doesn't help too that the game reinforces that the land of Silence is all in the mind and it must be destroyed in order to return to the real world. The only people you'll probably end up caring for are Renie, Noah, and Spot. Regarding the game's puzzles, they're fairly "casual" and lack the numbers and challenges of the previous game (though having a "challenge" in a point & click game can be a double-edged sword since more often than not, puzzles could lean into the bizarre when developed with "challenge" in mind).

While all this sounds negative, this is by no means a "bad game". It's well made and they're able to sell a "Telltales-like" experience without having to go full Walking Dead, meaning interactive movie. There is a sense of urgency unlike The Whispered World which was slow to start. With the easy difficulty of the puzzles, newcomers to the genre will not find themselves ripping the hairs out of their heads. Visually the game is superb and the sound design is great as always. It made for a nice evening experience at around 6 hours and I don't regret getting it. However, I do recommend buying the game at a discount.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004798252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 392, 'last_played': 1516774175}
review:
A short, sweet, and beautiful surprise. 

I went into Silence without knowing that this was, indirectly but certainly, a sequel to the very good The Whispered World.
Within the first few minutes of gameplay it is immediately noticeable that the visual style has been changed and the gameplay itself has been revised, inarguably simplified, with no inventory, dialogue exchanges/trees, and very few taxing puzzles. This at face value would seem to lend itself to a diminutive, malformed Whispered World; a mere shadow of former excellence--but that would be severely and unforgivably misjudging the worth of this game.

In lieu of the standard adventure game trappings and a lengthy playtime, Silence provides a moving and incredibly beautiful game: the animation, illustration, the writing, and hell, even the voice acting is above par for adventure game fare. To exemplify this point, I would argue that Silence has probably the best voice-acted child character that I can recall: charmingly innocent and playful, but not noticeably voiced by a young woman imitating. And the lack of adventure game pabulum directs your focus on the game's strengths: characters, art, and narrative. One need just accept that this game is not Whispered World, and it is not trying to be.

The only fault I could readily find, and I didn't want to look too hard because I like this damn game, is the structure and story. Structurally, the game is missing a chapter, or the chapters there should have been longer, and quite often you will be wondering how we progressed so far so quickly, or why an action in a cutscene isn't playable action instead. I don't mind the 5-6 hour playtime, but it is exasperatingly obvious that the game needed a little more fleshing out. Relatedly, there are a  few characters that simply do not receive the appropriate conclusion--or just about any form of conclusion.

Silence is a game that has very few faults, has a great many successes, and charms from beginning to all-too-abrupt ending. Enjoy the time you have with Silence, rather than exasperating at the what-could-have-been.

review: I played this game over two days. It's visually appealing, with little thought required to follow through the story and figure out the simple puzzles. author: {'steamid': '76561198029134415', 'num_games_owned': 1784, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1526579701}
review: This game was on my wish list for a while, and I must admit, that i am very disappointed. it's not a bad game. It is the sequel of "The Whispering World", have very nice graphics and  good story. the problem in that it's not a classic Point & Click adventure game. There are no inventory, no puzzles. Just pick an item, click on a place and the game show you where to use it, also the mini games can be very frustrating.
