author: {'steamid': '76561198008305545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1516162934}
review:
Silence fait partie de ces jeux qui Ã©blouissent sur le plan visuel. Le jeu est magnifique, mÃªme s'il n'est pas un foudre de guerre sur le plan technique.
Paradoxalement sa beautÃ© graphique est certainement la raison de la pauvretÃ© de son gameplay et de sa faible durÃ©e de vie (5H sans forcer). Sans Ãªtre aussi dÃ©pourvu de gameplay que les jeux Telltale actuels, il s'en rapproche beaucoup plus que les productions habituelles de Daedalic. Les Ã©ngimes sont trÃ¨s simples et ne poseront pas vraiment de difficultÃ©s. Pire, elles risquent de decevoir les amateurs de point and click.
Le fait d'alterner entre trois personnages n'apportent pas grand chose, mÃªme si Spot a des transformations pour rÃ©soudre les Ã©ngimes.

Niveau scÃ©nario, Silence est la suite directe des Chroniques de Sadwick. Est ce que cela pose problÃ¨me si l'on n'a pas jouÃ© au premier avant ? 
Personnellement, je n'ai pas, ni jouÃ© Ã  Sadwick et pourtant, je n'ai pas eu l'impression d'Ãªtre vraiment larguÃ©. Par contre, je pense que le faire est un gros plus pour apprÃ©cier pleinement le jeu. 
Ce qui peut Ãªtre un dÃ©faut ou non suivant les joueurs, le scÃ©nario n'est pas Ã  la hauteur et les personnages secondaires sont trop en retrait par rapport aux deux personnages principaux que sont Noah/Sadwick et Renie. Cette derniÃ¨re Ã©tant particuliÃ¨rement rÃ©ussie et trÃ¨s attachante. 

En rÃ©sumÃ©, je recommande pour ceux qui aiment les belles plastiques, peuvent faire fi d'un gameplay et d'un challenge au ras des pÃ¢querettes. Je ne recommande pas pour ceux qui aiment les point and click plus classiques. L'ennui risque de poindre rapidement.
Pour ma part, je mettrais Silence dans la catÃ©gorie de jeux moyens.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999938574', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 590, 'playtime_forever': 318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1515952084}
review:
A beautiful emotional story with great visuals and good voice acting (at least in English). This is a sequel to The Whispered World â€“ one of the first games from Daedalic Entertainment. But you don't really need to play that game: Silence is completely fine on its own.

Frankly, Silence is very different from The Whispered World. While the latter is a classic 2D point-and-click adventure, Silence has more similarities with Life is Strange or the games from Telltale: it has simple puzzles, a lot of movie-like scenes and even some non-linearity.

Perhaps the only downside about the game is its length: Silence can be completed in around 5 hours even on the first run. But I am sure that sooner or later you'd want to return to this beautiful world again!

review: Avventura non lunghissima, anzi corta, con enigmi abbordabili ma mai scontati. La grafica Ã¨ pregevole mischiando modelli 3D con sfondi bidimensionali in un mix di grande effetto. Il gioco poi Ã¨ sottotitolato in italiano mentre l'audio in inglese Ã¨ ben fatto e comprensibile anche per i profani dell'inglese. Gioco consigliato se acquistato con uno sconto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065670893', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1515276792}
review:
Vale bastante la pena si es que aguantas jugar the whispered world ya que silence es la segunda parte de este.

Tiene una historia super bonita que dejo a mi corazonsito llorando, los personajes son super graciosos y hacen que los quieras desde el comienzo.

Como puntos malos: no tiene muchos acertijos dificiles ya que practicamente se resuelven solos, no hay inventario y todo se hace automaticamente dando click en los puntos que te permite el mapa, ademas de eso no puedes saltar las animaciones y a veces los textos son demasiado lentos, el guardado de partida es automatico y cuando quieres seguirla tienes que tragarte de nuevo toda la animacion y por ultimo el mouse esta super mal coordinado con el juego.

A pesar de la jugabilidad que tiene vale la pena, los personajes te atrapan demasiado y los finales que tiene son super emotivos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970711212', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 810, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1515616308}
review:
A fantastic little gem!

At Â£24, this is probably pretty steep, but if you are a big fan of games involving an engaging emotional storyline, and enjoy the feeling of story elements coming together at the end, or you are one of those people who enjoy second playthroughs to spot hidden clues to the ending, or more fleshed out understandings upon the second playthrough, then this is the game for you.

Run time is pretty short, and will likely run between 3-6 hours (dependant upon how many achievements you want to pick up along the way on the first playthrough, or like me, someone who just loves to click on everything!) but can be run through in under 3 hours is you really wanted.

Special mention also needs to go to the audio of this game. It helps to really set the tone and scene of all the scenes throughout the game, and without being intrusive, certainly makes up an integral aspect of the game.

If you see this game on sale for anything less than Â£10, you cannot go far wrong with adding it to your library!

author: {'steamid': '76561198117054702', 'num_games_owned': 680, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1514651131}
review:
AprÃ¨s 6h de jeu, mon avis sur Silence est assez mitigÃ©...

Je le recommande parce qu'il s'agit d'une belle histoire, plaisante bien que triste. Pour Ã§a, Ã§a reste dans la lignÃ©e de The Whispered World. Les graphismes sont soignÃ©s, on redÃ©couvre le monde de Silence.

Par contre, il n'est pas exempt de dÃ©fauts et de dÃ©ceptions :
[list]
[*]Le jeu est court, trÃ¨s court mÃªme... 6h de jeu alors que son prÃ©dÃ©cesseur m'a demandÃ© 11h pour le finir.
[*]Le chapitre 4 est quasi-inexistant (en durÃ©e, si on compare aux 3 autres chapitres).
[*]On perd les mÃ©canismes d'un point & click pour se retrouver confrontÃ© Ã  une sorte d'histoire interactive (plus d'inventaire, pas de choix dans les "dialogues", des rÃ©pliques limitÃ©es).
[*]On ne peut pas sauvegarder oÃ¹ on le souhaite, ce qui nous oblige Ã  revivre certains passages si on a quittÃ© le jeu entre 2 points de contrÃ´le...
[*]Quelques bugs qui peuvent Ãªtre handicapants (mais trÃ¨s rares, heureusement). L'affichage Ã©tait parfait avant de quitter le jeu. J'arrÃªte le jeu, je reprend plus tard... et lÃ  j'ai eu le droit Ã  des scÃ¨nes buggÃ©es (tronquÃ©es, ou avec un gros rectangle de texture en plein milieu ce qui empÃªche de voir les Ã©lÃ©ments avec lesquels on interagit)
[*]On Ã©change l'aspect cartoon de The Whispered World pour un aspect plus rÃ©aliste. Ca m'a un peu dÃ©Ã§u, mÃªme si les graphismes sont soignÃ©s. (pour ce point, Ã§a se voyait sur les captures d'Ã©cran, mais Ã§a reste bizarre pour une "suite" Ã  mon goÃ»t)
[/list]

Au final, je ne regrette pas mon achat, ce fut une aventure plaisante mais je m'attendais Ã  quelque chose de diffÃ©rent... et plus long.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979594197', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 215, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 463, 'last_played': 1603296652}
review:
[h1][b]Bueno[/b][/h1]
[b]Arte.[/b] No tengo palabras para definir el nivel artÃ­stico que tienen los escenarios. Es como si un cuadro cobrase vida y pudiÃ©ramos interactuar con el. En este caso tendremos diferentes zonas con un colorido mÃ¡s variado que su antecesor, asÃ­ como unos efectos de iluminaciÃ³n y reflejos de agua excelentes.

[b]Personajes.[/b] Noah y Renie son fantÃ¡sticos, y el juego se enfoca mucho en su relaciÃ³n y como el mundo de Silence les va cambiando. Spott y los Stone Brothers siguen igual de fantÃ¡sticos, Shana aparece mÃ¡s mÃ­stica que nunca, Sam, Kayra y Janus parece que van a tener una gran importancia... y cuando esperamos algÃºn tipo de desarrollo mÃ¡s profundo no ocurre.

[h1][b]Malo[/b][/h1]
[b]Tiempo.[/b] El juego es exageradamente corto para lo que puede ofrecer. Esto hace que tanto el desarrollo final de la historia, como la evoluciÃ³n de la misma se vea mermada.

[b]Redundante.[/b] No podemos negar que el arco narrativo y argumental estÃ¡ mejor desarrollado que su antecesor, el problema es que no explica nada nuevo. No aporta nada a este universo, y muchos de los giros se ven diluidos porque te los esperas.

[h1][b]Nota: S[/b][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198119533006', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1514334226}
review:
Don't get me wrong, SIlence is not a bad game, but it is not a worthy sequel to The Whispered World. It has a charming story (which fits surprisely well with the ending of the first game), good music, beautiful graphics... but a terribe game interface. There is no dialoge with other characters (you can click on them up to four o five times to hear what they have to say, but after that they will repeat the same thing over and over again), no inventory and almost no puzzles or interaction with the environment since the game is always gonna tell you what to do.

Long story short: As a narrative experience, is totally worth a try, but if you're looking for a classic point-&-click adventure (like The Whispered World) then this is simply not your game

author: {'steamid': '76561198252236966', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1514065552}
review:
[h1]Silence - Traumwelt = Traumspiel[/h1]

Da hat Daedalic Entertainment mal wieder ein sehr schÃ¶nes Spiel auf den Markt gebracht.
AnknÃ¼pfend an das Spiel "The Whispered World" spielt man nun eine weitere spannende Story in Silence.
Im Gegensatz zu dem VorgÃ¤nger sind die RÃ¤tsel weniger kniffelig (fÃ¼r mich positiv), dafÃ¼r steckt deutlich mehr Story in dem Spiel. Die einzelnen Spielszenarien sind sehr schÃ¶n gestaltet, sodass man wirklich den Eindruck bekommt, in einer Traumwelt zu spielen. Die Charakter sind neu gestaltet, besonders hat mir Spot gefallen, weil der einfach nur niedlich ist.

RÃ¤tsel: 8/10
Story:  10/10
Grafik: 10/10

Gesamt: 10/10

Ich kann das Spiel jeden empfehlen, besonders an die, die schon "The Whispered World" gespielt haben.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074880281', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 375, 'last_played': 1512886882}
review: Ein graphisch wundervolles Spiel. Sehr bunt. Wir begleiten zwei Protagonisten in wechselnden Ansichten durch die Welt Silence. Dabei gilt es GesprÃ¤che zu fÃ¼hren, RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen und Ã¼beralle dran zu schlecken. Die RÃ¤tsel sind meist eher einfachrer Natur und unterstÃ¼tzen das Spielgeschehen. Die Geschichte und Storyline ist recht kurz und mir ist es schleierhaft wie ich so viele Steam-Archievments verpassen konnte. Durch die Gradlinigkeit des Spieles, ist in mir nicht unbedingt der Wunsch geweckt etwas zu wiederhohlen. Entscheidungen bedeuten meist nur die eine oder andere Perspektive aufzuschieben, spielen muss man sie sowieso. GrundsÃ¤tzlich hatte ich SpaÃŸ am Spiel und der Welt Silence, ich wÃ¼nschte man kÃ¶nnte sie lÃ¤nger erkunden. Mehr Abzweige gehen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971537739', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1513481229}
review:
First and foremost, for the Not Recommended vote... This game is a sequel of a previous game.  This is fact that is not mentioned anywhere in the product description, and I had to find out the hard way when I started playing, and couldn't understand the world settings which the game assumes the player is familiar with.

With that out of the way, letâ€™s talk about the gameâ€™s presentation.  The gameâ€™s world is beautiful; there is no doubt.  However, the puzzles and dialogues donâ€™t really make sense, for the lack of a better word: the characters would say something doesnâ€™t make sense to each other, and I had to interact with environment with not much sense, and actual puzzles are basically solved by interact with everything on the screen.

Iâ€™ve seen better walking simulators.  Seriously I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998793855', 'num_games_owned': 1210, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1513372553}
review:
[h1][b]Genre: Point and Click/Adventure
Time: ~6 hours[/b][/h1]

Long time since I played something close to a proper point and click game, but here we are. Finished [i]Silence[/i] a moment ago and I gotta say, it was a quite pleasant ride through the kingdom of Silence. The graphical style was adorable, with awesomely made backgrounds (believe they were handdrawn as well), with characters who all looked as great and with music to accompany the journey, which never got stale. The only complaint would probably be the ending, as it comes and goes as if the developers felt the pressure of completing the game post-haste. But I have to say, the puzzles were fair and the inclusion of the "hint button" (holding down the mouse wheel), which then shows you a subtle hint but also all the things you can interact with... love it!

Overall, a short and sweet experience which won't leave you with losing sleep in any way, not due to story, not due to puzzles. And there's some replayability, at least if you want to hunt for achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978131107', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 96, 'last_played': 1513150167}
review:
Puzzle quality: Telltale 1.0 circa walking dead

Facial animations: Telltale 2.0

Artwork: Not quite Witcher 3 but pretty damn impressive. Best part of the game. They really put a lot of love into the animations and art.

Fun: Adventure games walk a very fine line with me. They border between hidden object games and narrative thrillers. Maybe they have comedy or great voice acting. By the beginning of chapter #3 this one hadn't roped me in with either an engaging story or particularly interesting writing or puzzles. The romance options might carry a younger audience but as a grown man who has had sex and seen this romantic trope before, it felt forced.

Music: There is music.

When you are playing a game and you find yourself wondering "Could I just watch a Let's Play", then you already know the answer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046097024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 307, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 307, 'last_played': 1513078050}
review:
At a $30 price tag I cant recommend this game. 

TLDR: The game is short (5 hours for me) , the puzzles are very boring (Most can be solved by simple first order thinking, and there are no failure states if you get a puzzle wrong), and only real saving grace is that it looks and sounds nice, 

Ill start with the good things that i did like,

Firstly, the game is very very pretty, the colour palate is varied and vibrant, the characters are 3d moddeled and look well designed onto what seem to be a mix of 2D and 3D enviroments, the music fits and sounds amazing, even if some of the tracks are just the theme from the Whispered World, and the voice actors performances were good, although get somewhat grating after a while as they dont like shifting off of one or two emotions through the whole game, especially with Renie and Noah, who have the most lines in the game. 

And for the things I didnt like.

Without looking up a guide, I beat the game in 5 hours. Most of that time was spent waiting for animations to play out instead of thinking about the game. Most puzzles will require you to use Item A, on item A. There is no inventory system and items will be used regardless of whether or not you know you should use them there. Occasionally there will be a slightly harder puzzle such as listening to a short riddle, and turning symbols to match the riddle, or tuning instuments, but those are still brutally simple. Comparitivly, in the whispered world, which ill admit i havent completed there are a few great puzzles, such as "To get item required, close the door after walking in to reveal it" or "Change the time on the clock to match a thing you had on a list since the beginning of the game, after realising that the riddle meant a certain item on that list". There are 2 bad puzzles in PnC games which are A. Diversions that dont require much on the player or B. Guide dangit puzzles which are ones that are rooted in moon logic and cant really figure out. This game has plenty of A. 

Secondly, the story and writing seem to fall flat. The best example of this is the ending. Otherwise this seems to be filled with some lines that feel just, off for some of the characters to do. There is swearing from some of these people, which have been living in a magical fairy land all their lives.

MAJOR SPOILER, if it wasnt obvious.

The ending of the game, is that it was all a dream.
Thats right. 
You are given the choice to continue the dream, or to wake up. 
This cliche is by far one of the worst ways to end a story. And it is somewhat justified in the story but its still, as a friend of mine said after I told him this "A giant middle finger to you for playing the game" because, everything that you have done to that point was ultimatly POINTLESS. Only one character really grows over time, being Noah, who changes from someone who wants to be a hero, to an absolutely selfish jackass because he's a sad clown now, and you are going to like it, and finally a somewhat redeemable jackass. 

I could handwave all of this as a "Its meant for kids" and it would be a great game for kids, but the writing tells me its not necessarilly for them, as the forementioned swearing and the game features strong themes such as rebellion, war, death, loss, not necessarilly meant for them. I very much doubt a child young enough to have the puzzles as easy as they were, would understand and grasp the concept of air raids. 

Again, at its price point, for a 5 hour adventure I cant really recommend it.
I would say your money is better spent picking up its prequel, the Whispered World, which it itself has some probelms, but it is a much much better adventure game than this, and fills the craving for a fantasy adventure game very well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009311541', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1512943398}
review:
Amazingly well done game, following it's predecessor in art, music, story, and still some of the most heartfelt feel rides I've had. The endings are just as impactful as the first game (The Whispered Worlds).

I just didn't want the feels...

author: {'steamid': '76561198054259146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 170, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1512468606}
review:
Pretty little point and click game with a strong story and nice characters. 
It lasts 5 hours more or less.
Game feels like well polished and optimized, never had a crash or a bug. The only "bad" note, might be the loading screens. Sometimes you have to switch rooms in order to complete the puzzles and see loadings so often, everytime I'd switch room, was slightly annoying.
Puzzles aren't hard but still give a satisfying amount of challange. 
Totally worth to be played.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198027613946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1512254310}
review:
''Silence'' is a wondrous, colourful, stunning game about war and death.

Yes, war and death.  It is gonna make you cry at the ending.
''Realms'' like Silence are actually ''real'' for millions of children suffering from war.  There is a sharp dissonance between merry colourful graphics (top level artwork there!), child-story plot, and overall lightheartedness.... and the harrowing reality of what it all really means. 

Raw emotion pours forth from that dissonance, upgrading the game from ''fairytale art'' to actual art.

A bit short and too easy, but totally worth it on a sale (30$ is too much for this game, Daedalic!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198041444554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1510611757}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045163498', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1512163247}
review:
I thought I'd just finished the tutorial and then the credits rolled.

Seriously, this is a game where style goes over substance. After hearing they were doing a sequel to a Whispered World (go play this if you haven't), I was very much looking forward to it, but after several delays and interviews before release, in which the devs explained they had to change the engine and made the puzzles easier to appeal to the 'Story Adventure' audience, my hopes weren't as high as before. But I did not expect this bullsh*t. I admit the graphics are great, but they should've made a movie instead. WIth this product, where every 'puzzle' is designed for babies, they surely didn't make a game.

[spoiler]I felt sorry for the boy after the first game, but after seeing him in this one behaving like a stupid, selfish and unfunny brat, I wished he hadn't woken up back then.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197976498153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 533, 'last_played': 1525574389}
review:
*pollice giallo*

Silence Ã¨ un'avventura grafica punta e clicca. 
Dal seguito di Whispered World mi aspettavo gradi cose, purtroppo nel complesso devo dirmi deluso. Partiamo da l'unico aspetto che funziona: visivamente Ã¨ la piÃ¹ bella avventura grafica di sempre, ogni singola locazione Ã¨ una spettacolo, i personaggi poi sembrano usciti da un film di animazione da quanto sono fatti e animati bene. I punti positivi finiscono qui. La storia Ã¨ pressochÃ© la stessa del predecessore, il che Ã¨ giÃ  un grosso punto a sfavore, oltre a ciÃ² il gioco Ã¨ cortissimo (4-6 ore) e di conseguenza risulta molto poco approfondito, direi quasi incompleto. I personaggi secondari sono appena abbozzati, non facciamo in tempo a conoscerli bene che il gioco Ã¨ finito. Si puÃ² dire lo stesso del mondo di Silence, quando stiamo iniziando a capire cosa sta succedendo, bam, finito. Il gameplay non fa eccezione e vive sull'onda della semplificazione: non abbiamo un vero Ã¨ proprio inventario (!) gli oggetti si combinano da soli (!!) e ci viene indicato dove utilizzarli (!!!). Insomma il gameplay del gioco consiste nel farsi guidare per manina in una (breve) camminata fino alla conclusione. Le musiche le ho trovate poco ispirate, l'unico brano degno di questo nome Ã¨ stato ripreso pari pari dal predecessore. Quantomeno il doppiaggio Ã¨ all'altezza.

Concludendo questo Silence sembra un gioco tagliato a metÃ : anche con il suo non-gameplay, se la storia fosse stata all'altezza e non lasciasse mille buchi per strada (finale compreso), avrebbe avuto comunque un suo perchÃ© nell'incredibile bellezza del mondo di gioco, ma gli elementi che mancano sono veramente troppi.

SE non vi dispiacciano i giochi semplici e brevi Silence potrebbe fare il caso vostro, tutti gli altri passino serenamente oltre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044104020', 'num_games_owned': 846, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1480266551}
review:
Silence is a trip back on the memory lane to the bed time stories of childhood, hiding behind a charming world, silly characters and a fairy tale plot a much more delicate subject. But itâ€™s trying so hard to appeal to multiple generations and this is probably its biggest sin.
At the transition point between two markets, Silence might be capturing the attention of older and younger adventurers alike, but Iâ€™m not sure which group will enjoy it the most.


Pros:
+ Visuals are artistically beautiful
+ Atmospheric music
+ The story
+ Spot

Cons:
- Overly simplified gameplay
- Many and long loading screens
- Some of the dialogues and voice acting 

Read the full review at:
www.thegameslashers.com/2016/11/silence-review.html

author: {'steamid': '76561198121692552', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1511711377}
review:
Un voto positivo porque no es un desastre de juego, de hecho tiene cosas muy buenas y se nota un esfuerzo por los desarrolladores, pero por desgracia deja una sensaciÃ³n de decepciÃ³n importante.

Lo bueno: 

- Enlaza muy bien con la historia del primer juego.

- Los personajes bien desarrollados y muy buenas voces (especialmente la protagonista).

- GrÃ¡ficamente perfecto.

- La mÃºsica sigue cumpliendo muy bien.


Lo malo:

- Parece una mezcla (muy mal hecha) de aventura grÃ¡fica y novela visual. El apartado de juego tiene la misma importancia que las escenas cinematogÃ¡ficas. En el 95% del juego tu personaje solo puede desplazarse por el lugar donde se encuentra en ese instante, (que cabe al completo en la pantalla del ordenador, no hay mÃ¡s). Nada de coger objetos de un sitio y combinarlos con los de otro lado. Todo estÃ¡ ahÃ­, y hay pocos objetos interactuables asÃ­ que la sencillez es mÃ¡xima. Por no haber no hay ni inventario y si por casualidad coges un objeto no te molestes en pensar con cual de las 4 o 5 cosas mÃ¡s que aparecen en el mapa tienes que usarla, el juego ya te lo dice mostrÃ¡ndote un icono. Es tan bÃ¡sico que parece que pretenden que no pierdas ni un segundo de mÃ¡s jugando y pases a la siguiente escena cinematogrÃ¡fica cuanto antes. Y es que el juego tiene muuuchas escenas de video. Tantas que cortan por completo el  ritmo de juego.

- No se puede guardar cuando quieras. El juego lo hace automÃ¡ticamente en algunos momentos (que no sabrÃ¡s). Por lo que en ocasiones al cargar tienes que volver a tragarte la escena anterior.

- MecÃ¡nicas absurdas en un juego de aventura grÃ¡fica. Para desplazar un objeto o tirar de algo no vale con hacer click tienes que desplazar el ratÃ³n en el sentido del movimiento. O para mantener el equilibrio tienes que ir centrando el ratÃ³n en una barra.

- Las decisiones. En el primer juego tomabas una sola decisiÃ³n y era importante, ya que segÃºn lo que eligieras mostraba un final u otro (acorde a tu elecciÃ³n). AquÃ­ da la sensaciÃ³n de que digas lo que digas no importa absolutamente nada, te mostrarÃ¡ la siguiente escena igualmente. Y la Ãºnica decisiÃ³n que cambia algo las cosas que es la Ãºltima (y es la Ãºnica que puedes rejugar por el tema de autoguardado) produce cambios en algo en lo que no deberÃ­a, porque tu decisiÃ³n no tiene nada que ver con eso.


En definitiva, aunque Silence tienes cosas realizadas con mucho acierto y momentos muy buenos, creo que no es para todo el mundo. Si hubiesen eliminado muchas escenas sin importancia, dejando las mÃ¡s relevantes para conocer mejor a los personajes y la historia, y hubiesen dado mayor fluidez y  profundidad al apartado de juego la cosa podrÃ­a haber sido bien distinta. 

Si no eres mucho de aventuras grÃ¡ficas y quieres probar un juego muy sencillo y artÃ­sticamente bonito Silence es buena opciÃ³n. Si eres de aventuras grÃ¡ficas clÃ¡sicas te quedarÃ¡s decepcionado. Finalmente, si te gustÃ³ The Whispered World probablemente te quede sensaciÃ³n agridulce. En cualquier caso mejor esperar a ofertas.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999081490', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 298, 'last_played': 1511813226}
review: Very short but definitely entertaining.  The puzzles were very simple and straightforward but it was more about enjoying the story.  You should definitely play Whispered World before playing this or you will be lost by the references.  This story is a bit more dark than the one before but I like the replay value as you can make differen choices.  Don't go into this thinking it is a brain teaser but look at it as an interactive story to sit back and enjoy.

review: Telltale oyunlarÄ±nÄ±n en bÃ¼yÃ¼k eksikliÄŸi olarn bulmaca kÄ±smÄ±nÄ± da iÃ§eren (umarÄ±m) yeni nesil Daedalic oyunu. Hikaye ve animasyonun Ã§ok Ã¶n planda olduÄŸu bir oyun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115840410', 'num_games_owned': 1537, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1511468980}
review:
Silence is a strange game, I started liking it but ended up not. Why? It's BORING.
The gameplay (I know it's a story driven game but) it's too slow and every action takes forever to complete.
The graphics are good and a big improvement from the first game, but that does not save the game.
Voice acting is really mediocre with some characters and really takes away the atmosphere sometimes.

Pros
- Graphics
- General Idea

Cons
- Everything else

author: {'steamid': '76561198023909017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 340, 'last_played': 1511708742}
review:
Ich hab mich anhand der Guten bewertung orientiert.
Aber im Spiel stimmt so einiges nicht.

Ich bin ein Fan von spielen wie Monkey Island.
Da war es mÃ¶glich, Sachen miteinander zu kombinieren um eine Tiefe im Spiel zu erhalten und die MÃ¶glichkeiten zu steigern.
Bei Silence, kann man keine items kombinieren, wenn man ein Item in der Hand hat, zeigt das Spiel wo man es hintun soll.
Die Dialog Optionen spielen fast keine Rolle, hÃ¤tte mir mehr MÃ¶glichkeiten bei den GesprÃ¤chen gewÃ¼nscht.
Manche Charaktere sind so schwammig, am Ende hab ich mich gefragt, wozu ich den Typen gerettet habe oder diese Leute mitgenommen habe?   Das Ende hat mich sehr enttÃ¤uscht.
Leider ein Flop, selbst mich Herbstaktion.  
Scheint mehr ein Spiel fÃ¼r Kinder zu sein, schade eigentlich.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260514314', 'num_games_owned': 473, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1511634754}
review:
Ein visuell sehr hÃ¼bsches Spiel mit tollen Charakteren und dem gewohnten Daedalic-Humor!
Es gibt zwei verschiedene Endings, welche einem erst deutlich machen, was Silence Ã¼berhaupt ist und sobald man die Bedeutung verstanden hat, wird es ziemlich emotional.

Super Spiel auf jeden Fall, sehr empfehlenswert, wenn man auf Point&Click x Daedalic steht!

Spielzeit ca. 5 Stunden

author: {'steamid': '76561198150690709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1509645583}
review:
Ein athmosphÃ¤risch und grafisch wunderschÃ¶nes Spiel! Ich musste weinen, lachen und habe vor Spannung die Luft angehalten. Man schlÃ¼pft in die Rolle 2er Geschwisterkinder, ein kleines MÃ¤dchen oder der groÃŸe Bruder, um RÃ¤tsel zu lÃ¶sen und sich durch die Welt "Silence" zu bewegen und fÃ¼r die gute Sache zu kÃ¤mpfen. Manches ist nicht so, wie es auf den ersten Blick wirkt. 
Man hat verschiedene HandlungsmÃ¶glichkeiten, die sich auf den weiteren Verlauf der Geschichte auswirken. 
Es ist der Nachfolger von "The whispered World".
Mehr mÃ¶chte ich nicht verraten, sondern nur so viel: ich werde dieses Spiel garantiert erneut spielen!

review:
Einen Moment Stille fÃ¼r ein groÃŸartiges Adventure.

Um es kurz zu machen:
Das Spiel hat eine schÃ¶n erzÃ¤hlte Geschichte, einen charmanten Humor und schÃ¶ne SchauplÃ¤tze.
Obwohl ich selbst keine Intelligenzbestie bin, waren die RÃ¤tsel gut zu lÃ¶sen. Und mit der Raupe "Spot" macht es gleich doppelt so viel SpaÃŸ.

Und Leute: meine F12-Taste (yep, Screenshot-Taste) hat immer mal wieder geglÃ¼ht - das Spiel ist einfach so schÃ¶n, die Landschaften so malerisch, die Charaktere gut gezeichnet, es stimmt alles.

Und jetzt brecht mit der Stille und startet Silence! ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198002475286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1493803362}
review: Silence is such a neat game. The fantastic story and the lovable characters almost make you forget that it is a point and click game. It feels a lot more first person than it is. I feel like there are two approaches here: One could think that it is a shame that the game doesn't live up to its potential by have a more interesting gameplay, by it not being a point and click. Or one could accept that this game is one of the best point and click adventures of all time. I chose the latter.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053355328', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 740, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 711, 'last_played': 1519164293}
review:
A new game by Daedalic and oh my, how beautiful it is! I'm a big fan of point & click games, especially those from Daedalic and when I saw the artwork, I knew I had to give the game a try. I wasn't disappointed - at all! 
The game opens really strong and emotional and takes you on a journey to different worlds. At first I was surprised that there's no real inventory like I'm used to from most point and click games but the game works well without it.
Overall, it seems easier than other point and click games I've played. There was one "puzzle" I was stuck on but that was probably due to fatigue and not because it was overly difficult. If you like a challenge this game might not be for you but if you want to be taken on a journey that focuses on story - this is your game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198286722236', 'num_games_owned': 1238, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1615750817}
review:
Silence ist wirklich ein wundervolles Spiel. Ja es handelt sich um ein Point & Click Adventure aber die Geschichte hinter diesem Spiel ist so schÃ¶n und wie ich finde eigentlich wirklich traurig, dass sich das spielen auf jeden Fall lohnt. 

Die Geschichte an sich ist erstmalig nach ein paar Stunden (ich brauchte 6-8) durchgespielt. Nach dem ersten durchlauf werden die durchgÃ¤nge dementsprechend kÃ¼rzer, da man weiÃŸ was  man machen muss. Dennoch sind  mir bei jedem durchspielen ein-zwei Kleinigkeiten aufgefallen, die mir vorher nicht aufgefallen waren. 

Grade wenn das Spiel im Sale ist, kann ich es nur empfehlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012951694', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 717, 'last_played': 1542830820}
review:
Aventura grÃ¡fica que te toca la fibra.

Continuando la linea del Whispered World, la narrativa del juego te hace sumergirte en la historia, te hace partÃ­cipe de las decisiones de forma que estas marcan el camino para el desenlace, consiguiendo que quedes absorto mientras lo juegas.

Ofrece una ambientaciÃ³n grÃ¡fica y sonora de muy buen gusto que consiguen hacer la experiencia de juego realmente Ãºnica.

Los personajes y las interacciones entre los mismos te hace ir cambiando de emociones mientras lo disfrutas variando entre el drama, el humor y la sÃ¡tira.

Respecto al gameplay, mantiene como su predecesor unos controles sencillos, comodos e intuitivos, que te hacen disfrutar de la experiencia. Los puzzles tienen sentido y pueden ser resueltos prestando atenciÃ³n al detalle, sin caer en el error en el cual caen otros juegos de la misma categoria, en los cuales acabas probando todo con todo sin razonamiento lÃ³gico.

Si quieres una aventura grÃ¡fica que te haga despertar emociones (desde la tristeza, a la carcajada o la inquietud), mientras disfrutas de una estÃ©tica muy cuidada (me atreveria a decir que encantadora). este es sin duda tu juego.

Es importante decir, que es necesario haber jugado previamente al Whispered World para entender la historia, asÃ­ como el papel de cada personaje, o ciertos escenarios.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067708511', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1510931261}
review:
What I think makes this game is the beautiful artstyle and the surprisingly deep story, the gameplay was quite simple as were the puzzles but that kept the flow of the story going nicely. 
I'm not usually a big fan of point and click games but this one felt different, I really enjoyed it :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198288685905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 632, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1540693825}
review: Beautiful character and world design with a stunning soundtrack. However, after a promising beginning, I felt that the gameplay was far too short and the ending was somewhat rushed. It left me feeling rather melancholy and wondering what became of the supporting characters. I hope there's a sequel on it's way, otherwise I can't see myself wanting to play this again. I would recommend this but not at full RRP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046426199', 'num_games_owned': 3057, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 579, 'last_played': 1511537006}
review:
This is how a point and click game should look like in 2017! Too bad Daedalic Entertainment sacrificed the content, riddles and story for the amazing graphics.

Pros:
+ unbelievable graphics
+ music
+ voice acting

Cons:
- story (too short and lack of details)
- riddles are way too easy, it's more like a casual game than a traditional point & click one which is a pretty big flaw

It's worth a try, but don't expect anything like Whispered World. A pretty short casual point & click with astonishing graphics. Once again it's hard to recommend this game. It's yes, but only if it's on sale, otherwise you may be disappointed!

If you want a little bit of back ground on the game you can play the Whispered World, which I also highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439808116', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1511379193}
review:
WunderschÃ¶nes Adventure - oder eher eine interaktive Geschichte - mit nachdenklich stimmender Thematik.

Wer ein Point-and-Click-Adventure in Umfang und KomplexitÃ¤t des VorgÃ¤ngers The Whispered World erwartet, wird ein wenig Ã¼berrumpelt sein. Die RÃ¤tsel sind spÃ¤rlicher, leichter und einen richtigen Inventar gibt es auch nicht. Die gesamte Handlung ist weitaus gefÃ¼hrter, es ist mehr wie eine interaktive Geschichte. 
Etwas schade fand ich, dass man zwar WahlmÃ¶glichkeiten angeboten kommt, diese jedoch nur scheinbar existieren, weil der Charakter sich sowieso fÃ¼r genau die eine Sache entscheidet und kleinere WahlmÃ¶glichkeiten eigentlich auch keine oder nur selten Auswirkungen auf die Interaktion zwischen den Akteuren haben.

Die Bilder und EindrÃ¼cke sind jedoch wunderschÃ¶n und man kommt aus dem Bewundern kaum heraus, und wer Spot und Sadwick vermisst hat, wird sich Ã¼ber ein Wiedersehen freuen. Anders als The Whispered World tendiert Silence stellenweise jedoch zum Kitsch, und leider ist aufgrund der SpiellÃ¤nge keine Zeit fÃ¼r zynische Kommentare Sadwicks. Ein "uns verbindet ein unsichtbares Band aus...aus Kitsch" wird man von Sadwick hier eher nicht hÃ¶ren.
Ebenso wie in The Whispered World liegt auch hier eine eher nachdenklich stimmende Thematik zu Grunde, der man sich spÃ¤testens gegen Ende nicht mehr entziehen kann. 
Das Spiel ist wunderschÃ¶n gestaltet und es macht trotz enger FÃ¼hrung und kurzer Spieldauer sehr viel SpaÃŸ zu spielen, auch, wenn es ein wenig wehmÃ¼tig macht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198441231747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1511302518}
review:
[i] EMOTIVO, TRISTE, HERMOSO [/i]. Tres adjetivos que definen muy bien este juego, que te arrancarÃ¡ alguna lÃ¡grima. [b] Es la segunda parte de The Wispered World, !y ojo porque justo al principio de este desvelan todo el primer juego! [/b]

El comienzo de este juego es fuerte, muy emocionante, y la cosa no decae, hacia el final las emociones se intensifican si cabe. Este juego tiene dos finales posibles a elegir por el jugador, y se puede rejugar para explorarlos ambos. [b] OJO estad MUY atentos porque son finales distintos y para enterarse bien de ellos hay que tener los ojos bien abiertos y prestar atencion al detalle. Para uno de los finales hay que esperar al final de los creditos. [/b]

[u][b] Es un juego corto, de unas 4-5 horas. [/b][/u] [i] Es de point&click y tambiÃ©n de elecciones.[/i]
En este juego han cambiado un poco los controles, no hay un inventario, se interactÃºa directamente con el entorno. Las acciones posibles son propuestas por el propio juego cuando se posa el ratÃ³n sobre el objeto, esto hace que el juego sea Ã¡gil y fÃ¡cil de manejar. TambiÃ©n tendrÃ¡s la ocasiÃ³n de jugar con varios personajes en el curso de la historia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006383695', 'num_games_owned': 2419, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 636, 'last_played': 1511215514}
review:
Spoilers will be in this review for both Silence and The Whispered World.

Okay I just finally played the game and I loved the story even though it was quite predictable and quite liner. The puzzles where quite easy as well and there is an achievement for dying which I never had happened I didn't know I could die until then.

The characters are good and seeing some old ones are great, however. What most confused me about this is the start of the game. It's an air raid and Noah (Main character from the first game) takes his sister to a shelter. However, when Noah woke up on the first game he never had a sister it was his dad, brother and Spot (his dog.) Which are not mentioned anywhere in this game at all. His sister fine she could be born later on, but at least mention the others or something.

review: I've very much enjoyed this play. Finished it in 6 hours on one day without taking a real hurry. It's a good story and the gameplay is challenging, but not of the mind-boggling kind. The hint system ensures you should keep going, which makes this a nice story to play through on a rainy sunday. I'm glad i "won" this game in a raffle! Recommended if you enjoy story-rich enticing puzzlegames!

review:
Es delicado recomendar Silence. Por una parte, resulta una experiencia narrativa con una historia de muchos matices, ambivalente entre el drama y la comedia, bien hilvanada y que cuenta con un plantel de entraÃ±ables personajes, todos ellos correctamente perfilados. En suma, su apartado audiovisual es rutilante, con una banda sonora muy emotiva y un diseÃ±o artÃ­stico de una belleza sobrecogedora. Como pocas veces se han visto en este medio. Por el contrario, todos aquellos aficionados al gÃ©nero de las aventuras grÃ¡ficas que esperen una plena ortodoxia con lo que deberÃ­a ser la continuaciÃ³n de The Whispered World, aquÃ­ se verÃ¡n decepcionados. Silence es una aventura corta, de mecÃ¡nicas mÃ¡s amigables al manejo con el pad que del ratÃ³n, y con unos puzles de sencilla resoluciÃ³n que desechan el uso de inventario y, por extensiÃ³n, de la lÃ³gica transversal. En definitiva, una bonita fabula con forma de aventura grÃ¡fica y fondo de pelÃ­cula interactiva de animaciÃ³n. 

Â¿Recomendable? SÃ­, si uno sabe lo que se va a encontrar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084538408', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 140, 'last_played': 1511035109}
review:
Editing this review to be a little more constructive.  Suffice to say, this game made me grumpy.  TLDR: this is a beautiful game with terrible writing.

First, my play time is a bit of a lie because I had to pause and run away at one point.  I actually played only about an hour. 

In the first five minutes there were a few emotional non-sequitors which had me wondering what I was in for, and I was leery because the writing for Deponia was the worst thing I've ever experienced in a video game.  But I liked the setup and the characters, and the art in Silence is truly wonderful, so I decided to try to ride out the intro.  However, once the game actually gets started, the characters start making incoherent dialog references like, "Oh, there's that train I rode through the sky."  What??  Did I miss a cutscene or something?  And then a major character is introduced as my good old buddy, and of course I already know this character so there's no reason to explain them to me, the player.  If this game is a sequel, and if you need to play the prequel to understand this world, then this should be clearly called out somewhere, and ideally this should just be "part 2 of something else" instead of its own title.  I'm assuming that that is the explanation, because otherwise I have no idea what the writers were thinking.  Whatever the reason, I felt a bit conned because it's either bad writing in the game or bad advertising in the Steam store.

I kept playing because I was hoping to get through whatever backstory references they forgot to explain, and just get into this world.  For a bit I almost succeeded, despite some bugs in the dialog timing where characters would start speaking too soon or over each other and completely break the immersion.  I actually like most of the character personalities - none of them go terribly overboard in any annoyingly stereotypical fashion, and they interact in some fun ways.  But due to the timing and backstory issues, I also never really connected with any of them in a way that made me care whether or not they made it through this unexplained world.

The puzzles were simple yet fun to play through, and I liked how the story was interwoven pretty well with the puzzle sections.  However, after breezing through the first several scenes, I got to one that seemed to stump me.  I noticed that some of the objects in this area were extremely difficult to get the game to highlight, even when I knew that they were there, so maybe I simply never found the object needed to solve the puzzle.  Either that, or the difficulty went from like 2 to 10 instantly.  But after several minutes of trying to figure out why objects weren't highlighting and whether I was missing something or just dealing with bugs, I realized, I don't care at all about this story or these characters, and the puzzle system isn't interesting enough to engage me.  The only thing left without story or puzzles is art, and the stream of new art had stopped at this puzzle, so I was done.

Maybe the writers were aiming for a higher level of meta, and I'm *supposed* to be confused because this is a dream-like world, or something.  But I just felt entirely disconnected from any story content.  A pity, because Daedalic's visual artists did some great work in the first part of this game, and I'll probably never see the rest.  If I could refund this game, I would.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039913312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1511017171}
review:
I have to say that I am really dissapointed in this game.
I have played the prequel "The Whispered World", I liked the story and found the puzzle's really fun.

It looks like they have taken everything bad about the first game and used that as a base for making the sequel.

- The game is very short
- There is NO puzzles that a 5 year old would not manage to find out.
- They have managed to make the characters interesting, but the game was so short and hollow, that it fell through.

I am increadibly dissapointed.
It looks like theer is a completly diffrent team behind this game, thats how diffrent it is (In an increadibly bad way)

I have one positive thing though. The graphics are good and I like the beginning.I just had higher hopes for this game.
Dissapointed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989807190', 'num_games_owned': 2276, 'num_reviews': 599, 'playtime_forever': 266, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1510788946}
review:
Silence is a sequel to the first Daedalic's international success - The Whispered World. Which I've played twice and don't like all that much, by the way. And it hits all the points every Daedalic's title hits - it has amazing visual style, except now it's 3D+2D, it has really nice soundtrack, it has fantastic ideas for the story, and then it falls apart at everything else. The studio did make a few point and click adventure games that worked (more or less) fine throughout the entirety of the playthrough, with solid gameplay ideas and actually good story execution, but Silence is not one of them. In fact, I'd say Silence is one of their worst attempts.

Be it the first foray into the world of 3D adventuring or some other reason, but Silence feels like a quarter-baked idea released as is. It has the story arc fit for a full feature, story for about 20 minutes and then a bunch of "adventure game" gameplay in between. Which isn't actually adventure gameplay, but more of a "guess where you have to click next to trigger the next thing to go to another place to trigger another thing to trigger the story", in the worst possible way. It's like watching a movie, only for it to pause and present you with a bunch of boring busywork so it unpauses and continues, with busywork having next to nothing to do with the story. Which, by the way, is a boring and non-impactful rephrasing of the same story as in The Whispered World, but with forgettable disposable secondary characters, pointless "character arcs" (oh no, I so care about this character I'm seeing for the third time and know nothing about who might die now!) and nothing of its own. I hope Daedalic manages to make a good game with this visual style. But Silence is not it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052312111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1510717024}
review:
[b]Atemberaubendes Spielerlebnis, dem jedoch leider die Tiefe seines VorgÃ¤ngers fehlt.[/b]

[h1]Vorweg:[/h1]
Meine Empfehlung fÃ¼r "Silence" kann ich leider nur eingeschrÃ¤nkt abgeben. Wer sich von dem Titel ein tiefgehendes Adventure mit zahlreichen Dialogen und knackigen RÃ¤tseln erhofft, so wie es sein VorgÃ¤nger "The Whispered World" geboten hat (nebst den meisten anderen Spielen von Deadalic), wird leider maÃŸlos enttÃ¤uscht. "Silence" ist viel mehr ein Eintauchen in eine fantastische Welt und eine traurig-schÃ¶ne Geschichte, in der nur wenig gerÃ¤tselt und Dialog-gefÃ¼hrt wird, sondern eher gestaunt. Ein Spiel zum ZurÃ¼cklehnen und Erleben.
Dieser Zugang zur Traumwelt "Silence", ist jedoch so passend und rund, dass es mich trotz der zunÃ¤chst enttÃ¤uschten Erwartungen in seinen Bann ziehen konnte - daher meine Empfehlung. 

[h1]Story:[/h1]
Die Geschichte knÃ¼pft direkt an die von "The Whispered World" an. Wer den ersten Teil noch nicht gespielt hat, ist jedoch nicht vÃ¶llig verloren, denn gleich zu Beginn erfÃ¤hrt man alle wichtigen Ereignisse des VorgÃ¤ngers und kann so auch ohne Vorkenntnisse in das Spiel eintauchen.
[u]ABER: Ich mÃ¶chte dennoch wÃ¤rmstens empfehlen vorher "The Whispered World" zu Spielen, denn, wie gesagt, das gesamte Spiel wird in "Silence" gleich zu Beginn gespoilert und ruiniert damit mindestens die HÃ¤lfte des SpielspaÃŸes.[/u]
Ohne zu viel verraten zu wollen, erzÃ¤hlt auch "Silence" wieder eine wunderschÃ¶ne, bitter-sÃ¼ÃŸe Geschichte, die sich zum Ende hin perfekt entfaltet.

Leider ist die Spielzeit deutlich zu kurz geraten (nur 5-6 Stunden!). Entsprechend ist kaum Platz fÃ¼r Nebenhandlungen und wir erfahren nur wenig Ã¼ber die Charaktere, die uns begleiten. Das ist besonders Schade, da jeder einzelne der Nebencharaktere hervoragend geschrieben ist und viel Potential bieten wÃ¼rde. So manche Frage Ã¼ber sie scheint am Ende sogar unbeantwortet zu bleiben.   

[h1]AtmosphÃ¤re:[/h1]
Dieser Aspekt ist eindeutig die StÃ¤rke von "Silence". Die epische Musik, die malerischen HintergrÃ¼nde, die liebevoll animierten Figuren, die insgesamt einfach atemberaubende Grafik - alles passt perfekt zusammen und lÃ¤sst einen tief in der Traumwelt versinken.
Dies trÃ¶stet auch gut Ã¼ber die geringe Spielzeit hinweg, denn das gesamte Erlebnis ist sehr intensiv: Kein unnÃ¶tiger Dialog, kein HÃ¤ngenbleiben an RÃ¤tseln, keine Frustration, nichts, das einen aus dem Spielfluss herausreiÃŸen kÃ¶nnte. Einfach ein einziges, langes MÃ¤rchen. 

[h1]Spielmechanik:[/h1]
Wie bereits erwÃ¤hnt, ist die Mechanik fÃ¼r ein Point&Click sehr simpel gehalten. So gibt es z.B. kein Inventar, gefundene GegenstÃ¤nde werden automatisch an passender Stelle benutzt. Harte KopfnÃ¼sse bleiben durch die Bank aus, in der Regel ist auch bei nicht sofort ersichtlichen RÃ¤tsellÃ¶sungen nach zwei, drei Versuchen Erfolg garantiert. Trotzdem darf eben auch ein bisschen gegrÃ¼belt werden, was das Spiel von reinen "Story-Spielen" abhebt.
All dies passt jedoch, wie gesagt, gut zum Spiel und mÃ¶chte ich auch nicht bemÃ¤ngeln.
Was mir jedoch bitter aufgestoÃŸen ist, ist die "konsolenartige" Aufmachung an vielen Stellen. "Balance"-Aufgaben und Bewegen von Objekten durch Maus-gedrÃ¼ckt-halten-und-ziehen wirkt einfach sehr befremdlich in einem Point&Click und ist unnÃ¶tig mÃ¼hsam. 

PRO
+ fantastische Grafik und Musik
+ einzigartige AtmosphÃ¤re
+ gute, ergreifende Geschichte
+ sympathische Charaktere
+ sehr gute deutsche Sprecher und fast noch bessere englische Sprecher
+ endlich mehr Spot-RÃ¤tsel!

CON
+ Nebencharaktere kommen zu kurz
+ geringe Spielzeit von 5-6 Stunden
+ offene Fragen
+ Konsolen-Steuerung auf PC anstrengend
+ fÃ¼r Adventure-Fans viel zu einfach

[h1]FAZIT:[/h1]
Ein traumhaftes Spiel zum ZurÃ¼cklehnen und GenieÃŸen, das wenig an RÃ¤tseln, jedoch viel an AtmosphÃ¤re bietet. Obwohl es kein Adventure vom Feinsten ist, wie es Daedalic schon oft abgeliefert hat, ist es ein einzigartiges Erlebnis fÃ¼r 2 oder 3 entspannte Feierabende.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105336683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1510685792}
review:
8/10 Definetly a good game. 
The story is excellent. Voice acting and art are beautful to watch. The game play is a little slow at times, and the puzzles can be confusing. There is a help system that makes the puzzles a little bit easier, but it could be better. 
But all of the mechanic's problems are washed away by how breath taking the story is. I got 8 hours out of the game, definitely a worthy addition to anyone's library.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127133011', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 343, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1510611531}
review:
Silence no es un mal juego como tal, pero tampoco tiene nada en particular que incite a jugarlo por encima de otras aventuras grÃ¡ficas. Como en cierta parte lo he disfrutado, voy a ser justo con Ã©l destacando sus pros y contras:

[b]PROS[/b]
[list]
[*]Muy bonito de ver.
[*]Buena banda sonora (nada muy destacable pero cumple su funciÃ³n).
[*]Buen final.
[*]Renie y Spot son personajes a los que se les coge cariÃ±o.
[*]Aunque hay gente quejÃ¡ndose de su precio (yo lo conseguÃ­ en Humble Monthly asÃ­ que ahÃ­ no me voy a meter), han tenido la decencia de no sacarlo en episodios en una Ã©poca en la que todos quieren subirse al carro de Telltale.
[*]En general las animaciones que no tienen que ver con personas son bastante buenas (y algunas de personas tambiÃ©n).
[/list]
[b]CONTRAS[/b]
[list]
[*]Quitando Renie y Spot, el resto de personajes son una mezcla horrible de tontos e inÃºtiles. Tienes a la que manda aunque no valga para nada, el que se cree mejor que el resto, el gordo bonachÃ³n y el viejo que desvarÃ­a. CuÃ¡nto habrÃ­a ganado el juego sin ellos.
[*]A pesar de lo fantÃ¡stico-Ã©pica que es la trama, quitando en el Ãºltimo segmento del juego, nada de lo que haces se siente ni Ãºtil ni Ã©pico. Es mÃ¡s como ir de un obstÃ¡culo-recado a otro sin mucho sentido en la trama general hasta que llegas al Ãºltimo segmento y por fin te hablan del argumento y tomas grandes decisiones.
[*]Tiene una muy buena premisa que te cuenta en la primera escena, pero durante el juego se olvida prÃ¡cticamente de ella hasta que llega la Ãºltima escena.
[*]La mayorÃ­a de segmentos point&click tienen 2-3 pantallas con tiempos de carga entre ellas. Es un tiempo corto pero lo suficientemente largo como para que te duela dejarte algo por hacer en la pantalla anterior y comerte una pantalla extra de carga.
[*]Los personajes tienen en general problemas para mostrar emociones fuertes, cuando gritan la animaciÃ³n es (prÃ¡cticamente) igual a cuando hablan, y al final esto acaba quitÃ¡ndole chicha a los momentos mÃ¡s tensos.
[/list]
Como veis, falla en los puntos mÃ¡s clave de una aventura grÃ¡fica, que son una trama interesante y buenos personajes. Por eso, a pesar de ser un juego perfectamente vÃ¡lido para pasar una tarde, siento que no puedo recomendarlo del todo.

EDIT: Arreglado un error de escritura.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059861937', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 526, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 526, 'last_played': 1510523392}
review:
Beautiful environment design and decent soundtrack, perhaps slightly hampered by so-and-so voice acting and sketchy (yet somehow rewarding) storyline. Daedalic Entertainment is eventually shedding its tiresome elements that plagued its Deponia series, it appears. It's perhaps suited for more casual player base as puzzles are rather simplistic and overall playtime is about 7-8 hours at a leisurely base.

It's also arguable whether 29,99â‚¬ is a reasonable price for a game so short, but it does appear in discounts / bundles. It's by no means a bad game - it's enjoyable and occasionally, can even be quite touching. Its endings seem to have been specifically designed to induce total guilt and regret, so kudos for that.

review:
Silence, ist ein wirklich interessantes Point and Click Adventure mit einer sehr Ã¼berraschend endenden Story.

Es mag zwar spielerisch nicht wirklich eine Herausforderung darstellen, hat dafÃ¼r aber interessant gestalltete Charactere und ab und zu auch sehr witzige Momente.

Spielern die gerne Kunst in Spielen suchen sind mit Silence sicher gut bedient, da sÃ¤mtliche Landschaften sehr schÃ¶n in die Welt eingearbeitet wurden (viele HintergrÃ¼nde wurden offenbar gezeichnet, haben aber eine schÃ¶ne Farbharmonie).
Beim Soundtrack, lÃ¤sst der Titel allerdings etwas nach, bis auf die Titelmusik ist keiner der Soundtracks wirklich einprÃ¤gsam gestalltet worden.
Nichts desto trotz, interessantes Spiel.

----------------------------
Meine persÃ¶nliche Bewertung: 8/10 Gameart, 4/10 Soundtracks, 2/10 Schwierigkeit der RÃ¤tsel, 8,2/10 Charactere, 9/10 fÃ¼r manch witzigen Moment (bringt einem einfach zum Lachen)

author: {'steamid': '76561198035402609', 'num_games_owned': 1495, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 325, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1510331029}
review:
I stepped into Silence for the first time, which i have ment to play since before it launch, i am not sure why i did not get around to it, but i am glad that i did at last.

Silence explores a topic that a lot of games tend to shy away from, the idea of life and death. Even though silence has been this topic in an abstract way, it some how keeps the delicacy required for an otherwise uncomfortable topic. 

i wont go to much in to the story, as you may want to play or watch the story unfold for your self, but lets just say  Silence is a strange world, that never disapoints you, and lets just say you will fall in love with spot, he is so cute.

As to the game play and Speaking of puzzles, Daedalic Entertainment have ensured that Silence is filled with them. Utilising Noah, Renie and Spot, players will be required to solve puzzles, which can have you jumping between areas at certain points, which manages to keep it fresh all the way through the game,  In addition, there are a few mini games that add even more variety to the puzzles

The art work in this game is absolutely stunning and every scene beautifully combines the detailed 2D background with the 3D characters. I was pleasantly surprised by how well the characters blended into their surroundings and love the gameâ€™s overall appearance. Furthermore, much like other cinematic successes, Silence has a fantastic soundtrack that seamlessly carries the player from relaxed exploration to tense encounters.

I wish i could give this game a 10/10 but i can not as sometimes when the characters talk, thier conversations were delivered slightly awkwardly and their mouths would sometimes (very rare) be out of alinement with the words, so thus i can only give this game a 9.6/10

Silence is anything but silent and you may find your self scratching your head at this game but go and play

author: {'steamid': '76561198034317530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 303, 'last_played': 1510233343}
review:
the last three minutes are acutally the only good moments of this game.
then there is the graphics, which are worth playing.

but besides that it comes nothing close to the original. gameplay is really just point and click. brain not needed and options very rare.
story and storytelling are very linear and straightforward, no surprises at any point in time.

it's basically a telltale story with bare minimum of interaction. not point-and-click more watch-and-listen

furthermore the loading times are ridiculous for such a game

review:
Â¿Quieres una aventura grÃ¡fica clÃ¡sica? Daedalic tiene opciones con mÃ¡s profundidad en los diÃ¡logos y en el juego (A new beginning, The whispered world, Chains of Satinav...).

Sin embargo, ninguna se acerca ni de lejos a la belleza de los escenarios de Silence. Cada fotograma es una postal preciosa en la que elementos 3D y 2D se funden con un mimo y gusto que ya quisieran muchos AAA. Sus Ãºnicos defectos son una carga algo larga entre escenas y una jugabilidad simplificada en exceso (sin inventario, sin poder observar, p. ej.), pero es disfrutable de principio a fin. 

Y la oruga Spot merece un puesto junto a Kirby y Yoshi en el Olimpo de los personajes mÃ¡s adorables.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071670775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 359, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 359, 'last_played': 1510220449}
review:
I enjoyed the game even though I did find some of the puzzles difficult. The art was stunning. The voice work was fantastic too. I love Spot and the way you make use of him. But, I didn't like the long loading screens although I did get used to them towards the end. 

I found it annoying sometimes having to go back and forth from one location a bit annoying. 
However, all in all I'm glad I played it. I'd pick it up on sale or as part of a bundle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045446309', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 391, 'last_played': 1509949738}
review:
I'm not a fan.  This isn't a full Telltale-style experience as others have been saying, it is a point-and-click game.  Just a simple, linear one.  The puzzles were simple and easy, but frequently seemed to rely on arbitrary logic.  They story story exists, but feels more like a series of strung-together plot points that only make sense if you squint a bit.  The characterizations vary wildly, the 'main' character's personality being particularly fickle.  The whole tone of the game switches randomly.  I have a feeling this game was meant to be quite a bit longer than it wound up, which would explain a lot of the jumps.  The voice acting's not as bad as some have made it out to be, though.  Its a bit overdramatic, but completely servicable for the game.

I'll admit I'm not usually a fan of Daedalic's point-and-clicks, so take my perspective with a grain of salt.  But For me it was quite a bit disappointing.  It really is a pretty game, with a world that could be interesting, but there's just not enough here for me to recommend it.  It has neither the intricate puzzles of better point-and clicks nor the plotting of more cinematic point-and-clicks.  It's just kinda there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024983274', 'num_games_owned': 2676, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 604, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1509971381}
review:
[i]TDLR: Really good point and click adventure, great characters and music, solid pace, decent puzzles, and some TellTale-esche gameplay thrown into the mix. Ends abruptly, making it a little bit short[/i]

This game packs one of the best artwork and music I have ever witnessed. It combines 3d and painted backgrounds over 3d elements, and the effect is outstanding, to say the least. Every scene is like watching a painting come to life. 

Eye-candy aside, it is a solid point and click adventure. I found the characters the most enjoyable element of the experience. And theres puzzles for everyone: from the old inventory puzzles (although obvious), dialogue puzzles, some mini-game puzzles, and a whole bunch of situational puzzles (ala monkey2), to TellTale narrative and chose your own adventure.

I found the game, in terms of difficulty, on the easier side, but not in a bad way. There are difficult puzzles in there, but it is very well balanced. There is no "I had to use a guide for this" puzzles.., a Tim Schafer's speciality. 

+ Artwork, graphics, music, character design, voices.... it is truly a feast
+ True gamepad support, aka you can move your character using the stick, not just move the cursor. It also supports the steam controller, button prompts and all
+ Really good pace. Judging by the trailer and artwork, I thought the game was going to be an slow artsy feast, but that is not the case. That melancholy tone doesn't mean the game is a snooze fest at all
+ Jump between characters

~ I don't know why, this game has the same issue as the first one, at least in my setup: while playing, mid dialogue, suddenly some random phrase volume drops, then comes back in the next phrase. I had to lower the music volume to avoid missing out part of the dialogue. It is bearable, so I don't list this as a con.
~ The last half hour of the game, turns into full blown narrative and prompts. I appreciate the story, but I still prefer gameplay.
~ Short. a couple extra hours of gameplay could help a lot. There is some replayability based on taking other decisions, but I can't confirm how meaningfull the decisions are because this was my first playthrough. I am not against the TellTale stuff, but I don't particularly care to replay just to check what is going to happen.

- I prefer enthusiam over apathy, so I find the protag a little insufferable. This is my main gripe with the first game of the series. Playing the girl segments was rewarding, in comparison.

solid 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198119185500', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 308, 'last_played': 1509952575}
review:
This game reaches deep within and pulls an entire world together in a way that many games only hope to achieve. The protagnist is lovable, the characters rich with personality and the sound track it gorgeous. One thing I will note is that this is not a normal puzzle point and click game. Its more a cross of Tell-Tale and point and click. To some degree your actions decide the outcome. 

The game is fairly linear, with one main story line that branches off into different playable characters. I played on both a Mac and PC and it was flawless on both OS systems. The sound track is excellent, the graphics are relatively nice for the style of game it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088217136', 'num_games_owned': 786, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 544, 'last_played': 1509914679}
review:
It took me 9 hours but i finally beat Silence. 

Now as a person that enjoys PCA games, I LOVE it when you can interact with more than what is needed. Hearing the characters personal views and thoughts about everything is nice. 

This game is just stunning and beautiful. It has a big beautiful world, fun characters, and cute creatures (and of course creepy monsters). The voice acting is nice, and frankly i played this game 8 hours straight (had to stop since it was 4 a.m. before i knew it) then finished the last 9th hour in the morning. Basically I played it 9 hours straight.

The gameplay and puzzles are super thought provoking. And there is even an option to switch between people you play as from time to time. Though it doesn't affect gameplay for the most part.

Rinie is downright adorable!

Now of course i had a little bit of nitpicks with the game. At certain parts the dialogue is rushed. Like as soon as one dialogue ends the next dialogue begins leaving no space between them. 

Almost as if " Hey How are you doing?Fine thanks for asking"
The game had shown certain elements such as a romance that LOOKED like it was going to be part of the story but never actually did, which is a little disappointing.

TL;DR

The game is beautiful and worth picking up. I wouldn't quite say it's $30 worthy, but keep in mind i finished the game in 9 hours. So ballpark thats the price of the hours you'd pay to play

author: {'steamid': '76561198063086667', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 775, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 775, 'last_played': 1481571902}
review:
The game is beautiful to look at, and I did somewhat enjoy playing it, (though it was nowhere near as fun as The Whispered World), but what got me mad was a bug at some point in the game where I actually had to download a save, just to get past that part, because it wouldn't work on my playthrough. I don't even know if they fixed that bug yet, because I've not played the game since.

Would I recommend the game? sure, if you like this kind of thing, I just hope it's fixed by now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198073198676', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1501228771}
review:
I really enjoyed the first game and picked this up to continue the story.

The overly-simplistic, linear game play killed it for me. It is boring with very little challenge. It's barely point and click adventure. More like story time: click the corner to flip the page and continue. I'm disappointed.

I can't be bothered to finish it.

review:
Sehr schÃ¶n gemachtes Spiel
Pro:
es war nicht einmal unfair, also keine blÃ¶den RÃ¤tsel, alles in allem eher leicht zu bewÃ¤ltigen, deshalb aber nicht weniger schÃ¶n.
Besonders haben mir die Charaktere gefallen, die Musik war auch sehr schÃ¶n.
Gut, ich mochte die beiden Ende nicht, aber bis dahin ein wirklich tolles Spiel.

es war nach ca. 6h durch, leider

author: {'steamid': '76561198029599410', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1503423211}
review: Puh was soll ich nur sagen die Welt ist wunderschÃ¶n gestaltet und auch die Geschichte wird wieder in einer hervoragenden dramatik erzÃ¤hlt ob wohl ich da den VorgÃ¤nger besser fand weil man da ja des Ende noch nicht kannte. Aber wenn man fÃ¼r die WunderschÃ¶nen Gestaltung die Spieldauer so wie die kanackigen RÃ¤tzel opfert, dann muss ich klar sagen ist dieser Weg ist der falsche. Man kann ein Spiel auch schÃ¶n gestallten und kanackige RÃ¤tzel einbauen das schlieÃŸt sich ja beides nicht aus. Aber diese vereinfachungungen  wie sie in diesen Spiel vorgenommen kann ich so nicht unterstÃ¼tzen. So wohl die Geschichten als auch die Knackingen RÃ¤tzel waren das was ich an den Deadelic spielen mochte und in der Hoffnung das sie wieder auf ihren alten Pfad zurÃ¼ckehren, kann ich diesem Spiel hier leider keine empfelung geben, obwohl es von der optik her einfach umwerfend war.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045280231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1505473004}
review:
Por general es una aventura grÃ¡fica decente: tiene buenos grÃ¡ficos, los puzles no son muy complicados y la historia sorprendentemente es una secuela de "The Whispered World".
Mi problema con el juego son las decisiones. Este juego tiene decisiones y no las necesita.
La primera decisiÃ³n se muestra al avanzar un poco la aventura: ir por A o ir por B. No importa, pues hagas lo que hagas, el protagonista irÃ¡ por B. Una decisiÃ³n sin sentido.
La segunda decisiÃ³n se muestra muy avanzado el juego: tratar de ayudar a tus compaÃ±eros con un balazo de caÃ±Ã³n (que no se ve una gran idea) o usar a tu mascota para dejarles en la estacada. De ambas manera jodes a tus compaÃ±eros. Ni siquiera cambia gran cosa, solo estÃ¡ para joder.
Y la tercera decisiÃ³n, al acabar el juego: Ã©sta marcarÃ¡ el final. El final a es un final "bueno" para tu protagonista y uno malo para el otro. El final b es justamente lo contrario. Pero no tiene sentido porque la vida del otro personaje de alguna manera estÃ¡ ligada a esta decisiÃ³n, pero Ã©sto no tiene sentido. No haces nada que afecte a su vida, pero aun asÃ­ elegir cambia su final? No tiene sentido
En fin, si te gustÃ³ "The Whispered World" es probable que te acabe gustando el juego, pero en el momento que tengas que decidir si A o B y te quede la sensaciÃ³n de que has elejido mal (y no puedes retroceder, en este juego se guarda automÃ¡ticamente cada vez que cambias de pantalla, solo la Ãºltima elecciÃ³n es posible rejugarla sin empezar de nuevo), no te preocupes, ambas opciones estÃ¡n para hacerte sentir mal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045080783', 'num_games_owned': 424, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 371, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 371, 'last_played': 1498999516}
review:
Rather disappointed of this game, even though it focuses more on family, has better graphics and the implications of destroying that coma induced world, it just looks more and more like a remake of the first. 
It starts by retelling the story of The Whispering World, just before entering it, and latter it pushes the point that the world is the same as the first and the choice needs to be made the same as in the first, just in case you were expecting a twist. 
You now play as two characters a brother and his sister who are trying to get out of that world, while they're enemies are trying to keep them there. 
The caterpillar returns again as a flexible puzzle tool. 
If you did not play the first game, this world would seem a lot more interesting.

review:
Naja was soll ich sagen. WÃ¤hrend der erste Teil meiner Meinung nach Point and Click in HÃ¶chstform war fÃ¤llt Teil 2 leider eher schwach aus.

Pros:
Renie ist sÃ¼ÃŸ
Spot
Nostalgie

Cons:
Abgehackte CharaktÃ¤re
Abgehackte Story
RÃ¤tsel sind entweder vÃ¶llig offensichtlich oder vÃ¶llig sinnfrei aber nie schwer
Das Ende...

Review enthÃ¤lt ab hier Spoiler!


Das gute zuerst. Wer Teil 1 kennt wird sich daran erfreuen wieder in die Welt eintauchen zu kÃ¶nnen. Leider ist die Liste an Charakteren die man wiedertrifft auf 2 beschrÃ¤nkt. Spot und Sadwick. Von den neuen Charakteren weiÃŸ vorallem Renie zu Ã¼berzeugen. Mit ihrer naiven Art wirkt sie einfach sÃ¼ÃŸ. Besonders den alten Soundtrack wieder zu hÃ¶ren hielt einige schÃ¶ne nostalgische Momente in sich.

Nun zu dem Rest. AuÃŸer Renie sind alle Charaktere flach und man baut ohnehin wenig verbindung zu ihnen auf und selbst diese Verbindung wird spÃ¤ter apprupt und recht erzwungen beendet. Wenn man das Spiel spielt spÃ¼rt man ab einer bestimmten Stelle einen gewissen abbruch. Alles wird urplÃ¶tzlich so schnell es geht zu Ende gebracht und es wird mit moppsgeschwindigkeit aufs Ende zugeheitzt. 
Das Spiel spoilert sein eigenes Ende selbst, auch fÃ¼r Leute die den ersten Teil nicht kennen wird das Ende bereits in der ersten Stunde preisgegeben.
Um dem ganzen dann doch ein "Plottwist" zu geben wird dann eben das Ende verhundst. WÃ¤hrend das Ende des ersten Teils ein echer Hammerschlag war ist der Ende dieses Teils leider vÃ¶llig sinnfrei. Wie zu erwarten repariert man den Spiegel oder zerschlÃ¤gt ihn. Nur leider wird die ganze Nachricht das es sich eben nur um einen Komatraum handelt sehr schlecht Ã¼bermittelt. ZerschlÃ¤gt man den Spiegel Ã¶ffnet Noah am Ende nicht die Augen doch Renie meint ihre hÃ¤tte die Geschichte gefallen und sie wÃ¼rde nun eine erzÃ¤hlen. Wenn man den Spiegel repariert werden alle Leute in Silence geheilt aber Noah Ã¶ffnet am Ende die Augen. Einfach beide sehr seltsam aufgemacht und reichen einfach nicht an das Ende des ersten Teils heran. 

Die meiste Zeit habe ich nur die nostalgsichen Momente genossen, leider gibt es nicht einmal sonderlich viele GegenstÃ¤nde zu denen interessante oder lustige Kommentare herausgekitzelt werden kÃ¶nnen. Wer das Spiel ohne zu trÃ¶deln spielt kÃ¶nnte es leicht in ca 3 Stunden wegzocken. FÃ¼r ein Adventure eigentlich ein Witz.
